Reviews.Title: “Nice on the surface, but beware....”
Reviews.Author: BarcaBloke
Reviews.Content: The good: reception area big and airy, bed very comfortable, fast free wifi. The not so good: style and design (actually very weird design ideas) on a budget means that it looks good on the surface but scratch away a bit and it's tired and in some places a bit grubby. For example, the shower head does not have self cleaning heads and is semi-permanently fixed to the pipe so does not get cleaned: result, blocked nozzles and a dribble of a shower. The bad: well, here's my mail to Radisson. I am waiting for a reply: "I've stayed in 3 Radisson Blu hotels in the last 2 months. This one really disappointed. For EUR 175 I do not expect to be woken up at 4.30am to find that my window (poor sound insulation) is no more than 50m from two levels of the train tracks into the nearby main station. Train noises, tooting horns and loudspeaker announcements kept me awake the rest of the night. I commented to reception at check out, who said that the hotel was full which is why I had been given that room, then said that i should have asked to be changed room - at 4.30 in the morning?? Which also begs the question how to change room if the hotel is full? I was offered no further apology nor offered any compensation nor invited to speak to someone senior. Poor value and poor service. Whatever happened to the Carlsson 100% satisfaction guarantee? I await your comments." 5 star this is not!! Stay here only if guaranteed an inside facing room. Awarded three stars only because I imagine the inside rooms are better for noise.

Reviews.Title: “Under Radisson's quality standards”
Reviews.Author: efami45
Reviews.Content: - The hotel was close to train station, so easy to get somewhere using public transports or reach the airport. - The hotel seems to be a design high standard in the past, but it looks that it has not been maintained. Bathroom tubes are damages, some lamps does not work, wall paints are getting too old. This hotel should really invest in renovation as they did for the last floor where you can see the swimming pool. This hotel is unfortunately under other Radisson's quality standards. - The breakfast had a very large range of choice, but quality is very bad. For example, egg were cold, bacon not cooked, italian pastries with not taste ... - For a last drink, the bar propose very nice range of cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you don't mind walking”
Reviews.Author: onthepiste
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location for the train station so from the plane to the train and to the hotel was only just over an hour, so it is perfect for this. The hotel is exceptionally clean and although I went in March the outdoor pool was not in use it looked very appealing for a hot summers day and in the city this could be a blessing. The breakfast was good but don't go for the full option it didn't seem worth it. Importantly - what about location to the main sights,this hotel isn't near any of the main tourist attractions however it isn't that far away if you want a walk, I would walk out in the morning and back in the afternoon before going out again in the evening, all city breaks involve walking so this wasn't a problem. The cost of the hotel outweighed having to walk into the central area. Overall good value, modern hotel, not central but it's Rome and to walk through the streets of Rome is part of the holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay too much, don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Traveller25351
Reviews.Content: We risked the hotel despite adverse reviews because it was offered at a very cheap price for the week before Easter. We found it reasonable with comfortable beds. The advantage of the train station location is that the local restaurants (at the end of the road) are real local restaurants offering excellent food, often home made, used by locals at good local prices. The facilities weren't at all bad and we enjoyed sitting by the rooftop pool drinking tea or beer. But the base design was flawed - I think the designer tried to serve up basic and low quality as minimalist. Melamine covered chipboard for the door surrounds oozes low quality. Reminiscent of the white-sprayed Formule 1 rooms but with ensuite. Fittings were loose and unrepaired. Bath surround worn, bath ceiling starting to show signs of mould. But for a four day stay it was tolerable and proved a good base, with easy city and airport access. Think 2/3 star with upgraded facilities. Do not use this as a 5 star hotel to impress a loved one with a classy stay. But you will need to spend more for this.

Reviews.Title: “OK IF YOU LIKE TRAINS”
Reviews.Author: jackbuny
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for 2 nights the hotel is very modern and clean , the bed was very comfortable ,but it takes a while to figure out how to turn on the lights in the room ,everything is centralized and the water taps in the shower were somewhat confusing., a bit too high-tec for my liking. the breakfast was great and they make good cappuchino , but beware !! make sure you dont get a room on the side of the hotel which looks out on to 'roma termini' romes central train station , the noise level is terrible and the tanoy system can be heared all day long and at night ,absolutly annoying. the trains work from 5 oclock in the morning until midnight and if you have a room on this side of the hotel ,sleep is minimal . so dont say you havn't been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: JulesWarwick
Reviews.Content: This could have been a fun and quirky modern hotel in a great location at a reasonable price. But, instead it was a mouldy, plasticky, plug-socket-hanging-out-of-the-wall room that has put us off the whole hotel chain. The design looked great, but the cracked bathtub with excessive mould, the dangerous looking plug sockets and clanking bed showed the emphasis was on how the room looked when it was (recently) refurbished but not on how it would suffer the wear and tear of guests. Plus, wifi did not work in our room, but was free.

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else.......”
Reviews.Author: MichaelKoch66
Reviews.Content: I usually am not overly tough on my reviews, but think I must in this case. I came to the hotel late, and the desk staff was cordial. I went to my room then the Zest bar on the roof for a late drink prior to bed. It took about 15 minutes to get an order in with only two other people there. I went to bed and woke up at 4 am to the sound of the neighboring train station and the platform recordings. Shame on me for not doing my homework prior to going, and shame on the door staff for putting me in a room facing the train station when the hotel was half booked . The check out staff was fine, the concierge was fine, but the food at the breakfast bar was cold. The eggs were cold, the coffee was lukewarm, and the experience a bad one. I hope they get better fast as this hotel is not up to Radison standards.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel , good location , best staff.”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_Traveller_fam
Reviews.Content: Had a very good experience with this hotel, wish we could stay more, great room, location couldnt be more handy.

Reviews.Title: “As others have said,, certainly not 5 Stars!!”
Reviews.Author: Stuart D
Reviews.Content: We were initially given a room on the 5th floor. We entered the room to find a eavily stained carpet, terrible/loose fittings, scratched finishings on everything and a loose non-functioning window handle. But 5 stars does get you a clean bed! We went down to reception and were assertive with them that this room was not up to standard and we were moved to another room. To be honest the woman at reception seemed to expect us to complain about the room. We were told we would be given a free upgrade to a junior-suite but that it would take several hours (no problem it was early afternoon). I believe we were actually upgraded to a queen-suite (3rd floor). This room was much larger with a wooden floor, an exercise bike, jacuzzi,,, sounds great. Except for the fact that once again most of the fittings were loose, lightbulbs not working, the electrical devices seemed temperamental (for example the electronics lowering the blinds, which was essential for any privacy in the shower/bath area. Quick notes on other things: Ignore my ratings on Spa/breakfast as we didn't use these. Both rooms we were given were air conditioned. We slept well in the hotel. The hotel location is very good, right next to the main train station. This hotel could be so much better if they maintained the rooms to a reasonable standard. It probably was 4 stars when everyhting was new, but the lack of maintenance has ruined it. My advice, avoid this hotel and find one nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking service.”
Reviews.Author: epicureglasgow
Reviews.Content: We attended the Zest Bar of the Radisson Blu for pre dinner drinks on the terrace. We ordered a bottle of (mediocre) Chianti and two glasses of water. Twenty minutes later the wine arrived, and was dribbled (some of it over the table) by the waiter. We were then completely ignored for the hour and fifteen minutes it took us to finish the wine until we decided to leave. Still no sign of the waters, the ashtray unemptied, and no check back by any of the staff to see if we required anything else. We even had to go up to the bar to ask to pay. 35 Euros for poor quality wine. It took 3 attempts for a waiter and a waitress to process the card through the machine, with no apology for the delay. Style over function.............avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Niki_0921
Reviews.Content: This was my first international travel experience ever, so I was unsure what to expect. I was with a large group attending an international speech/debate competition. We spent 7 nights in the Radisson in Rome and to be honest, it wasn't terrible. The staff does make up for the odd layout of the property and rooms. The breakfast each morning was pretty good, and I fell head over heels in love with the cappuccino maker! But the rooms need attention. There was an odd smell coming from the sheets of the beds. The toilet could use some lovin, and the the shower/glass box thing needed to be cleaned and repainted. But the location of the hotel is so convenient! It didn't take long to navigate the neighborhood well, and they're really close to the major sites like the Colosseum and Trevi Fountain. But overall, Americans need to just lower their standards when traveling to Italy. European hotels can't all be compared to American hotels. Good food, hot water (with good water pressure in the shower), and an attentive staff that wants to help you is all you really need. Besides, I spent only about 8-10 hours in the room for sleeping n getting ready, while the rest of the day was spent exploring the city, so there's not much room for complaint. Ignore the minor details and have a great time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, average stay”
Reviews.Author: Ketiljt
Reviews.Content: The room was stylish. A little bit noisy due to traffic, but hey it's Rome. Location ok next to railway station. Breakfast was not ok, bread(!) and eggs missing.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is not ospital”
Reviews.Author: tommaso r Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff is not ospital , The breakfast cost 27€!!! Is nice The structure and The swimming pool on 7floor

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the Radisson Standard”
Reviews.Author: awtk
Reviews.Content: It is interesting looking at the reviews of this hotel and now I can see why the hotel does not offer customer comment cards. We were visiting Rome for only 2 days for the Rome Marathon. The hotel was very convenient so that is why we chose the Radisson. I called ahead to as for a roll away bed for the room as our daughter was joining us for the weekend. First of all let me explain that our booking was done through the Radisson Reward centre. When I called the hotel, the clerk said that we didin't have a reservation. After persisting he finally found it spelled incorrectly. I thought that the clerk understood about the extra bed and was happy everything was in place. When we arrived, we had the clerk I had spoken to so I thought everything was going smoothly until he informed me that they could put a crib in the room but not a bed (our daughter is 23) he hummed had hawed and finally said we would have to get a different room. Okay, so move us to a room that could accomodate the extra bed or put us in one with 2 doubles. I said okay to the change and he needed to reswipe our credit card for the upgrade. He took the credit card and tried to put it through then announced to the world that the card was declined. (he had forgotten to let us put our pin number in. After straightening out the card issue he handed us 1 key card, in my confusion I asked for 2 and he told me I already had two for the other room. Oh no.....we needed to get a seperate room for our daughter. The rooms are the craziest rooms I have ever seen. In the middle of the room was a platform with the bed facing the window and also on the platform was a shower only large enough to clean a bean pole. the wash basin was right behind the headboard on the left of the platform and a hanging rack on the right. The bathroom had its own enclosure but the trick was to find the lighting. Eventually we found it on the outside of a random door. hslf the light fixtures didn't work and neither did the blackout curtain. We had a light that had a large sac over it and when you turned it on the sac filled with air to this big balloon. The hallways and the rooms were well used and required much updating. I don't believe that this hotel can call themselves even a 2 star. Beware!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay if you like being woken up by trains at 6am”
Reviews.Author: Tachiba
Reviews.Content: On arrival the Radisson put us in a different hotel which wasnt up to the same standards. Service at Radisson was good but cleanliness was ok but there was no attention to detail; the curtains dont shut out the light in the room and we were facing the train station therefore very early mornings for us.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and downs...you get what you pay for I suppose..watch out bad area....”
Reviews.Author: TravellingGGDr
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is ok. Our shower was quite moldy with paint peeling but otherwise was fine. The pretty clear glass door to the toilet that pretty much allowed you to see what the person was doing in there was somewhat disconcerting too. However the breakfast was great and the staff friendly. We used it as a handy base for our sight seeing. The downside was the location - there appeared to be some sort of homeless shelter or something over the road and there always seemed to be people drinking outside the hotel. The people can be somewhat aggressive when walking past and i generally felt very unsafe wondering around. I wouldn't have gone out on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel destroyed, good service, poor breakfast, not 5 * or 4 *”
Reviews.Author: luk_sz66
Reviews.Content: Rooms very neglected, leaking shower, non-functioning air conditioning, loudly. Breakfast very poor. But for a good service, great location. Nevertheless, I recommend

Reviews.Title: “need some heavy maintenance”
Reviews.Author: rabat2011
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very close to the Termini station, but in the wrost area around it. The rooms have a nice design but now are really dated and you can see from many different detail, sometimes not so small. The staff is very friendly and efficient. At the end the value for money of this hotel is very low and i do believe I'll not suggest to anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Has been so called design hotel in desperate need of refurbishment. But I don't think their owners care..”
Reviews.Author: adrianelvn
Reviews.Content: To keep it brief, it was inexpensive (Internet deal), close the Rome Termini and run by, mostly, friendly staff. But the design is a train wreck (what's with the inflatable everything..??). But I can accept bad design if it's good value sometimes, but..... The room was INCREDIBLY hot , with no way of cooling it down (" the air conditioning isnt turned on sir"), the mini bar, turned off (ie, fridge filled with HOT drinks), the bathroom shower/ bathtub was disgusting: different paint types and colors, corrosion, stains on the walls, toilet oozing some strange oil/gel). I won't continue, but you get the idea. I'm a bit of an expert too (I write about hotels for well known magazines in the UK and US..). Shame Radisson doesn't seem to have any international standards or control over their properties..

Reviews.Title: “very nice staff but under the Radisson standards”
Reviews.Author: Patricia G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near Termini Rail Station, and near an areea full of Chinese stores, not a plus. It is at a walking distance from the main visiting points in Rome, but Roma's turistical area is not that big. The staff was very fiendly and nice, especially at the Reception Desk. The rooms were the biggest dissapointment. Small rooms, which urgentlly need refurnishing and painting. The design of the rooms gives no privacy at all. The bathroom in the middle of the room might feel like modern design, but is very unconfortable. I would not rate this hotel with more then 3 stars. Although we went there in February, it was very hot in the rooms, and AC was not working. When asked how to cool down the temperature in the room, we were told that the only solution was to open the windows.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandHaggis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between 17th - 20th feb and had a great time with our friends . The hotel is very modern and spotless ,the rooms were unique in style, the staff were very friendly and very helpful, especially sonia at reception and viola the bar maid . One of our group had his birthday while we were there and the hotel gave him a card and champagne (nice touch). Some reviews have said the hotel has nothing around it , we found lots of restaurants and bars within a 5 -10 minute walk or 5 minutes by taxi. The only down side for some of my friends was their rooms were on the same side as the train station where trains run all night . but i am sure if they wanted a change of room it would not have been a problem. If you are not bothered about walking to bars, etc then this hotel does the trick .

Reviews.Title: “Strange rooms and not brilliant but convenient location”
Reviews.Author: traveller112233
Reviews.Content: I understand the hotel is new and design led, however, if you are not a couple, the rooms in this hotel are not really for you. There is very little privacy. The shower and sink are behind a glass screen behind the bed and the toilet has frosted glass doors which aren't exactly private!! The location is very convenient but not the prettiest. It's right next to the train station and is convenient to walk to most of the sights. Rome is THE most expensive place I have ever visited though and for this reason I wouldn't return. I knew it wouldn't be cheap but one meal of 2 starters, 2 pastas and 2 cokes in a local restaurant was €84!!! And it wasn't even that nice! The lady who runs the spa at the hotel is lovely and she gives one of the best massages I have had! The jacuzzi on the top floor also has lovely views.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: Stockholm1572371
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ideal when in Rome during summer. The rooms are nice, especially if you are travelling with your partner. The pool is the best, however during weekends it can get crowded. Since people can who are not stating at the hotel pay 50 EUR to use it. I heard people complain about the loaction, I may not be the must upscale area. But 5-10 minute walk and your in main Rome. If you cross the railwaystation you will find lots of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Sort this out.”
Reviews.Author: travrobsi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for few days last summer. Hotel definitely very tired and need refurbishment right now. This is only 3star but need to be back to 5star Radisson world class. Service was very good. Love it the spa and swimming pool and breakfast good quality as well. But please change your rooms as soon as possible they are tired and terrible disagned. Love Radisson ...but this is not 5star hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Full frontal rip-off”
Reviews.Author: Breker
Reviews.Content: Rome was a sumptuous feast, the real thing, but the Radisson Blu hotel was an outrageous fake! 5-star? Whoever decides these star ratings ought to be made to stay there as penance!! Our room was small, mean, pinched, dog-eared, mouldy, tatty, cheap, nasty and downright uncomfortable. Finishes were so minimalist as to hardly exist – in fact there was no kettle, no comfy chair, no real wardrobe, no bath, poor lighting, few plugs and no toiletries on our first night. Shower and toilet room faced the bed which was two steps away – I was uncomfortable taking a crap with my dear wife resting so close by. Wet room shower sprayed uncontrollably, liberally wetting the floor, toilet and toilet paper. We only endured two nights, but the memory of wasted euros and rip off remains. Special offer? The perfume of the discount cannot disguise the odour of the offering.

Reviews.Title: “A "Curate's Egg" of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolynUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a "curate's egg" for us in that it was "good in parts!" The good staff - helpful and friendly room - large and comfortable amenities - fabulous breakfast - excellent The bad Dining room staff haphazard - we asked to take dinner in the bar/ snack bar but were ushered in to the a la carte area, and we were shown to what looked like an empty table at breakfast - and settled in to eat our food - only to be accosted by a rude Scottish woman claiming that she had been allocated the table by another staff member.... and indeed had placed a couple of postcards and a room key behind the floral arrangements before vanishing for at least 10-15 minutes. Lots of broken furniture in public areas Location - whilst I didn't feel particularly unsafe, it really isn't the nicest location for a 5 star hotel. We booked the hotel as part of a British Airways holiday and chose it because it was a central location, 5 star and offered free breakfast. I think we did get good value for money and the reception staff were very helpful in telling us how to reach various sights

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for low budget luxury”
Reviews.Author: Nir S
Reviews.Content: Hi, I had a meeting in Rome 2 weeks ago, I've arrived with an evening flight to Rome and the next day I had my meeting and just after the meeting I had to have another good night sleep before my next flight. So I had 1 day and 2 nights in Rome, i booked the Radisson Es because its next to the train station, not as close that I tought but about 5 minutes walk, so the location for me was more than perfect. for people that would like to accomodate at a hotel that is close to nightlife area its totally not a good hotel and approx. 10 Euro by taxi + 10 Euro back,. But the Radisson is a great hotel - the service and also the SPA and the modern design - PERFECT!!! so its a very recomanded hotel except its location witch was perfect for my needs!

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: twinkletod
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this hotel for new year. We were pretty impressed by the website, very shiny. In reality this hotel is in a worrisome location, is SOOO noisy (get a room on the internal side if you go) I was awake from 4am (noise like people in the room/construction).. take earplugs. And then we had to negotiate with the cleaner not to clean our room at 8am! She really wanted to! The room was supposed to be a suite, it was just some small beds in a normal sized room. It was a little tired. Lights didn't work.. the minibar contents were incorrect. The restaurant appeared to be on a different floor to the kitchen, so the lifts smelled of fried fish. Sorry, but I wouldn't stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Bad maintenance, low quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mike_P777
Reviews.Content: The reception and the lobby is nice, all the rest not really. The shower is just behind the bed in the same room separated by curtain only (room 316). Of course if usualy bath walls can be sanitized after each guest, this is not the case with the curtain. Also the fact bath room is same with bed room causing it to be humid after the shower. Holes in carton's walls, dirty curtains. The maintanace of the rooms are very poor (see photos). Request to change the room wasn't respected. Additional word should be said about the "Fitness center", it is located next door to the whirlpool, very small and poorly ventilated with old equipment. The humidity in the fitness room, because of common ventilation with the wirpool was extrimely high, and due to small size of the room also very hot. Strong odor of chlor came from the whirlpool also didn't contributed for a good feeling in the fitness room, no drining water was found in the room, you needed to go to the room with the whirlpool for it.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Weekend...”
Reviews.Author: elaxton
Reviews.Content: No very impressed with the Hotel. My boyfriend booked it as romantic break away and he was very disappointed with Hotel for the Price he paid. Reception were ok, Champagne he had pre ordered was not in the room so runied a surprise. The room was very modern, and when things were broken you could see they could not replace it fix it properly. The room was small and when we asked if we coudl upgrade were told 'no ask tomorrow'. Breakfast was included however it wasn’t the best, we went down each morning at different times and they had run out of different things each day. Location was good, we were only a 10 minute walk from the Coliseum and 5minutes from the train and bus station for an easy pick/drop off to the airport. Some of the staff didn’t even have very good knowledge of the area and the main sights. They did have BBC news and all the amenities in the room you could require. I can’t complain, I had a lovely weekend. However my Boyfriend wasn’t so pleased!

Reviews.Title: “For Business”
Reviews.Author: Drappo74
Reviews.Content: I have been four times in the past months in this hotel, using different rooms. The hotel would be a "design hotel" but probably the furniture were not as good as promised during last renovation and cleaning is nothing exceptional. In the room with bath tube there is a lot of lime and rust and take a bath in that stuff is not the best experience i have ever tried. Apart these things, the position is good if you need to stay in the city center and if you reach Rome by train (the station is just passed the street).

Reviews.Title: “I don't ask for much, just a comfortable room to sleep in...”
Reviews.Author: A K
Reviews.Content: I don't demand excellence. Weather if's a business trip or a holiday, I like comfy places, where one can relax after a hard days work or exploring the city. I like a chair, a comfortable one, so I can sit in it when I get back, not an ultra-modern weirdly-shaped bench that I can neither work or relax on. I like a wardrobe for my clothes, not a rack right in front of the mirror, so when I hang my clothes on it I can no longer see my reflection. I like a bath, or at least a shower at the end of the day, preferably not in the middle of the room, and certainly with the curtain that goes ALL the way around, not leaving a 6 inch gap and therefore having my floor wet all over. I like a window that I can open, the reception is made of cloth... and I really don't want to go any further. Basically, if you have a choice - stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Unconventional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arturs80
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with group of friends using Eurobonus points. 1) Location Location is safe enough to walk during the night however it is quite ugly since hotel is right behind the Termini railway station which means that during the day it is ok but during the night you will see lots of homeless people sleeping on the surrounding streets. 2) Room (425) Room has Hi-tech design of 90th which is interesting for a change however it seems that rooms have not been renovated since opening of the hotel. Walls have dirty stains, some lamps and light bulbs are missing... Shower is in the middle of the room and toilet has glass walls so if you stay with your wife, girlfriend or good friend it might be ok, but you will not feel comfortable to see your mother or sister taking a shower or using a toilet... 3) Breakfast & rooftop terrace This Radisson has the best breakfast I have had in Italy. Choice and quality is excellent! Besides view of the city and outside swimming pool makes is an unforgettable experience. 4) Slow check in and check out 5) Taxi There are no Taxis available at the hotel and its not easy to get one in Rome. You must walk to the Railway station to get one and wait a long time or take an illegal taxi which charges double price but available on request. There are lots of illegal taxi drivers offering their services next to the empty Taxi stands.

Reviews.Title: “Very hip, great location”
Reviews.Author: vj011
Reviews.Content: The room is nice, clean, and very hip. As others reviewers mentioned, the bathroom is within the room, separated by a glass. Interesting concept. The buffet breakfast is at the top floor, with great views of the city, and big outdoor pool. The hotel is walking distance to the Termini station, from where you can take direct train to the FCO airport. Lowlights: pretty small gym, with only free weights for the resistance training. There are no machines, except for cardio (treadmil, eliptical, stair master...)

Reviews.Title: “nice modern hotel,close to the station”
Reviews.Author: AndrF
Reviews.Content: the hotel is what you expect from any business hotel: service is very good, staff professional. The location is very good if you want to stay close to the railway station, but the place itself is not nice at all. If you are travelling for business this hotel is fine, but if you are looking for the real "Rome" flavor, than this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: Bulldog512
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel, decent location and great service. The rooms were nice the only thing that threw me for a loop was being able to see into the bathroom so make sure you are very comfortable with whomever you are staying with.

Reviews.Title: “Super glitzy modern hotel near Rome's train station”
Reviews.Author: njrsf
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blu is space age elegant. The lobby is clean, spare and high tech The upstairs Outdoor pool has a teak deck and chaise longues occupied by bronzed, sun glassed Euro trash types. Probably the only people who are happy to pay 35 euros for a gin and tonic and sandwich at the outdoor bar. But the room was worth the tariff. Where else would I find a "shower in the round" in the middle of the bedroom?

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Blu Rome dont do it to yourself”
Reviews.Author: thanksmate
Reviews.Content: My family has just spent 9 weeks in Europe and we decided to stay mainly in Radisson Blu Hotels, getting 3 rooms where ever we went The ROME Radisson Blu is a standout of poor service and poor quality. we do a lot of traveling, and the other Radisson Blu hotels, were very good (except Paris see my other review) however Rome Italy was a disaster. meals that took 1 hour to arrive , was cold and 45 minutes after the main meal arrives the side dish arrives.! Rooms that smell, Internet thats slow and unreliable, staff that simply dont speak great english and dont really care. Items in the room broken, and no coffee making facility in 2 of the rooms. Do yourself a BIG favor and don't put yourself through it. This is not our first visit to Europe and will not be our last I hope, however will be our last to Radisson Blu Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Sparse, minimalist, more functional than useful”
Reviews.Author: Travel_beatch
Reviews.Content: Whilst the location is useful (near the station) you get what that entails. Noisy, dodgy streets and drunks serenading you awake from about 4am. The rooms are minimalist containing the bare minimum required, much like student accommodation and the bathroom is a bit exposed. If you didn't know your travel mate well before this experience you certainly will after! The decor is not to my taste, I prefer a good ole carpet and the usual lamp shade configuration. The burlap flooring and old granny bloomers on the lights were a bit odd. I understand the rooms were designed by someone famous....... The front of house staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The one upside to staying here. Overall value for money wasn't there. For the amount paid I didn't feel I got a lot. If you like your hotel a bit contemporary then this is for you. Is you like a bit of comfy and luxurious then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but disaster in the interior design !”
Reviews.Author: HKTraveller2009
Reviews.Content: Good location as being next to the Roma Termini but it's located at the far tips of the station which is around 10 mins walk from the main front entrance The area is safe as it's just right opposite the train platform to the airport and a small supermarket "Spa" is just cross the road. Let's talk about the hotel. Having stayed here for 5 nights over Christmas, I think the hotel location is average although being located next to the termini seems convenience but it's a very long boring walk when you need to walk back everynight along all the same boring platforms. The shops outside is just some vey cheap snack bar which I would not walk in as there are plenty of good local cafe and bar in the neighbourhood.. The hotel has a good mini gym by European standard with a few cardio machines and some free weights. The hotel itself is supposed to be a hip hotel with tasteful design, however the whole design is a disaster which did not take into the consideration for traveller's needs. Due to the lack of maintenance, everythings seem falling apart ! There is no proper coffee table or desk for use in the room. There is a very awkward design bench with uncomfortable seat! There is no sofa or any proper comfortable seats inside the room. The bathroom has the worst design among the hundred of hotels I have visited. I will only give a 3 stars if it has no gym or pool. The open bathroom has the worst design overall and the edge is very dirty. All bedside reading lights are broken and the bed is shaking! I did not try the restaurant in the hotel as there are plenty of local restaurants outside. I would recommend to walk a bit further into Cavour or Via Cernar areas to avoid the tourist restaurants. Although many past reviews say the hotel area is not safe as the neighbourhood is mostly occupied by foreign immigrants, but I find it OK. Just because you see many black and Asian people there doesn't mean it's a a crime area ! Overall, i would not recommend anyone to use this hotel unless they charge the usual off peak rates. Otherwise, i would prefer to stay in other roman style family run hotels which seems to be better managed with the warm roman hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: mptranslations
Reviews.Content: Cool rooms designed by Philippe Stark (?). Great service by friendly staff. Breakfast very good on the top floor next to the fabulous pool area. Located in central Rome close to the not- so- exciting Central Station. Would recommend travel Oct.-April due to weather and crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience in a 4/5 stars hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pmm70
Reviews.Content: The shower is in the middle of the room, no privacy at all; the room was dirty; the location is a ... Parking building transformed in a "5" stars hotel; the area itself is dirt; verry bad experience

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ven_mumbai
Reviews.Content: We had an extremely disappointing stay at the Radisson Blu in May 2011. It was a let-down from the word go - the hotel had a nondescript lobby; nobody bothered to even offer to help us with the bags. In our entire six-day stay at the hotel, not once did any of the staff bother to even offer to help us with any bags. The rooms were a bigger let-down. There were no wardrobes or space to keep any suitcases. The bed unit had a weird curved design which ensured that there was little space to keep your book or watch; keeping it anywhere else in the unit would cause it to slide down! The neighbourhood also did not inspire confidence - we were accosted by dubious characters a couple of times when we were walking back to the room at night. There were a couple of briight spots in an otherwise disappointing trip - a couple of the staff at the restaurant were helpful in accommodating our special meal requirements. Also the hotel is close to Termini station, so that helped. But these did not outweigh the overwhelming negatives.

Reviews.Title: “great view and good for conference”
Reviews.Author: econokal
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located near the central station and bus station so transport to the hotel is adequate although taxi still took a chance to try cheat us on arrival nevertheless, rooms are quiet and nights silent as did not hear trains rooms adequate and bathrooms need revamp ( frosted glass bath enclosure in middle of room!) breakfasts nice with great view over Rome from the deck top and adequate array of food and fruit, coffee a letdown as expected delicious cappucinos! hotel decor contemporary and clean

Reviews.Title: “Just plain awful”
Reviews.Author: Big-Guy-Abroad
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for my honeymoon after seeing its advertised 5* rating. I wish I'd read more TripAdvisor reviews before booking. It clearly has 5* aspirations, certainly charges 5* prices, but fails to deliver in all areas including the basics. I was drawn by the 7th floor pool with views of Rome it advertised. Well let me tell you now, this is far from the idyllic panorama of terracotta wonderment I'd envisioned. The east and west views were walled off, the Southern view was of blank walls, satellite dishes, cables and tv ariels, nothing even remotely pretty, let alone historical. And the northern view was the rail hub with approx 14 sets of train tracks terminating there. The squeals from the constant influx of trains were the closest we got on that rooftop to ambient noise. Ever the optimist, I was determined to find the silver lining, if not just for the sake of happy honeymoon memories with my newly betrothed. However, I was shot down at almost every turn. The swimming pool was surrounded (and I do mean completely encircled) with ants. The two poolside ladders providing access to the water were on the point of collapse, one had red and white tape wrapped around the handles, but nothing to prevent its use, certainly no other obvious warning or sign of prohibition. The water was freezing cold, though I tried to convince myself it was bracingly refreshing. After swimming one length I realised the interior walls were covered in dirt and scum. I managed to dissuade my wife from jumping in just in time. The first bedroom we were issued (not shown to), despite booking as newlyweds, had twin single beds. While I considered pushing the beds together, the mrs went to freshen up, only the bathroom light wouldn't turn on. It was a modern touch-panel lightswitch, only the touch panel was so encrusted in dried gunk that it didn't register anyone was touching it. I sought refuge within the cheerful pamphlet by the phone which read "100% satisfaction guarantee" I called down to change rooms. With a 5* hotel booking I'd originally assumed a standard room would suffice, this clearly wasn't the case, so being on honeymoon I decided to upgrade to a jr suite. No apology was made for the condition of the original room and a full upgrade fee was charged. However the service I received was prompt and a porter even helped with our bags to move us to another floor. The Jr suite was much larger and appeared clean, so we thanked the porter and we settled in. The modern interior that I'd seen pictures of prior to booking appeared a bit cheaper and a little tacky in real life, but it was what I'd booked, so we went with it. What I wasn't prepared for though, was just how transparent the bathroom wall and door would be. Naïvely I had imagined the opaque glass would be misted enough to shield toilet procedures from the rest of the room. Not so in the Radisson Blu Rome, it appears they wanted me to share the experience. On closer inspection the waterproof edging from showers was coming away, scum was left on the shower floor, layers of dust had built up on the air-conditioning grates where the wall joined the ceiling and the grates themselves looked like they were about to fall down. The array of light switches and master switches all over the room needed an Enigma code cracker to make sense of, the 3" thick headboard wobbled and when tilted you could see a build up of gunk and matted hair underneath. Every window in our room had a dusting of brown dirt on the outside making photographs of the view impossible to take. On our second night, when we moved a chez-long, it revealed a gnarly, ripped big toenail in the rug underneath. The small gym, hot-tub and relaxation area with granite showers were the only parts of the hotel we found any solace in. And that's only because we went at night when no-one else was there, so it felt like a private spa just for the two of us. Staff were friendly enough, but they seemed completely unaware that their services were any less than the absolute highest quality. On checking out I realised we had been charged for breakfast both mornings despite booking the no breakfast option and not dining in the hotel at all. This took almost an hour and the last of my patience to rectify. Finally, the location of the hotel is very good for rail links, however the surrounding streets are dirty. Not just city living dirty, that I can handle, I mean DIRTY! Urinated on walls, poor lighting at night, I even found a hyperdermic needle on the ground less than 50m from the hotel door. In short, DO NOT STAY HERE. Not at this price. Not at any price. You'd be better of honeymooning in a 2* hostel with dormitory-style rooms and bunk beds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Robinson_kruse
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooftop and Greta breakfast, rome is such a beautiful town during summer

Reviews.Title: “Not for Everyone”
Reviews.Author: rw939
Reviews.Content: I just spent 3 nights in a business class room on the 6th floor overlooking the front of the hotel. I was traveling alone and using Termini station every day. Other than eating one snack in the restaurant, I made no use of any hotel amenities -- it was a base of operations & place to sleep. That said: Pros: Proximity to Termini Station. Pleasant room for one person. Bed and linens were just fine. Quiet. Free Wi-Fi. TV OK. Cons: Sketchy neighborhood after dark. No closet and limited space for hanging clothes. Conclusion: It was great for my situation - a solo traveler, wanting easy access to Termini. I wouldn't recommend it for a family - except maybe if you wanted to be near Termini on the first or last night of a trip -- great for that. I wouldn't choose it for a romantic stay either. Given the limited space, it could be hard w/a high maintenance companion. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “,.great hotel for a lovely city break in Rome.,”
Reviews.Author: LRobbie
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 fantastic days in Rome. The hotel was nerby to Roma Termini. We re warmly welcomed by the staff at the front desk, they informed us about all facilities of the hotel and gave important informations what we liked to know about public transportation, sightseeing etc.. Room was great, design furnished and comfortable. Breakfast just amazing, extremely friendly staff and well selected fresh products. Breakfast room with huge terrace on the roof.,, We really enjoyed. Rooms are perfect cleaned. I was surprised to reading comments below?! Is it a same hotel? I would go back for sure.,

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: MsJEM
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was in a shady area (although it was close to the trainatation/subway which was nice at times). The room was horrible! The shower was in the very center of the room on a wooden platform next to the bed. The entire room got steamy when you showered and the round shower curtain didn't close all the way so the floor was wet and slippery. Thank goodness I got a deal on this because I knew someone who worked there. I would have been even more anyry if I paid full price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: CSEYates
Reviews.Content: I was perhaps a bit naive on this one: I got a deal for half price on a (so called) 5 star hotel and thought I couldn't go wrong. Big mistake. On arrival we were alarmed to see tramps right outside the hotel, drinking. Okay if it's a 2 star hotel - it's sort of what you expect - but this is 5 stars! Next, the room: Air-con didn't work and the sun was blazing in, I tried to close the blackout blinds, they were ripped. Tried to run a bath, water came out almost black (not just a little discoloured, I mean like mud). When we complained we were told to just keep running the water and it should eventually come clean. Two hours (and a couple of scrubbed baths) later the water still looked like nothing I would choose to bathe in, and then we discovered the bugs. Not just one or two, but loads of them, skittering around the place. This was the final straw and my husband went to complain. To the hotel's credit, we were moved, but by this time, we'd wasted our first night in Rome just trying to take a bath. It wasn't exactly how I'd imagined it. The second room was better in that the blinds worked, but the bugs were still around, though this time dead in the water of the Nespresso machine. We decided against coffee. My advice would be to do yourself a favour and look for a nice, independent hotel in a good area of Rome. Ignore the Radisson brand, the swimming pool, the 5 star rating and go somewhere where you won't be sharing a room with insects and entering into Rome's underworld every time you set foot out of the door at night.

Reviews.Title: “Take some self defence and a plumbling kit with you”
Reviews.Author: Trampilot
Reviews.Content: The shower came out of a hole in the ceiling rather than a head. The restaurant was always fully booked for a function. The bar was moved to a conference room. The streets are dark and have gangs of youths hanging around outside. Exposed wires under the bed - where the shower was leaking! Air Con didn't work. "hi-tec gym" was three machines in a very small room. 5 Star hotel? Do not use this hotel unless ... well read the title.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Afrikat
Reviews.Content: After I booked into this hotel I saw some of the review on this site and was very worried about what to expect. However we were pleasantly surprised once we arrived. You can get a very cheap (4 euro) bus from the airport to the Termini which is a few minutes walk from the hotel which makes it convenient for travel and we walked from the hotel every day to the main attractions. I would say I wouldn't want to walk home late at night as a single female but that would be true of any hotel not directly in the centre of all the action. The staff were all extremely friendly and offered some good advice about local restaurants etc. There is definitely a sense of style over substance with the way the hotel has been designed however. The lights were very difficult to work out - and it was easy to accidentally knock all the lights on when trying to get to the bathroom in the night. The 'bedside tables' had a slope on them that meant you could easily send your glass of water sailing over to the other side of the room and our air con was broken. The layout also means that the room would be no good for friends travelling together unless they are happy to bare all - the toilet is just about private but the rest of the bathroom is just open to the room. However there was a great coffee machine, a nice balcony for a bit of fresh air, a super comfy bed, enough space for our clothes etc and the breakfast offering was the best I have ever seen. I am sure there are nicer places in Rome that are more centrally located but the Radisson was perfectly fine and we had a great trip

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was perfect”
Reviews.Author: pjd1972
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Blu for a weekend at the end of October. The hotel is very near to Termini train station which is really handy for for arriving in Rome by either train or coaches from either airport. Checked into the Radisson at 11am, our room wasn't ready so the staff kindly looked after our luggage whilst we went out and had a wonder around Rome. We returned to the hotel mid afternoon and our room was ready, we had been upgraded and had a wonderful balcony on the 5th floor, our room was fantastic, super king size comfy bed, reall, great bathroom, modern with shower and jacuzzi bath tub and not a hint of any problems that others have mentioned. The hotel is next to Termini station so you can hear announcements but were from London so a little noise didn't bother us what so ever. lights were easy to use so not sure what others mean when they say you cant work them! it was my wifes 40th birthday and the manager Andreas sent us a really nice bottle of sparkling wine which was a nice gesture and all the staff generally made us feel really welcome. The breakfasts were great and consisted of cereals pastries, cold meats, toast, eggs, bacon....generally something for everyone! The roof top swimming pool looked amazing but we were to busy checking out the sites to use it. The location isn't right next to the main attractions but its only 2 or 3 stops on the metro to the Coliseum on the Blue line and Spanish stepps/ Trevi fountain on the red line, both lines go from Termini and only costs 1 Euro which you have 75 mins to use, or just buy a Roma pass. Termini isn't the nicest location and major Train stations always attract there share of problems, there was a few undesirables walking about but no one bothered us, its pretty much like Euston/Kings cross if I was to compare it to London, One tip id give is to walk inside the station if coming back late at night, you can stay inside pretty much all the way down the road until your right near to the hotel. Theres a Spar across the street from the hotel so stock up, much cheaper than hotel prices:) All in all I'd come back to this hotel, I think they are slowly but surely renovating all the rooms, they probably need to reduce the rates until its finished but hotel prices in Rome are expensive anyway so... Had a great time, thanks to the the manager and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced and Staff that really can't be bothered!”
Reviews.Author: Georgina J
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and a friend booked a table at the Zest & Sette restaurant at this hotel after reading some positive reviews on the internet before we left the UK. We really wished that we had not bothered. After a day of travelling we were all really looking forward to starting our holiday with a quality meal in a quality hotel, how wrong could we be. The staff were very slow and we actually had to ask for bread and olives 3 times before we were actually served them. When ordering steak we were not even asked how we liked it cooked and although we ordered it medium rare it turned up blue!!! The fish course was cold and over seasoned and had to be taken back to the kitchen only for the same pice to be sent back reheated. The service was dreadful for a hotel with such a good reputation and I would never recommend it to anyone that I considered to be a friend!!! Very expensive and not worth a penny.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms to be re-done”
Reviews.Author: guymichaud
Reviews.Content: Rooms are in bad shape, specially bathroom! Breakfast very good compared to even some 5 Stars

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality for a reputable hotel chain”
Reviews.Author: Sdubuya
Reviews.Content: We book the trip through BA and thought Radisson 5 star you can't go wrong. Mistake!!! The rooms are a little quirky but I can live with that, but they are also very tired and in need of some refurbishment. The bath has a wood surround which has been painted orange. This paint has now started to peel off around the taps. The bath is also chipped which adds to the ambiance. I did complain to reception but the young lady just tutted and got the porter to show us another room which was equally as tatty. Also, don't share a room in this hotel unless you are at one with you fellow traveller as the bathroom is part of the bedroom and the toilet does not have a proper closing door. I have to agree with some of the reviews with regards to location, this hotel is not in a nice area and the front of the hotel is often used by skateboarders. The one thing that is definitely 5 star about this hotel is the bar €18 for two glasses of wine. But to finish on a positive note the breakfast was good with plenty of choice and the staff with the exception of the receptionist were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but average room”
Reviews.Author: MaveRic18
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the summer of 2009 for a week so apologies for the late review. Service - The Canadian guy at the reception was very helpful and friendly. Room - modern room with Nespresso machine and see thru shower...water pressure a bit weak for me. Location - very close to Termini station. On my last night - I complained about the loud noise coming from the suite next door to my room. They eventually relocated us to another room but this was a hassle. Tips - skip breakfast here and head to Termini as loads of cafe inside the massive station. I found the area can be bit "unsafe" to walk alone.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced and VERY bad location”
Reviews.Author: Cken1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was modern with nicely laid out rooms. The hotel staff were polite but not very accommodating in recommending restaurants. Also, rooms were very stuffy and air conditioning was not in operation. The cleaning staff also woke us every morning by knocking on our door from 8.30 onwards. It was extremely overpriced for the service we received and the location. It's quite a distance from the city's attractions and restaurants (it cost approx €30 each night on taxis as it's not safe to walk). On the plus side, the hotel was near the metro despite being in a dodgy part of town. If we were to visit Rome again we would definitely not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: alan r
Reviews.Content: Stayed fro 5 nights in October 2011. A very questionable area of Rome to have a hotel. I would not want to allow my family members to walk alone at night or alone. The reservation was made via Last Minute, with a large room with 2 double beds. When we arrived we had 1 double bed and were told that is what was ordered. The strange thing about the room was the bathroom was an integral part of the room, open bath at then end of the bed, no doors on the shower room and just no privacy at all. Clearly not suitable for our family. So the hotel came to the rescue with organising another triple room and the housekeeping people breaking every rule in the hotel by organising separate beds and the room with more private shower room and toilets, although each room had cloudy glass doors. The down side was that the room faced the railway and was quite noisy with the rail industry starting at 5:30 in the morning. They need better windows not the fancy designer layout that probably cost them a fortune. On the plus side the staff were pleasant, the rooftop bar staff were fantastic, and the housekeeping people went out of their way to sort us out. Overall not the 5* they claim.

Reviews.Title: “An ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: P0014
Reviews.Content: The design of the hotel is modern and impressive. The rooms are large with a sofa in it. We got the room with the bathtub right above our bed and the bathroom door is quite transparent so the room is more suitable for a couple than a father and a daughter sharing a room. My father accidentally pulled the bathroom emergency pull chain, I tried calling the operator to inform them that nothing was wrong, do not send someone up but the operator had trouble understanding and kept repeating that she will send the technician, after a while I decided to cut the conversation short by informing her to ignore my call. No one came to visit us that night so I'm not sure if the bathroom emergency system is working or not. My customer got the room with the teepee shower room in the middle of the room. He did not like it because it is too small that he felt he does not fit in and there are no place to put the accessories in the teepee. Therefore, I would recommend selecting the room with the bath tub. The rooms once closely looked are old. The lighting system is quite dim. I couldn't find the switches for some lighting but the fabric balloon that inflate when the light is on is amazing, love it! The hair dryer is provided beneath the sinks, there are shampoo, bathgel, soap, toothbrush, toothpaste and bathing salt provided. The coffee and tea are also provided on the working desk. The breakfast is ok. The rooms are quited despite its proximity to the train station. Free hi-speed wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “A little less then ok”
Reviews.Author: rio2012
Reviews.Content: The hotel wants to be a futurist one but the result is not something good. The room is small, the bathroom is in the middle of the room, the location is not good. The bed is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Poor design, combined with mixed service”
Reviews.Author: veedubmelb
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights here and found it a mixed experience. It's close to the main train station which can be a plus or minus (it was a plus for me as I arrived by train, but it's not a nice area so I probably wouldn't recommend it for, say, a lone female traveller or a family). As other reviews have noted, it isn't 5 star quality (more 3, maybe 4). The rooms have been got at by a modernist designer trying (but failing) to be clever, who has sacrificed style for substance. For example, the shower is in the room itself, built into the same basic structure as the bed. It looks kind of cool but I found it just plain weird, and more importantly, impractical. The flat rectangular box that forms the shower base naturally sinks ever so slightly with successive guests weighing it down, making the drain the -highest- point in the shower base - and you don't have to be Issac Newton to know that water won't flow uphill. Mine was also blocked on arrival, and still didn't drain well after maintenance attempted to fix it. I wouldn't have wanted to be sharing accomodation with this design either - a bit of privacy while showering is preferable in that situation and the steam from the shower is best confined to the bathroom. The advertised Jacuzzi wasn't working and the swimming pool is outdoor and not useable in the winter. The poor design was, at times, combined with poor service: they usually don't answer the phone on the 'one touch service' nor the '100% satisfaction guaranteed' speed dial buttons (eventually got through on the latter to some woman who seemed most displeased at being interrutpted). I was persistent, and emailed their head office - after which the hotel manager was profusely apologetic and fought valiantly to restore my confidence, including moving me to a better room with a proper shower in which the water goes downhill rather than pooling around your feet - although this one was on an upper floor and it took a good couple of minutes for hot water to get there (which was alright once you know that - you can turn it on a couple of minutes before you want it - presumably the same idiot designer put the hot water tanks in the basement). Because of his efforts (he really did try hard once the issues were brought to his attention) I'm giving it three stars, an 'average' rating. I'd give his personal effort five, but he was let down by his colleagues and by what he had to work with. Would I come back? No, probably not: no amount of effort on the 'software' front of customer service and remedial gestures from the management (lovely as those were) can change the 'hardware' problem that whoever designed this place didn't really do it with function in mind. And they still don't answer their phones. Or let you use their wi fi after you check out. Or help you to anything like 5 star standard at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here!”
Reviews.Author: BrenDsouza
Reviews.Content: One of the worse hotels I've stayed at in Europe. The rooms are really pathetic and food is awful too. Stay anywhere else, but don't make a mistake of going to this place ever. Almost every aspect of the room was a disappointment, from lack of power plugs, to an absence of a desk, light switches away from the bed, joint beds which were highly uncomfortable, and I could go on and on... Just don't make the mistake of staying here!! Had a super awesome time in Rome (was my first trip)! Luckily I spent much of my time on the streets visiting tourist spots, but even the little time I had at the hotel was sheer misery!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, just not 5star.”
Reviews.Author: VaciAVaci
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a long weekend. It is a very very modern style hotel, best suitable for younger people.The staff certainly could be nicer, but overall its a good hotel to stay. The pool on top of the hotel is amazing even though it was too cold for us to use it. I believe its even nicer during the summer months. The hotel is in good location just 5 minutes from the train station of the city. The breakfast has a wide range of food.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy its 5 star hotel rating!”
Reviews.Author: Prinsesse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing but average. Rooms are boring although an effort is made to make them interesting with its minimalistic design. Breakfast buffet is over priced and quite boring with extremely dry bread, sausages dripping with oil, no fresh fruit (only in syrup) and juice was not freshly made... The pool is a big plus however the few sunbeds are usually occupied from early morning until evening by people who leave their towels there and go sightseeing. We stayed at the hotel for 3 days and never managed to get a sunbed. The reception staff are not very interested in recommending restaurants or with general tourist inquiries. They should consider concierge service! Lastly, this hotel is not worthy its 5 stars! I would rate it as a 3 star business hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: KLL65
Reviews.Content: A disappointing hotel for such a wonderful city. Whilst close to the station ( which has it's advantages) the area is "dodgy" and I did not feel comfortable when wandering out of the hotel. The bedrooms, for want of a better word, were odd and it took time to work out how things worked. Unplugging lights at the sockets seemed to work!There was no safe in the room and when I contacted reception they proceeded to tell me where it was. Still no safe in the gap where it should have been ! Reception said they would arrange one to be in the room but nothing arrived in 2 days. The food was edible but not enjoyable so overall the experience was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful place”
Reviews.Author: HelenW017
Reviews.Content: Just been at a conference at this hotel and it was dreadful. Firstly, location - upside - it is very handy for the station - 2 mins walk provided you recognise it is actually a hotel and not the multi story car park it looks like. Downside - area is, like around many stations, slightly dodgy with people sitting around drinking (i don't mean in nice curbside bars), vast amounts of graffitti and if you are unlucky enough to be at that side of the hotel, noisy from the trains. Secondly, rooms - upside - comfortable beds (although control unit for lights, blinds, etc between headboards). Downside - wierd rooms, controls for lights a nightmare, a electronic control for a blackout blind that didn't exist, shade for the light in the room a large paper bag, shower over bath with dodgy controls, secret 4inch deep wardrobe hidden behind the light swtich to the toilet. More concerning though was that as I wasn't concentrating and went to open a bedroom door two down from my room, the key let me in. It then wouldn't let me in mine. When i reported this to reception there concern was getting my key reprogrammed, and not the fact that i'd been able to walk into another room. Finally, food - upside - breakfast was lovely. Downside - maybe it was because we were at a conference, but the food was exceptionally poor at both lunch and dinner. Dinner consisted of undercooked risotto which i discovered had aspargus in for some people, but certainly not mine and then a chicken dish which was five small pieces of chicken with one slice of mushroom and a couple of slivers of pepper in it. It looked very sad on the plate! Pudding was creme brullee which unfortunately i don't eat and then not even a cup of coffee - we purchased our own. We know that the Italians can cook, but if we had only eaten in the hotel we would not have had that impression! This is not a cheap hotel, but it is a cheap hotel trying to be trendy and failing badly. If i'd have booked it for my husband and I, I think i'd have been beside myself and checked out after seeing the room.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, funky but a bit tattered.”
Reviews.Author: Michael A
Reviews.Content: The location of the Radisson Blu in Rome is either great or bitterly disappointing depending on how you look at it. It is situated near the end of the main 'termini' station in Rome, so if you get the train into town or one of the shuttle busses that only drops off at the station, then you are in luck with a 10 minute walk down the long south-easterly side of the station to the hotel. The hotel is then quite close to the Vittorio Emanuele‎ station on Rome's Metro system, however you will need to get the Metro (or face a rather long and confusing walk) to and from the hotel when you want to start exploring any of the sights down in the historic centre. I will also advise that it isn't situated in the safest area either- you will either be walking briskly past the ferrel cats that line the streets, avoiding the urine stench from the local park or all out not trying to look sideways at the shifty characters lurking in the many alleyways and backstreets that you need to navigate through. Now, on to the hotel! It is nice, modern, crisp and clean. Or at least it was when the hotel opened. Upon checking in with the very friendly front desk staff I got to my room which at first inspection was brightly furnished with modern finishes with lots of orange and a shag-pile rug (yeah, baby!). However, on a closer look you quickly see the rotten wood lining the combined shower/bath (yes, combined shower/bath combination) and other outbreaks of mould and broken fittings. If staying in summer, the rooftop pool is a great place to relax, have a drink, swim and soak up the sun once your done with the sights in Rome. The hotel's restaurant has outdoor seating next to the pool which is a lovely serene setting for a nice dinner (once again, once you are done with the local haunts first). Overall, it's a nice, modern hotel that performs on a whole, but if small instances of cleanliness are high on your radar then you better look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: MichaelTaylorMarple
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous visit to Rome, it's a great city. And this hotel is located near the station. Obviously that's convenient - and basic research tells you that's a dodgy area too. The hotel was disappointing however. Firstly, the rooms have a strange modernist design which borders on the ludicrous at times. The bath plumbing takes ages to work out. Secondly, the rooftop bar prices were very high, but again, probably comparable with a capital city hotel. What isn't acceptable is the stale snacks they serve with drinks. Rubbish. That gave us a foretaste of the mediocre breakfast buffet. The Americano coffee was vile, the espresso cold, the hot buffet was reheated mush. In fairness the service was friendly and efficient. But for the price and prestige of the brand there is much more to be done to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you'd expect from a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: stormflys
Reviews.Content: We were moved here from the Welcome Piram Hotel as they had to close a floor. They described it as an 'upgrade'. If this was an upgrade, Im glad I didn't stay in the Welcome Piram. I'd rather stay in a clean 2 star than stay in a dirty 5 star which is what this was. On entering the room, the first thing I noticed was a stain on the bed throw. This is unacceptable as it was blatently obvious and no attempt made even to hide it. The white walls were really grubby looking, right round the bath was black, there was ominous stains on the furniture, the toilet was not cleaned properly, and the pillow case was also stained. As this was a sight seeing trip, we only planned to use the hotel to sleep in, however I did not even want to sleep in this room. When we complained about the room we were told that the decor was not to everyone's taste and was supposed to be modern, even though our complaint was about the cleanliness, not the look. They also refused to give us an iron - for our own safety - but could get out clothes ironed for 8-15 Euro's per garment. We were made to stay in the same room for the first night and got no sleep with the sound of the trains. You could hear every announcement and screeching of brakes. We even asked them to contact our original hotel to get us moved somewhere else and they refused outright. We were moved the next day and although the room was a lot cleaner, the bath was in need of repair and the shower was dirty and not very powerful. There was also a completely random chair in the room, the type you would find in an school assembly, ugly and uncomfortable and completely out of sorts with the rest of the design. The most annoying thing is that there is signs everywhere saying '100% satisfaction guaranteed'. Also there was no full length mirror in the room. A small gripe but found this very odd. The hotel in general was dark and a bit eerie and generally just not a nice place to be. It would've been fine for one night but not somewhere I would stay again for any length of time.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location to train station with lovely roof top pool and bar area”
Reviews.Author: JonnyandJules
Reviews.Content: For access to main Roma train station, Termini, it was a 5 min walk. Hotel entrance itself is lovely with roman ruins in the foyer. Room was quite small, but clean and everything you need including free wifi. Pool at roof top was a great luxury in the city and had good bar with cocktail menu. However food and drink was pricey. Cocktails were around €10-€15. Close to some main sites with colosseum and Trevi fountain within walking distance. Overall experience is what you would expect from radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Train Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rider123
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews of this hotel before staying and picked it because of location next to train station and curiosity over futuristic architecture. The place is rather bizarre in design. There is a glass wall showing a ruin dig in the lobby near a blow up reception desk (very cool). The suites look over another above ground ruin surrounded by trash. My recommendation, have your staff clean up the view, do some maintenance and you will be fine for those who like a cool stay with decent beds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool area”
Reviews.Author: MartaA1
Reviews.Content: The main reason we booked this hotel was the roof top pool, as we travelled in August and it was extremely hot. If this is your first time in Rome, then stay somewhere else: this hotel is very modern, nothing Italian about it and it's near the main train station, which is far from the main sites. For us it did the job, as the pool area is fantastic, however the prices at the bar are crazy so definitely go to the cafe around the corner to get your lunch and drinks. The rooms are ok, however the shower is in the room just behind the bed... so the design is pretty weird.. I would probably recommend it if you are looking to just chill at the pool for a few days, but not if you are on a citybreak or if you want a true Italian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor location”
Reviews.Author: businessmanankara
Reviews.Content: Well, I prefer this hotel for it's five stars...İt's certainly not.Especially the location is terrible.. When you travel to Rome, do not choose a hotel around TERMINI. Antwhere else is ok but Termini is the worst place to stay in Rome. The hotel is totally problem..If you want to take a shower, in a tent in the middle of the room just go for it..But not for me...sorry..

Reviews.Title: “strange design in a shabby part of the city”
Reviews.Author: soxfan
Reviews.Content: All I need to say is that there is a shower in the middle of the room. No desk (per se) and odd design probably dating back to 1970, I would call it "mod and odd". I also think the neighborhood was rather tattered and the location is not as close to the railway entrance as one would think especially if you have luggage. When we did arrive there were no bellman in sight. Lastly my chair went through the floor board at the rooftop bar (no injuries). In my opinion, there are better choices in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Five star in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Fundaky
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent for a Rome trip. The price is high, but we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms & amenities, convenient location, great concierge staff”
Reviews.Author: TheSeaIsForMe
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice and I have to tell you, this hotel is great for both business and pleasure because it's safe, well appointed, well maintained and it's location is right next to the Termini Train Station. That could be a turn-off for some travelers who want to stay near the sites, but not for us. You walk across the street, you're in Termini, and you can take a bus, train or tram anywhere you want to go in Roma. The Leonardo Express whisks you to and from the Fiumicino Airport. Believe it or not the food and little grocery stores in the station are not bad. If it's your first time in Roma, take the Tourist Bus, the concierge can give you details and a discount. All the concierges are great, but Michela was the best. See my review on Taverna Trilussa Trastevere Ristorante. She sent us there, it had just won awards for "BEST PASTA IN ROMA", it was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Needs work. Not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Seang74
Reviews.Content: The hotel location worked for us, the rooms are clean but the shower has mould all over. The restraunt is very expensive, but the staff are excellent. I found the beds uncomfortable. The roof top pool is nice as is the spa

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel choice near Termini”
Reviews.Author: stanopoulos
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my wife partly for business and partly as a short break without the kids. The Radisson is a newish glass and steel hotel on the side of the Termini station. Transport links are excellent. It has standard (bath/shower €185) and superior (shower only + balcony + coffee machine €225) rooms. Many rooms face the internal courtyard but some have "city" view. There is a wonderful rooftop restaurant and pool (also kiddie pool) and fitness centre/hot tub/sauna/spa. On the first floor there is a lounge area with library good for quiet study or reading. Breakfast is included in the rate or exclude and save €30 per room. The rooms are clean and floored with vinyl and a rug under the bed. The overall feel of the place is trendy - the rooms have flat screen TV, free wifi eevrywhere, study area in the room, and a glass enclosed toilet and bath area in the rooms. The a/c works well and the hotel seems to run efficiently from the guest's point of view. The downsides are minor - the materials used in the rooms are not that good so lots of fixtures are broken or looking like they may break. For example the seals around the glass bath area, the headboards etc and it makes you think you are living in an IKEA room! Having said that the staff respond quickly to all complaints and we were offered an upgrade when a/c leak occurred. The front desk staff try hard but some of them seem a bit stressed out probably because of the sheer mass of guests checking in and out all day long. The food in the restaurant is OK, nothing great (tinned tuna in the Nicoise) but quite expensive €16 for a panini). Service is mostly really friendly and helpful. Now that I know my way around Rome I might stay in a place closer to the sights (although you can walk to the historic centre in 15-20 mins) but if you are considering somewhere close to the station, then you can't beat this business hotel on value.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure why this has such bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Archchana
Reviews.Content: 5 minute walking distance from the main train station in Rome this hotel has easy access however I wouldnt say it's in the best area of Rome. Booked this on lastminute.com £400 for 3 nights then read the reviews and was put off. However I can't seem to understand why these reviews have been written. The rooms are uber cool but small with one of the best AC systems. The roof top pool is very chic with numerous sun loungers available but the main problem with it is the train station is behind the hotel and so there is the constant noise of trains throughout the day which became annoying. They have a great cocktail menu however their food and drinks are seriously overpriced 16euros for a plain salad and 7euros for a glass of coke!! You definitely feel like you're in the med when you're sunbathing on their roof top pool a great R&R hotel They have a great selection

Reviews.Title: “Progress shouldn't mean more pit ponies.”
Reviews.Author: rachelclarke6062
Reviews.Content: Radisson Blu consider good design key to their success. The use of too many untested new materials and new technologies in every room, is it’s downfall. Funky design may get bods in beds, but I wonder how much repeat business they get? Still Radisson BLU has one great attraction, a roof top pool. It is not a refuge but a retreat [white flag flying] for urbane guests, seeking sanctuary from the urban jungle that surrounds it. The brave post-modernist facade hides the reality of premature ageing concrete monolithic. Everything is a bit frayed around its minimalist edges. New technologies, especially rapidly growing ones make for higher levels of obsolescence, which isn't good ecology. The Radisson must consume energy like a blast furnace, due to all the glass. Everywhere is air conditioning yet there wasn't a solar panel in sight. Maintenance at a basic level, such as window cleaning hasn't happened for a long time.
