Yet the army of cleaners struggle on coping with the design disaster. Guests have to weld a heavy plate glass door simply to use the wc. The rubber floors are great, but why place a shabby shagpile rug, which cannot be cleaned on top of it? The bed is mounted on a floating hardwood raft that incorporates the sink and shower tray. Inviting you to clip your ankles before you stand under the fixed shower head that pours a torrent of water on your head like it or not. A large plastic bag-like wall light adorned the wall, which demands that you turn it on, when it inflates, otherwise it just looks flaccid. The plastic Lilliputians, that populate architects 3D cardboard 1:10 scaled models, don't hint at any of these problems, but anyone with a titter of wit would have known. Worst of all the uber cool aspirations of this hotel rest too heavily on the humble maid. Progress shouldn't mean any more pit ponies, and my heart goes out to them. No amount of design will water the plants and remove the dead trees about the pool, or replace plants missing outside in the courtyard. Anything that is shabby, dead or pointless recycle. Lastly the beautiful floor in reception should be polished, and for the pit ponies, this would equate to a frolic in a meadow.

Reviews.Title: “terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Diocletian12
Reviews.Content: We were given a Junior Suite on the 5th floor. The room was dirty and smelly. The style of the room was trendy but the materials used were obviously of poor quality. We were woken at five o'clock by the platform announcements from the adjacent railway station. The hand cream in the bathroom had been previously used.

Reviews.Title: “Great roof top pool and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fabio Z
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August for two nights, the roof top pool is beautiful. The menu is expensive. However the rooms were comfortable and clean. they have a unique layout with the shower being in the middle of the room, interesting use of space, felt secure and safe and it was a 5 minute walk from Termini station which was convenient as I was catching a train to Venice next. staff and service was excellent. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen1966
Reviews.Content: I have just checked into the most run down hotel room you can imagine.... Mould in the bathroom, filthy stained carpet, severly marked walls , water damage in the bathroom so bad the plaster is coming off the walls and to it off the air con has been on full for a hour and the room is still hot... I'm afraid to take my shoes of and walk on the carpet.... Absolute hell hole....!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre, average hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: Journeyma
Reviews.Content: Radisson Blu is supposed to be a 5* hotel but in my opinion it definitely seemed more like a 3+ / 4* star alternative. The positives are that the rooms are funky and bright and the hotel has got a great roof top pool area if you are lucky enough to get one of few sunbeds. On the negative side one would expect a concierge service / educated reception staff that could assist with dinner-reservations and recommendations. The next time I visit Rome I will find another alternative as Radisson are only average and there are several good alternatives in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: Yalienow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Blu for four days last week. It is very well located, being seconds from Termini with links to the airport and the rest of the city which that brings. It also has a pool on the roof which is a god send to retreat back after a sweaty day out sight seeing. However, apart from the pool and a decent breakfast, almost nothing worked. The decor and fittings are tired and need desperately to be updated. The bed creaked, the TV didnt work, the bedside lamps didnt work, the bath leaked, the so-called Wifi was frustratingly slow (and didnt work by the pool) and the "gym" was a shoe box - and the staff obviously didnt like working there either as it was clear that guests were a distraction. The icing on the cake was that food and drinks were vastly overpriced. If you have a choice, choose another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Modern central hotel with POOL on the roof top”
Reviews.Author: swiss74_ZRH
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, right next to ROMA termini train station and withhin short taxi rides (10-15min) to the main tourist attractions (Colosseum, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona). The POOL on the roof top offers you relaxing hours after "stressful" sightseeing. The rooms are modern, with half-transparent shower. I was a bit surprised about the long pile carpet in the room. I don't think it is easy to keep it hygienic. The staff at the reception is very friendly and helpful. I wanted to see the Colosseum and the receptionist told me were to get a ticket without having to queue for hours.

Reviews.Title: “Futuristic reception area”
Reviews.Author: H0lly_Days
Reviews.Content: This 3 day trip was a birthday treat from husband. Arrived at the hotel by taxi from the airport in approx 30 mins or so. If arriving by train the hotel is right by the train station about a 2 min walk. This area looks a bit dodgy, grafitti everywhere and dubious characters hanging around so I would have felt a bit uncomfortable if travelling unaccompanied. Hotel reception/ lobby area was futuristic looking but dark, check-in was smooth and staff ok. We had booked a standard room which was generally clean and average size for european standards but very quirky. One of the lights had an inflatable shade? (see photo). The bed was positioned facing the windows, the shower/bath and hand basin were in the middle of the room behind the bed separated only by a glass partition. The toilet was however not as exposed and in a separate room. The orange paint was peeling from around the bath, there was some mould/mildew in parts and the controls were difficult to operate. The wardrobe consisted of a clothes hanging rack positioned to the side of the bed and open cupboards opposite. I can see the hotel was trying to achieve a modern/contemporary look -reminded me of IKEA but it didn't quite work somehow. As we'd arrived relatively late and it was pouring down we decided to eat in the hotel. The restaurant was on the top floor and again very dark I could hardly see to read the menu! Service was good and food was also but very expensive as were the drinks. However we did discover the following evening when we returned to the hotel for a night cap that they put on light snacks/nibbles/canapes which you could help yourself to whilst you had a drink. Awoken the next morning around 6.00 by the trains from the station nearby. I'm a light sleeper so this might not be a problem for some. Breakfast was served on the top floor, buffet style with a good selection of cold meats, cheeses, cereals etc and cooked breakfast if required. You could help yourself to a variety of fruit juices, tea and coffee. Rome is a lovely city with lots to see. We walked everywhere so can't comment on the public transport. Try to pick a restaurant away from the tourist routes. We had a fantastic delicious 3 course lunch for a fraction of the price and less crowded too! Finally if you want to go in the Colloseum and the Forum book a combined pass, you'll avoid the queues and the ticket touts by doing so!! Overall a lovely short break.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Pool are Plusses, But there are Minuses as Well”
Reviews.Author: PinguinVA
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends here at the end of July 2011 prior to a cruise in the Mediterranean. The Raddison is adjacent to the train station and there are direct trains to both the airport and cruise terminal, which makes this a great location for those needing to get in and out of Rome easily. The Blu also has a great pool on the rooftop which is nice to have available during the hot Roman summers. That said, if you are looking for a fine property with great service, look elsewhere. As others have stated before, the rooms are oddly laid out and are in need of repair. It looked more like a college dorm than a room that cost more than $200/night. There is a lot of wasted space, no closets (just hangers on a contraption) and the tub in our room was showing signs of age and neglect. Service was spotty -- long lines at check in and indifferent service at the pool bar. Also, be advised that they have a pretty nice brunch on the roof with strange pricing. There's one price if you book online, another if you book upon arrival and another if you are a walk in. At least for us, the best deal was to wait until we arrived. The Radission offers decent accommodations in a location that is perfect for those traveling outside of Rome, but there are a host of better choices for those touring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A F
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel was not in a great location (the dirty, smelly Termini station was a few blocks away), I must admit that we did not have any problems in terms of security. The staff were polite and friendly and the 7th floor bar/ pool area was good. Our main concern was the quality of the rooms. The attempt to provide a modern/trendy style in room decor and layout ,failed miserably. We booked 2 'standard' rooms and both were in need of refurbishment and maintenance. In my room, the air conditioning unit, which was above the bed, leaked several times during our 3 night stay and required a maintenance guy to come out. If guests like a degree of privacy (even if married) the rooms are not for you. The shower, located behind the bed. had a curtain that did not fit. leading to water splashing dangerously on the floor. The toilet door was made from a translucent material, leaving nothing to the imagination. There were also no 'in room' ironing facilities and the only alternative was a costly laundry/ironing service. We have stayed in a few Radissons in our time and we felt the quality of this one was lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice central location”
Reviews.Author: Wes_Charles
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a very unusual style of bedroom - lots of glass! Big breakfasts, but unfortunately the hot food was almost cold every morning. Nevertheless, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.......”
Reviews.Author: Milla007
Reviews.Content: We have been many times in Rome and have been staying here 4 times. This stay was probably our last. When we arrived in our room we saw that the end of the bed (frame) was full of stains. It looked like somebody had been lying in bed with wet, dripping boots on. There was also only one bathrobe in the room. We went down to the reception and reported this and told them to fix it. The rooms are very worn out and is in real need of a redecoration. We went to the pool and ordered something to drink and eat. The waitress was rude and did not understand english very well. And this hotel market themselves as a very "international hotel"??? When the drinks arrived the waitress also came with two plexiglass boxes with some snacks in it. The boxes was so full of fatty finger stains on the in-and outside. These boxes had probably been around on the tables all day. We returned them immidiately to the waiter. When the food arrived it was not what we ordered and we returned it. When it came back again it was not correct either. We gave up...... When we went to bed we discovered that two of the lamps did not work so it was quite dark in the room. One lamp missed a boulb and the other by the bed the wire was cut. We like to read so this was also dissapointing. Nothing had been done to clean the bed and we still had only one bathrobe. At this times we felt we have had so many dissappointments in only a few hours. We decided to complain and wrote a summary and delivered to the reception at appr. 11 p.m. They offered us to change room. They did not know if the other room was available the next day. We had already packed out all our things and did not want to change in the middle of the night and to a room we maybe had to leave the next day so we decided to stay and told them again to fix things. Day 2 we went to the city center and where out all day. We came back appr. at 8 p.m. Nothing was done to the bed or the lamps. No we started to get really annoied and complained again. Again they wanted us to change room (and not with a guarantee that it was available the day after...). We told them no and said they needed to fix our room. We went to dinner and when we came back, the lamps were ok, but nothing was done regarding the bed or bathrobe! Day 3: we came back from town and the bed had not been made up with clean, swept sheets. It was completely curled and did not look delicate at all. We gave up complaining feeling ignored. When we checked out they gave us 62 euro in discount. This is really arrogant when they have a sign in the rooms that says: "100 % satisfaction guarantee, or you dont have to pay!" It speaks for itself. This is suppose to be a 5 star hotel but I would rate it to a 3 star. Unless you want a filthy hotelroom in bad shape and arrogant staff, avoid this hotel. Roma can offer much better hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: C1are
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel in May this year and had an excellent time. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Swimming pool was great and food. Our room was very clean and was serviced everyday. Overall the Hotel was brillant, comfortable an well located. Will definitely return, absolutely loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Is this safe "Safe?"”
Reviews.Author: bloozaddict
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying, in general, the hotel was clean and comfortable. Reasonable Breakfast buffett. Nice pool on roof top of Hotel. small but workable fitness room. Location is directly next to the Terminale Roma, (main train station Rom). Which is also convenient to all the "must experience" areas of Rom. On the negative side, this area is a bit seedy , may intimidate some people. But in the 5 days I was there, always walking, having to walk through the area at 23:00 and some times later, I felt uncomfortable at times but never had a problem with the street people in the area. I was not approached once......in that particular area, from the front of the train station to Hotel that is. About a 10 minute walk. Now some suggestions. If you put anything in the room safe, make sure the safe itself is secured. Sounds silly doesnt it. But here's what happened. I put some valuables in the safe: passport, wallet, credit cards etc. things I would not carrry with me when walking around Rom, dialed in my "secret Code" and closed the door. When I closed the door I noticed the safe moved slightly on the shelf it was sitting. So I investigated further. To my surprise. the safe was not fastened to the shelf at all......not a single bolt, it was just sitting on the shelf. I was able to take the safe out and carry it under my arm ( made of sheet metal with a slightly sturdier front) down to the main lobby .........where by the way, no one seemed to be concerned that a man was walking around the lobby with a safe under his arm, I told my story to the attendant and she seemed surprised and immediately sent the maintenance guy to my room. He "tried" to fasten the safe using 2 small wood screws. After he left I checked the security of the safe by applying a small jolt, the safe was free again to carry around town during my sight seeing adventure in Rom. I gave up. Just secured my items my own way. Oh yea. apparently if you don't tip in this Hotel, you will simply be ignored. My mini bar was out of order. Full of nice warm drinks , melting chocolate etc. They could not replace or repair it so I asked for compensation in some way (reduced room charge etc.) which was rejected by the managment. As an alternative they were willing to send a bucket of ice to my room.......... thanks......... I didnt tip the young man that brought the ice as I felt inconvenienced and paying for a servvice I did not receive, definetly was not going to tip for that. So the next evening on the way up to my room I stopped at the front desk and asked for a bucket of ice. After an hour wait I called down and requested again. Ice never arrived. The scenario was repeated the following evening as well.... "No! No icea for you!"

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel needs refurbishment - better choices in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: djjbtoronto
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitant about staying in this hotel based on the less-than-positive reviews online. For the most part they seem accurate. I had a quiet room ($350US/night) on the fourth floor away from the train station. It was quiet, I heard no train or station noise. The room needed serious refurbishment. The air conditioning was mediocre. The service was good. The pool is the redeeming feature of this hotel, and the wireless internet worked well although the "business centre" is a table in the lobby with pay per use computers in order to print anything, like a boarding pass. I was in Rome for business and saw the hotel rooms of several colleagues staying elsewhere - mostly on Via Veneto. For the same approx price their rooms were superb compared to the Radisson, and in a much better location. I would not stay here again unless I had a lot of down time to use the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Location was poor and needs remodelling”
Reviews.Author: travelexpress1
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed. Our first room was very small, although it did have a balcony which we requested. The room had a 3 star hotel feel. I brought this to the attention of the front desk attendant and was given the option to upgrade to a suite for a not so little fee. Had we not been with guests, we would have probably changed hotels. We did take the (expensive) upgrade and made the best of our 5 day stay at this hotel in Rome. The hotel was right next to the train station but the noise wasn't too bad. We were a cab ride away from everywhere and the cabs in rome also charge for their trip to you. We would get in the cab at times and the meter would already read 10 euros! If we return to rome, We will stay much closer to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel not suitable for real guests”
Reviews.Author: anna232
Reviews.Content: I had seen this hotel in magazines and was quite excited to stay here. Upon arrival there was no body to help me with my luggage, but the lobby was spectacular and the girl at the reception desk was friendly, so I felt happy. However going upstairs that feeling rapidly disappeared. the corridors looked depressive and were badly maintained. the room was small (but he this is rome, so i was not surprised) and despite the modern design appeared as a 3-star hotelroom. There was no Appropriate closet, only one powerpoint far away from the bed, no comfortable chair, but above all no desk!! I went to the reception to ask for a room with a desk and i was referred to the bussiness center, I indicated that a desk in my room was essential but they did not have nother room available and said some guests like this hotel others dont.... But I was promised another room the next day. The next day iwas told the other room was vailble at 14h, i had to call 5 times to arrange the roomchange. The new room indeed had a Desk, but the carpet was very dusty,, it seemed to be unused for a time, there was only one powersupply away from the desk so i called for An extension cord, than the safe did not function, i decided to ignore, than the toilet did not work, so Ii called reception again and somebody came to repair. Next internet did not work in this room..... Back to reception... There the said it was my apple laptop that gave the issues, butvthe laptop did function in the lobby, then they gave me a cable, but there was no place to pkug it in.... I became really desperate especially since i got the impression that i was doing difficult. Was i? The only thing i asked for was to be able to work in my room in this 5 star hotel.... Finally the office that booked my room told the reception that i was a vip and than things started to move forward. A really nice It manager came to my room, admitted that this room always had an internet problem and took drastic measurements, he had a hole made in the wall and a cable connection was made, it took about an hour and he stayed to check whether everything functioned and he also had the carpet cleaned. Later on a plate of fruit and candy was bought to mke up for the inconvenience, which was nice, but could not make up for the lost hours and change my feelings about this hotel anymore. Neither could the awsome rooftop area or the fine breakfast. This hotel just doesnt seem to be suitable for guests, i did not mention many other inconveniences, because it is just too much, it seems that the design has got more attention than guest comfort and the staff doesnt know how to compensate for this.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced, need renovation but nice pool and terrace”
Reviews.Author: Abeille-Jaune
Reviews.Content: The pool and terrace rescue this hotel: the rooms looks somewhat "cheap", unrenovated and are bad isolated from the other rooms, but clean. The breakfast is very expensive (26 euros). Location for sightseeing quite weak, far from many sites. No parking in the hotel but just beside, unfortunately no reduction as a hotel client. Our room was not made when we came back from the city, this was at 4:30 pm. Good point: the free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Not even 4 Star accommodation, but nice pool and terrace. I'd look elsewhere next time.”
Reviews.Author: Pommie60
Reviews.Content: The room was a very unusual design, with a shower in the middle which isn't necessarily bad. Unfortunately, it was poorly engineered with cheap materials so the shower didn't drain well, the curtain wouldn't close and the whole room was awkward to use. Bed comfortable enough, but you can clearly hear the station announcements clearly from across the road. Expensive too, but this is Rome and nothing is less than over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “I truly enjoyed the staff”
Reviews.Author: antman31
Reviews.Content: The service in the restaurant and front desk was flawless. I really can appreciate good and professional team and they really are a team. The rooms were very nice and clean. I must be honest from the reviews I was expected less. Thanks Radisson team largo

Reviews.Title: “Fighting for comfort... and getting it”
Reviews.Author: NikoPseudo
Reviews.Content: I tend to trust Radisson. It's pricey, but it tends to offer a combination of great modern design, good location and good service. I booked the Radisson Blu because it was recommended by the Wallpaper City Guide. The guide also mentioned that the hotel was originally launched by the same people who opened the Ripa Hotel, also in Rome, only in Trastevere. I stayed at both places while in Rome, and I could see resemblances (same pebble pattern on the carpets, same cloud-like light fixtures). Given their history (roughly 10 years, a LONG time in the Hotel business), these two places seem to have gone down two different roads. The Ripa went downhill, while the Radisson managed to keep some rooms in decent shape. When I stayed there, I was first assigned a tired smoking room (even if I had asked for non-smoking). I went back to reception and was told that I could be given a different room, only one that would be facing the train tracks, which are noisy. I put up a fight and said their policy was "100% Satisfaction Guaranteed or you don't pay". They finally gave me a non-smoking room, on the sixth floor, which was a little smaller but had its own balcony, apparently a kind of upgrade. I was pleased. I think the hotel is okay. The breakfast is not included and would have cost 25 euro per morning, which I find shocking considering the price of the room. The hi-fi is included and works well. Yes, the shower is a little tired, and there are stains on the comforters, but I am ok with that too, given that the room was clean enough. The location is convenient but makes for noisy pool scene and noisy rooms, at least in half of the building. And the complimentary spa and pool area are brilliant. Check in was difficult, but check out was smooth and very friendly. Overall, I would say Radisson: a) Train your staff b) Revamp the rooms c) OR lower your prices I recommend to stay at the Radisson if you need access to Termini train station, and make sure to ask for a room AWAY from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Too funky to be functional. Skip it.”
Reviews.Author: Schm00py
Reviews.Content: This property is so disappointing it is hard to know where to start. My husband and I just spent four nights here on holiday. I 1) I is billed as 'in the heart of Rome.' Well, it is literally right next to the train station but not close to the vast majority of the sites that one visits Rome to see. 2) The place is billed as 'cool' but the place is falling apart. We had two different rooms and both had multiple things that did not work or were broken. As were were coming and going each day by the reception area, we heard other guests complaining about unfunctioning things in their rooms too. 3) It is billed as a 'business hotel' but has no proper work station for computer work and has inadequate electrical outlets, not only at the work station but throughout the room. On the positive side, the pool area and restaurant/ bar that abutt the pool are very nice and the food and service is good. The spa area has a fabulous whirlpool and sauna that helps ease your muscles after all of the walking you do to get to the sites! The steam room was, however, not working.

Reviews.Title: “..... too expensive for what offers....”
Reviews.Author: brugne
Reviews.Content: Hotel is new but looks old, very cheap . The rooms are ugly, impractical, This is not a hotel for 5 stars but for 2.

Reviews.Title: “Pass on Radisson Blu”
Reviews.Author: shawno360
Reviews.Content: I spend 50 nights a year in hotels for business and pleasure. Blu had poor service at check in, meals (breakfasts), and poolside. Our two rooms were dirty/smelly with funky and overall poor design. Location for sightseeing/touring was weak...far from most major sites. Pool was 23 degrees (73F)-very cold for even hot June days! There was a small, but nice gym/workout room. Net/net, find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great design but not supported by service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: thePaulhongkong
Reviews.Content: The hotel design is great and very funky. Add to that a great location, very close to the main train station and sights and this hotel should be a total winner. Unfortunately this is a real example of design over substance not to mention design over service. The room was really funky but poor practical design meant that there was water damage and a feeling of things falling apart not too mention the feeling that the room needed a good clean. You would think that a hotel charging $300 a night would provide a plug adaptor and not tell you to go to a shop in the nearby station!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it at all”
Reviews.Author: Goalieman688
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while on vacation in June and we found most everything to be very subpar. When we checked in we found our first room did not have properly functioning drains and paint peeling off the ceiling. We were quickly upgraded to a "deluxe room" after bringing this to their attention. This room was fine but definitely not worth the 350 a night we were charged. (that wAs our original rate). Since we were traveling by train we decided to stay here one more night as it was close to the train station. When we checked in we were given room 228, a handicap room on the second floor overlooking the courtyard. This room was probably one of the dirtiest rooms I have ever stayed in. The carpets were stained, the white walls had one kind of stains, corners of the crown moulding was chipped away, the bathrooms were incased in one shower, the phone did not work, etc. Please see attached pictures to see what I am referring too. The rooftop bar and pool were nice and the staff was friendly most of the time, but I would take your business elsewhere and avoid this place like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again - even if it was FREE!”
Reviews.Author: Tvlallover55711
Reviews.Content: When you walk into the room, you are greeted by the smell of pesticides. The shower is in the middle of the room and curtain sticks to you, shower does not drain and helps you realize that it is not clean either - so gross! We could hear the train announcements across the street starting at 5am. There is a shag throw rug that is filthy. We moved it away as we didn't want to step on the nasty thing. Blood stains were on the down comforter. No one ever answered if you call the operator or front desk. Some of the switches in the room are not functioning. There is no well lit mirror and good luck if you wear contacts. This is a terrible hotel and Rome has so many great choices. Stay someplace else! This one is way too dirty to even let my dog stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good hotel let down by location”
Reviews.Author: AtomicTraveller
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel a number of times for Business, the design of the rooms vary from floor-to-floor. However they all have one thing in common in that the designer has tried to be too clever and what is initially a novelty soon becomes frustrating - too many light switches scattered around the room, lights that don't work, showers that flood the room (most rooms have the showers within the main bedroom). It may have been cutting edge when the hotel first opened, but is now looking a bit tired and could do with some refurbishment. However, the rooms are not unpleasant, the beds are comfortable and the aircon works effectively. Other positive points are the bar and swimming pool on the top floor with good views, great breakfast selection, gym and free WI-FI. The biggest issue is the location of this hotel: It is next to the Termini which is the main central station, which is fine if you need to use it (and the airport train is literally across the road from the hotel); however if you have a room facing the station (rooms x01 - x14) you will hear the trains and announcements. The area around the Termini (and the hotel) is situated in an ethnic area where you get lots of men standing around in groups in the evening, although I never found these threatening. Some of these are near the entrance of the hotel, and it is surprising that the hotel doesn't employ security guards to move these people on. The area though is run-down and walking alone is best avoided late at night. Saying that a 5 min walk takes you into a more tourist area with restaurants and bars. So in summary, this is a fairly good hotel, but unless you want to use the station, there are probably better locations.

Reviews.Title: “A "design" ripoff”
Reviews.Author: giocondinha
Reviews.Content: Well. If you are an architecture student or an architect, you might want to pay 200Eur for a night in a room that does look nice on the pictures... nevertheless this hotel is not worth the price so beware. Located in a bad neighbourhood (back of Termini station: if you are a solo traveller arriving late at night, hold tight to your belongings and RUN across the street to the reception). The rooms have been decribed by the fellow reviewers, I cannot help myself to wonder whether the architect of this guest unfriendly design has ever stayed in a hotel, and particularly, if they tried to sleep in theroom they have designed. Highlights might include the fact that the shower is literally situated behind the bed and, being separated from the bed just by a glass wall you will be pleased to fall asleep (or not) to the sound of the water dripping to the bath tub. Toilets have glass door... there is no concept of intimacy in the rooms of this hotel. No proper desk to put your pc or belongings, no wardrobe... the empty room might look nice but once 2 people settle in, regardless of how tidy they are the room looses the purpose: you end up jumping from one empty square foot to another. There is simply no space left. Minibar prices are outrageous (water, coke etc 6 eur). Walk across the street to the SPAR store in the station to buy 2 l of water for 0.30 euros. Room service past midnight is a joke, about 6 items on the menu, completely overpriced. We were also disappointed to see after full day out in the city that our room was not made, this was at 8 pm; and the "one touch" service button on the phone sometimes does not trigger any response at the other end of the line. The reception desk on ground floor seems to be terribly understaffed and even though the personnel tries their best and are nice, they are simply overwhelmed by the number of people staying in the hotel. On the positive side: Breakfast is good with the exception of the cooked food section which was not tasty. A plus goes to the gym (even though tiny) and jacuzzi on the 7th floor; and the magnificent open air swimming pool (water was freezing cold end may, but some might like that). In a summary: Radisson Blu Roma - never again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive- very”
Reviews.Author: Rottwyler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was close to the train station which was good. Also my meeting was at the hotel in the conference center. We had a 2 day class with coffee break and lunch for 20 people. Coffee break was expensive for both days - $250 US - FOR COFFEE & Juice?!?! and that was each day! Lunch for 20 was ~$1300 US each day - wow!! not really worth it. As for the hotel, the first night went up to the restaurant and bar - Drinks were 14 Euro each (yikes!) and Dinner was not worth the money it cost. Go local- find a place to eat outside the hotel. Ordering room service is cheaper than the restaurant but limited to choices. I went across to the market at the train station and bought a bottle of vodka and cranberry juice for less than the cost of 1 drink in the bar. Room service will bring you up a big bucket of ice for free (as there's no ice machines in the hotel). Also was able to buy snacks at the market.

Reviews.Title: “cool place”
Reviews.Author: FUNtravellerFUN
Reviews.Content: cool place to stay in Rome - it s avrey rare to get a swimming pool in rome in the city and there is one in this hotel . it s great to swim after a hot day in Rome breakfast is not as good as in other 4/5 star properties rooms are design/simplistic with nice tolietries upgrades for gold starpoits members which is really appreciated

Reviews.Title: “Worst Kept Hotel in a Long Time”
Reviews.Author: kml17
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as this is where some of my friends were staying. The staff was good, no problems there. But the room was terrible. Stains all over the carpet, AC didn't work, stains on the walls and drapes. Sheets were like sandpaper and to top it off every night like clock work our power to the room was shut off. So when we returned late at night we had to call maintenance to turn the power supply back on. Other than the train station, there is not much around this hotel and I don't see a plus to staying here at all.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother - Terrible Hotel in Terrible Area!!”
Reviews.Author: VirtueFor
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is very close to the Termini station - this is advantage and disadvantage. If you come in on the Leonardo Express from Fiumicino you see the hotel as you pull into the station so it is very easy to locate. However, you are right next to all the problems that come with being next to the main train station - you can always hear the trains in the hotel, and at night it's not the nicest place to be next too. If you are going to use the Metro you are better off getting the train from Vittorio Emanuele - its no further to walk and you miss the people hassling you at the ticket machines at Termini. The location of the hotel isn't great, very run down area. Be warned the local restaurants are not great either and some of them charge 15% service charges!! La Vecchia Conca on Via Carlo Alberto is very good and service charge is only two Euro's each. At your peril eat or drink at the hotel a medium beer is 8 euros, and a glass of wine 9 - Breakfast is 25 euros each but they try to sell you it at 15 euros if you commit to having it every morning in the hotel. The rooms are trying to be ultra modern but they fail - your shower is at the end of the bed on the same base unit - and it's right opposite the door so if your wireless stops working (which ours did) and you have to call to get it fixed make sure your partner isn't in the shower when they call as the shower curtains are see through! The WC is quite a small and we found ours always had a lingering 'pee pee' smell - this was the 2nd room as the 1st room the blind didn't work and the celing was yellow with damp. Overall I think this hotel isn't worth the hassle - it is no way 5* it's more like a 1* - we booked with Last Minute and this was their top secret 5* hotel - if we were to go to Rome again I would book to stay in Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain area. You won't feel safe walking around the Termini at night, and you are constantly hassled when you are eating by street vendors.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as i thought it would be from the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: EmmyandMatty
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights with my partner and we have managed to get a discount of 30% through an agency so the price was ok by Rome standards. I have been to Rome before and know that the hotel rooms are always extremly small and usually very old and dirty (unless paying the big dollars of course), so i didn't have high standards for this hotel before arriving. However, the hotel is extremly modern and clean as was our room (we on on the 3rd floor facing towards the train station). Our room was very tiny though expected that so wasn't concerned that much. We made excellent use of the fantastic jacuzzi they have there that looks out towards the city, though the pool being seasonal was closed and doesn't open again until June so that was a bit disapointing. Especially as it was hot and wasn't clearly advertised on their website when it is open and closed. The only downside of the stay was that after you've had a shower, water leaks through the room and we also had a little bit of water leaking from the room above us. It did slightly wet a couple of clothes we had hanging on a rack and when we complained, they offered to move us rooms and gave us a bottle of wine and a fruit platter which was lovely!! Our bed was comfty as well, though the pillows were a but too squishy, but you get four on the bed so once they are doubled up its fine. The blinds blocked out every bit of light from outside and we could hardly hear any noise from outside. If you can get a discount for this hotel and don't plan on staying too long, its not a bad stay and in a good location being right next to the termini. The pool would be gorgeous to use in the summer too! I definetly wouldn't pay full price for this place as they do charge way too much for what you get. Overall, quite happy with stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Michael-Rachel
Reviews.Content: Having read tripadvisor reviews of this hotel we were shifting uneasily, however, when we arrived we were more than pleasantly surprised with what we found. Our room on the 6th floor was spotless; crisp white sheets, plasma tv; espresso machine and modern sanitary ware. The design which was contemporary and the minimalism suited us to a tee. Overall the staff, from the moment we arrived to the moment we checked out, looked after our every need. Even on the one occassion that the cleaning staff took a tin of coke from the fridge belonging to us it was instantly replaced. The rooms were cleaned every day with espresso machine restocked with no qualm. Location wise we travelled from Fuimincino airport and the train arrived at the Termini exit which was located 30 seconds across the road from the hotel. Moreover Santa Maria Maggiore basillica and the Republica were only 7-10 mins walk with the Colosseum a further 15 mins away should you wish to walk as opposed to the open top bus tour that we opted for. Overall the Radisson offered everything we were after: Good location, cleanliness, value for money and comfort. Although the pool was closed for repair (only opened during summer) the rooftop offered awesome urban views to enjoy in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “shabby not chic”
Reviews.Author: reviewer12359
Reviews.Content: Our room hadn't been cleaned properly (the carpet reminded me of student accommodation with bleach stains and paint chips on the floor ) . The shower leaked from under the door into the bedroom and onto the carpet and water had risen up the skirting board and into the now-peeling plaster.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Front Desk - Noisy Room”
Reviews.Author: ATEMHZ
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 11 p.m. after a long day. The lady on front desk (Michela) insisted I had n't paid for breakfast. When I spoke to my colleague about this she told me that she could "hear me" disagreeing with what she had said. We produced a paper copy of the hotel coupon from the travel company clearly stating bed and breakfast. Eventually I said she should check with the travel company and we would clear it up the following day. I was advised the following morning that breakfast would be charged which was eventually accepted as included. The lady could not bring herself to confirm that I had paid for breakfast and to apologise for her rudeness. The rooms were exceptionally noisy on the train station side of the hotel. This is a 5 star hotel, the money would have been better spent on proper acoustic treatment than flouncy design features. Mistake made once - never again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were like a run-down locker room”
Reviews.Author: kbogh
Reviews.Content: This place honestly made me long for a Best Western or even a Motel 6, that's how bad it was. First of all, I didn't care for the space age design; even if the hotel had been brand new, I don't want a room with a rubber floor, a shower enclosed in a thin circular curtain smack in the middle of the room, and an exposed rod with hangers on it serving as an open-air closet. On top of that, one of my rooms (yes I tried 3 of them) had no countertop next to the sink, and all rooms had a contoured plastic "desk" with a bench bolted on that was supposed to swing out to allow you to sit facing the desktop were it not for the shag rug next to the bed getting in the way. But even if a person were okay with the design aesthetic, they would have to concede that this pathetic attempt at minimalist chic is well past it's prime with the doors and desk coming apart, a showerhead that squirted more water sideways out of the joint between showerhead and pipe than out of the head itself, and the musty odor of funky shower curtain permeating the room. Add a bed that's hard as a rock and the blare of train announcements from a window facing the rail station, and you have a complete picture of my misery. To add insult to injury, I ordered room service for breakfast and after waiting an hour, I called back down to inquire and they said the kitchen had my order but had not recorded which room it was for. By the time they delivered it I barely had time to eat before my meeting and upon lifting the lid after the attendant had left, I discovered that instead of my order of eggs and fruit, they had only brought fruit but alas no time to fix the error. The meeting rooms were okay, the one we were in was quite large, the AV worked fine and the beverage and snack service was well tended. I have to question the cleanliness since we discovered a trail of congealed prosciutto on the floor near the windows at one point. The lunch buffet was okay, but not worth the exhorbitant amount they were charging us. A couple of the staff were very nice and helpful such as Vincenzo at the front desk who helped me move from my room facing the train to one on the other side that had a glass shower instead of the karate kid curtain, and the maintenance man who fixed the power outage in my room. Most other staff were brusque or apathetic. Bottom line: if you're going to spend this much, you are better off staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hotel experience in my life”
Reviews.Author: cuscret
Reviews.Content: We were at Radisson Hotel Rome from 14 to 17 February 2011. We choosed this hotel because we have been to many other Radisson Hotels ,and we were impressed by service and all the amenities.The Radisson in Rome is by far the worst of the chain.First of all the rooms:the design is so uncomfortable and unpractical:the shower (if we can call it like this) is in the middle of the room,right on the back of the bed.no privacy at all,like when you go to the toilette,divided by a semitransparent glass,you can see everything the other person does...No chairs,no shelfs ,such a small basin with no space to put even the toothbrush.The fridge not working,the tent to isolate yourself from outside view broken.In addition, since it was my wife`s birthday, I asked to bring the cake in the morning.We found the cake only at midnight,when the day was over and I already had birthday cake and dinner in another place.The key card not working everyday (got to go to reception every night to activate card).Drinks (I mean mostly water and soft drinks) are so expensive (we live in Norway so have clear the concept of expensive) from minibar (and as I said not working).There are so many nice small hotels in Rome,believe me,even if they are 3 star they will be better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with functionally challenging room”
Reviews.Author: cn14
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went to Rome for the first time for an intensive sightseeing long weekend. We booked this hotel on internet and got 10% off. Since none of us has been to Rome before and we were going to have a very intensive schedule for visiting many sites, so location and comfortable room was of primary consideration for us. Before the trip, I read on TripAdvisor about this hotel, many criticizing its location for being too close to the sleazy Termini. And its dysfunctional over-designed room amenities. We took the Leonardo Express from Rome's Fiumicino Airport to Termini Station. If you sit by the left side of the windows in the train along its moving direction, you will see Radisson Blu Hotel right by the rail when the train approaches Termini. What you must do is not to walk to Termini's main exit, which is about 5-10 minutes walk. You should take the first exit downstairs you see, very close to the front end of the train, where you will see one exit to Cafeteria, the other to Via G. Giolitti. Take the one to Giolitti, go down and turn right, you will enter a small hallway. Exit it and cross the Via Giolitti, walking along Mamiani, the hotel is just one block away, and will take you no longer than 3 minutes to walk from the train. I'd say, if you take Leonardo Express to the city, this hotel is the closest you can get. The metro station Termini is actually 10 minutes by walk from this hotel. The closest Metro station is Vittorio E, which is 2-3 minutes walk. The hotel should make this location more evident on its internet site. I guess many guests have made the mistake by taking the metro station Termini. The area around the hotel, close to Termini, is not one of the most pleasant in Rome. It is in fact like a China town, with equal amount of Africans walking around. But besides the over-representation of immigrants, the area is quite safe and it is not like you will get mugged on the street. So although it is "sleazy", it is not unsafe. The check-in was done without problem. Once we got in the room, we realized why some people described it as technically challenging. The switches in the room will really take you about 5 minutes to work out, which is controlling which light. We are actually both quite tech-savvy, and it still took some time. Even the shower and bath will take you 3 minutes at least to figure out how to use it. Yes, it is true this hotel room is over-designed, it looks cool, but it will challenge your technical curiosity. By the way, I brought a electric extension cord after reading some reviews, and it was really helpful. There is no spare socket anywhere in the room. In order to charge your telephone, computer, and so on, you will have to bring the cord yourself. The room was clean, towels were fresh and the toilet has even a bidet. The bath tub does show signs of wear and could have been cleaned a bit better, but the water was hot and plentiful, and there were all the usual shower gels and all the stuffs you are used with a 5-star hotel. The first night was very hot, and we didn't figure out how to control the room temperature in the wall-mount panel. The second night we had the window opened so we could sleep better. I can imagine in a hot summer night, some people might have problem with this panel. The hotel breakfast was reasonably good, at a price of 26 € per person. The Cafe latte tasted like powdered or slot machine type. But classical Italian espresso was fine. The breakfast was both Italian (coffee, bread, lots of different cured meat), continental (musli, yoghurt) and English (potatoes, sausages, bacon, mushroom, egg, etc). The evening a la carte dinner in the Zest restaurant was surprisingly good and not too expensive comparing with a in-town dinner. Of course, you may not have the intimate atmosphere of dining in those Roman restaurants in the city. All in all, I find this hotel to be very well-located, very close to subway and Leonardo Express train. Lot of buses are coming to Termini, especially bus 70 and 71 stops right out side of the hotel. So if you take the bus from T. Argentina, you will be back to the hotel in 10 minutes. And from the hotel you will take about 10-15 minutes to walk to Colosseum. This good location enabled us to have a very efficient sightseeing in 3 days, the first day we checked in at the hotel by 2.30 pm, and by 4 pm we were already touring St. Peter's Church, and later that evening had dinner in the lovely Trastevere neighborhood. The next day we went to Vatican museum and Sistine Chapel in the morning, later in the afternoon we went to Colosseum, Roman Forum, and Fountain Trevi as well as Spanish Steps. Yes, we were tired but managed to see a lot. The third day, we went to the Gallery Borghese in the morning, and then took the bus to Museum Capitolini afterwards followed by walking to Pantheon. Afterwards we walked to Piazza Navona and from there walked across the Tiber to Vatican and stopped by the St Angelo. Rome in late February was wonderful, not too cold and not too hot, even better, not too many people. We booked the Vatican museum visit online, so we did not wait in the queue. We also booked the Gallery Borghese (you must book it!). Otherwise, the 3 day Roma Pass has also enabled us to skip the queue in Colosseum and Capitolini. The only queue we had was in front of St. Peter's, but the queue moved very quickly. I find Rome very pleasant, not at all like what has been described to me by all my friends: long queue, robbery, pickpocket, faked police, and so on. Using common sense, you surely can tour Rome safely. And Radisson Blu has provided a very comfortable base for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “It was, It could be again, but...”
Reviews.Author: pierredebahia
Reviews.Content: Third time at this hotel called before "es hotel". Very design and impressive when it was new it's now neglected, paint coming off, not any more the top hotel it was. Neighborhood is declining. Still nice roofpool...Hopin that Radisson transform these in a top hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Could be fantastic...but it wasnt.”
Reviews.Author: walter40Cardiff
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a 3 night break and expected high standards from a 5 star hotel with a decent reputation. Ultimately our stay was a disappointment but the hotel has some great features. The room was small and open plan with no bath and a shower with a curtain in the corner. The toilet had a glass door that didnt offer much privacy. There was no room to relax in the room. One of the main reasons i booked the hotel was the spa which turned out to be a great diappointment. The jacuzzi was closed for maintenance and then was too cold to sit in. The sauna was cold and the pool closed for winter. The glass door for the toilet in the changing rooms was missing! Breakfast was good and the location is great but 5 star it is not. There is no iron available and there are chips in a lot of the furniture. Coffe cups in the room were left unused by cleaners every day. We asked for directions to another hotel and were sent an hour the wrong way! On our last day banging started at 8am above our room. I hoped for it to stop but an hour later it was still going. I queried this when I checked out and found another guest doing the same. The hotel denied the banging started at 8 despite us both being sure and stated it was maintenance. I left a letter asking for the manager to respond to my concerns before I checked out but didnt hear anything. If you want minimalist then this is the place but dont expect 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place in city centre”
Reviews.Author: lcst1973
Reviews.Content: This is a really beautfiul place, centrally located next to the station. Amazing swimming pool but very cold water (although visited in March). Will stay here again next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Its_Scandinavian
Reviews.Content: Radisson SAS Rome is in all way a modern hotel in an historic city. The location next to the train station is good if you arrives from Fiumicino with Leonardo Express (that’s itself is a catastrophe but the only cheap alternative to get in to the city) and are not afraid of walking around the town. Of course, during the night time is not the nicest place of the city and you can indeed hear the sound from the trains but nothing that bother us. We had a wonderful junior suite with a great terrace overlooking the colorful hotel. The room was spacious with a very nice bathroom with both Jacuzzi, walkin-shower, two sink and one toilet. Fantastic cool design and specially the combination of a totally white room and a green puffy carpet. I had paid extra for junior suite with terrace and was disappointed upon arrival to find out we got an ordinary junior suite (cool, but not so nice as the one we had) and when I put this to the front desk attention they change the room directly. I would expect turn-down service to make it and a larger TV (it was actually very small and you could hardly follow – but who wants’ to see TV when you’re in Rome?). Breakfast buffet is excellent with several choices, and a modern touch. Nice to have the possibility to get a coffee as we like as well as start the day with a glass of prosecco. We had dinner by the pool terrace once and it was very good and relaxing. One evening there was a party with a DJ. I appreciate the servants attention to refer the families with children that brings McDonald’s bag and own food to don’t disturb the guests in restaurant. During the day-time its GREAT to take a quick swim in the pool terrace. Concierge recommended the Alfredo restaurant for one night and it was great. Staff was friendly and polite, perhaps a bit stiffy bell boys but ok for be in Italy. I would definitely stay here again if I got a nice deal, compare to other chain-hotels or traditionally Rome hotels you get a good fresh and up-beaten experience here for the same money as a old 3-star hotel in the more classic part of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for airport access not for tourists”
Reviews.Author: lofa
Reviews.Content: For business the amenities are all there. Very nice breakfast buffet, gym and great wireless Internet which is free. Location is only good for it's proximity to the Rome Termini train which you can walk to. Staff is friendly but rooms seem run down and worn out.

Reviews.Title: “Would have chosen a better location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: keentraveller_1988
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here when we were traveling in September. Last minute, we had decided that instead of going to Zurich from Paris by train and then onto Rome, we would book flights straight from Paris to Rome. I went on LastMinute.com and got a good deal for €388 for 3 nights for a double room, and saw good reviews about this hotel so went ahead and booked. On the flight from Paris to Rome we had a stop over in Cagliari, and upon arrival in Rome we discovered the airline had left our luggage in Paris, so we left the airport on a Saturday night with nothing more than our handbags. We arrived at the Raddison, and found that the area outside the hotel was very dirty with a lot of dodgy people hanging around. We quickly got inside, and were amazed at how great the place looked. They said they had no record of our reservation but just had me send the confirmation email from LastMinute.com through to them and charged us at those rates with no problem. We explained to the people on reception about our luggage going missing and they promised they would let us know if they heard anything from the airline and were very friendly and helpful. During our stay they called the airline a couple of times for us as we could not understand Italian. We were meant to be switching to a different hotel in Rome on the Tuesday but after our luggage hadn't yet arrived we decided to book flights back to Sydney and see if we could stay the Raddison for another night. They were all too happy to let us do this, however we paid almost €200 for that extra night as that was their normal rate. The room itself was very nice, apart from the bathroom and the bedroom only being separated by a glass wall, and the door to the toilet only being made of glass. The beds were comfortable and they were cleaned daily, and there were electronic blinds as well as other curtains which helped keep the sun out very well. And there was little to no noise at all. We were not happy with the location though - sure, it was close to Termini Station and a lot of little restaurants, but we did not feel safe walking around those streets, even in the daytime. To go sightseeing, we just decided to get a taxi from Termini Station to most places as that was only about €8. Our trip was ruined a bit by our luggage being lost but everybody at the hotel was very friendly and the service was great. We did order from room service one night but the prices were VERY expensive for a tiny meal, and the wine was also extremely expensive - cheaper to buy a bottle somewhere else. Thankyou to everybody at the Raddison Blu for being so helpful during our disastrous trip!

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting the worst, but it's actually not bad!”
Reviews.Author: marymar
Reviews.Content: I'm writing from the Radisson using their free wi-fi, I must say that after reading all the bad reviews, we were expecting the worst but actually, the hotel is nice, the area is not the best but it's just next to Termini station so it's easy to move through the city. Our room is very quiet because it is on the fifth floor and faces the city and not the station. The rooms need some maintenance but nothing serious, we actually like the design of our room. The lobby is beautiful, modern but the staff is really snobby! The courteous service we have received in other Radissons in Europe is not reflected in this one. They refused to let us check in an hour earlier and weren't so helpful explaining the new "tourist tax" of 3 euros per night per person. There have been lots of contrasting views regarding this new tax so we thought we wouldn't have to pay it but it turns out that from january 1st it is compulsory. It would have been nice to be explained that in a less cold way. But so far everything's acceptable, we'll see about the breakfast tomorrow...

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but will return”
Reviews.Author: Chuck1001
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd stay at the Radisson Blu during my past 4 trips to Rome. The hotel, especially the rooms, have become rather worn out and do not appear to have been renovated over the years. However, other than the normal wear and tear, everything is in good working condition. Some of the negative criticisms of the hotel are perfectly understandable as the layout of the rooms at the Radisson Blu is not conventional by any standard. The hotel is somewhat of an acquired taste which I have come to like, which is helped in some part by the perfect location of the hotel which is within walking distance of the main railway station in Rome (from which you could catch the Leonardo Express train to and from Fumicio Airport), as well as many of the main attractions in Rome (eg the Trevi Fountain, Plaza Novena, Spanish Steps - a rather long walk though) and the hop-on-hop-off touristic buses pick up point. Also, the abysmal hotel I stayed at during my first trip to Rome has made the Radisson appear so much superior in comparison. During my most recent stay in Dec 2010, I was given a free upgrade to a superior room on the 6th floor which had a balcony. Again, room looked tired, but all the basic comforts were there eg comfy bed, brilliant toilleteries and a big flat screen TV. The only caveat I would make is that I have always stayed at the Radisson during off-peak seasons and therefore always paid discounted rates (average Euro 160). I could imagine someone paying the normal rate (whcih is in excess of Euro 225) feeling short-changed as the hotel rooms are not opulent by any standard (and indeed look very tired compared to when I first visited in 2003). Will definitely stay at the Radisson again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location, very small rooms, bad service!”
Reviews.Author: Jafars
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson Blu while on Honeymoon in Rome. Our expectations were very high considering we were staying in a 5 star hotel (well at least that is what we thought after paying so much to stay here). Rooms were tiny with a really small toilet and open shower in the room. Staff service was terrible, location bad. All in all, a very bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful roof area”
Reviews.Author: 5starhotelreviews
Reviews.Content: Different impressions, but all together positive experience ! Firstly, you can be disappointed because its situated just to the railway station, but soon you will forget neighborhood. Minimal furniture, lot of glass, huge ceilings , but on the end not really functional.Rooms are pretty small compared to hotel which is impressively big. But all this you will immediately forget on the roof swimming pool which is perfectly hidden from the railway station. You feel like on island and you are actually 15 minutes from Spanish placa. Definitely, more than recommended hotel during summer time ! Even if you are not hotel guest, come by to Radisson hotel, take the elevator to the last floor and enjoy this lovely roof. Its perfect escape if you get overloaded by ancient Rome.

Reviews.Title: “with all the negatice reviews-I just had to see it for myself”
Reviews.Author: usatravelgirl
Reviews.Content: Here is a review from a travel agent. Even though this hotel had an extremely poor review, I had to see it for myself! I chose it for its location. It is a 14Euro (15Euro if you buy from train station travel agent booth) ride from FCO to the Termini station (last stop). LITERALLY all you do is cross the street and you are at the Radisson. The Termini has a few snack shops (with rude service people-but that is another story) BUT also a very nice market where you can buy food. We were able to get a room right away-if we got the "train" side. The clerk said you will be on the 5th floor, so it will not be as noisy. HA. All in all, it was not too bad. The noise, for me anyway, was like a white noise in the background, until a train blew its whistle in the morning. There are several hidden compartments-have fun looking for all of them. PS the safe is your standard safe. However, it is not attached to anything-so although your stuff is in there, anyone can walk out with the safe. The tub has an alarm pull string hmmmm. The only thing we could come up with is when you are in the tub, and should water rise up to the sides, you would not be able to open up the door anymore. Although you can't compare 5 star Europe with America, I would be very angry as a traveler who paid more than 125USD per night. I spoke to several other people on my cruise- who by the way agreed Rome was full of very RUDE people- who stayed in the vicinity at different hotels and were happy with them. I would stay here again only because of the location. The Metro is not a far walk and will get you to all attractions. I agree there are not many places to eat nearby, and a lot of foreigners live in this area. PS I Ieft a chocolate smudge on the sheets to see if they got changed. NOPE- just like another person commented. (Hope that was MY chocolate smudge!!!)

Reviews.Title: “No 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: robtroost
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is, even in November, very hot! Airco not possible and when you open your window, houskeeping will close it. Design is nice but already to many things do not work as designed anymore (light in front of windows, remote buttons in bed for light and curtains, glass door of shower, etc). Beds to hard and to hot didn't made it a pleasant stay especialy if you look at the prices

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: akim001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for our wedding anniversary. The hotel has superb design. We got a very nice and spacious room with full comfort. The staff was very friendly. I would like to give special thanks to Dominique who took fantastic care of our reservation. I read some reviews on this website complaining about noise from termini station and bad area around the hotel, but I totally disagree with them. At no time did we feel unsafe walking through the area around the hotel. We were absolutely not disturbed by any noise coming from Termini station. A recommendable hotel for a nice stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: parkwaydublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week everything was great, location very good, area fine ,other reviews said bad area, im from dublin and i thought it was very safe and close to train station so no problem walking anywhere.breakfast good too.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: geoffrey_squire
Reviews.Content: Quite simply put this is never a 5* hotel and is over priced for what you get. The style of the rooms is very contemporary and modern, but really is no better than a premier inn! Be warned about being upgraded, as you will put right next to the railway station and that is incredibly noisy. The hotel, whilst right next to the station, is not brilliantly placed for sight seeing and restuarants. If you want somewhere clean and close to the station then this is your hotel, otherwise I wouldn't go back for a sightseeing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Ally315
Reviews.Content: First trip to Rome and sure to return, although probably not to this hotel. We booked this hotel as we got what we thought was a pretty decent price for a 5 star hotel. It was too good to be true (the star rating) and i would put this on a par with a 3 or 4 (being generous) star hotel at the most. Do not pay 5 star prices for this place or you will feel badly let down. Initially read the reviews on here then worried a little about our what our stay would be like. First off, it did not diminish our trip to Rome. The room was pleasant enough, tidy, nice tv, nice decor, cosy and did the trick for a 3 night stay. Although the room was not cleaned once during our 3 day stay! Got a welcome bottle of sparkling wine and some strawberries which was a nice touch. I guess any location is good in central Rome. Vittorio Emanule Metro is only 3 minutes walk which gives an easy travel option to the Vatican and other sights. Be sure to buy the 4 euro option when purchasing a metro tickets as it will give unlimited travel for the entire day. Handy when venturing back out at night. If you return after 10pm then you may feel the ambience of the area change, although it is not threatening. To put its location into context you can walk to the Colosseum in under 15 minutes.. so not bad. In fact you can walk anywhere in central Rome from this hotel in under an hour. The jacuzzi was closed when we were there. As was the pool, so no leisure options, that was disappointing. Breakfast was passable, just. All the hot options, bacon, egg, sausage etc were stone cold, on each of the 3 mornings we ate. So that left cereal and croissants as our only choice, again not what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Drinks and meals are really expensive in the hotel. However it is much better to take yourself out to one of the many piazzas for evening meals and be entertained with the street musicians who perform at these eateries, giving you a true flavour of Rome. Piazza Navonna was really good at night . I guess had we paid full prices then we would have had cause to complain, but we didnt bother as it was just a base to visit and the trip to Rome more than made up for any disappointment in our hotel as we were harldy there. If you get a good deal (i.e. under £140 per room per night) and are only staying 2 or 3 nights then fair enough. It was good for that price.. One things for sure, Rome is an enchanting city and we only have good memories of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Brightest "Blu", But Unique”
Reviews.Author: tripfriend92
Reviews.Content: Having never visited Rome, I was advised that selecting a hotel near the Termini Railway Station would offer the convenience of travel by taxi, bus, metro, train, all true. And as I had previously stayed at the Paris "Blu" and found that to be an excellent experience, choosing the Roma Radisson Blu near Termini was a natural. Not necessarily; this Radisson IS next to the station, the walk from door to door is two blocks, but the neighborhood surrounding the Blu is less than desirable. That isn't to say it is dangerous, but rather "seedy", and the opportunities for shopping and eating around Blu itself are limited to a hodge/podge of haphazard venues. The hotel itself is interesting, very contemporary, clean and enjoyable; the trend with the Radisson Blu brand is to startle the senses a bit, create a unique environment. The rooms exhibit a clever use of space. My room--the smallest offered--was adequate for one person, the amenities lovely, though the "Queen Size" bed was, after all, two twin beds pushed together. Sleeping in the middle of the bed proved uncomfortable because there was nothing but probably a mattress pad bridging the gap between the two beds. Except for the intrusion of occasional train noise (which I found comforting), the room was very quiet, no interfering noise from adjoining rooms. It was a fun accomodation for one person. HOWEVER, it should also be noted that for TWO people sharing this room, the bathroom is open concept, not much privacy for two people. There is a restaurant atop the Blu which I frequented three times; once for a coffee when I arrived, then again that night for dinner, and the following morning for breakfast. The evening meal was one of the best taken in Rome. What I did take issue with when I went to the restaurant in the morning was the 'attitude' of the hostess. When I arrived for the breakfast, she inquired as to my name, my room number, and took the opportunity to remind me that a complimentary breakfast was NOT included in my stay. Coming from her, it sounded almost like a reprimand, rather than a reminder, I had a small breakfast, coffee, signed for my meal. I returned the next morning seeking, again, breakfast and coffee, and this same young woman completely ignored me. I waited some time to be seated and while she did appear busy--seating two other diners, addressing staff and moving a sign around--I was obviously invisible to her and not sure why. I will address that issue in a separate correspondence with the hotel. I did not dine in the hotel again. Other than that odd experience, my stay at the Radisson Blu, Rome, was enjoyable, comfortable...just hold your breath for the two blocks you must walk to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Cloudmate
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disappointment compared to other Radisson hotels I have visited. There is a design element there that is mildly interesting but overall it looks cheap and tired. The pool spa and pool area is ok, but there are no keys to the lockers to be had since no personnel is present at the entrance. I did notice personnel using the lockers for storing their own belongings, which was disappointing. The jacuzzi is nice with some train-spotting opportunities, and the premises are generally pleasant. They could use some repairs and cleaning, like the rest of the hotel. There is a room that was maybe intended to be a hammam but is now just a strange room with a sealed tap. I didn't try the pool since I'd have had to walk by the lifts and a restaurant full of conference guests. In general, I would say this is what happens when the interior designer and engineer have a big fight and the disigner wins. The engineer then demonstratively lets things go downhill. I wondered why Radisson took this hotel, and the location has some big advantages that could be rare in rome. The exit from the airport express is literally around the corner along with rome's termini train station, which if excellent for the conferences that seemed to be constant. Public transportation is close by as well as a great food market. Historical areas are easily reached but not close. If you're a tourist maybe better look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “hmmmm....”
Reviews.Author: AbhishekG_Mumbai
Reviews.Content: Our room was fresh and clean and the decor was futuristic. smart space-saving storage solutions. Location close to Termini makes this a great location. furniture in the pool area was a little dirty. The rooftop restaurant and pool is the only thing worth remembering. The buffet breakfast was great and offered many hot and cold items with a wonderful top floor view over the city. hotel staff was attentive and charming.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel services I ever got”
Reviews.Author: pmm70
Reviews.Content: it was incredible! so low quality for a such high price! the shower is... in the middle of the room, the toillet door wasn't close properly so any noise and smell was coming directly into the room. the cleaning ladies were doing their job exactly when people were going to the breakfast, so we met them and their cleaing tools exaclty before "enjoying" the coffe and croissant... the area was terrible - near the central train station - dirty and noisy. I can not imagine that the Radisson brand is on such a misserable place!

Reviews.Title: “A Two Star Hotel in the Ghetto”
Reviews.Author: AdventureSDB
Reviews.Content: It should be criminal that Radisson claims this is a five star hotel. If you want to really enjoy Rome....stay away from this hotel. It's in a terrible area that is covered by graffiti walls and poorly lit streets at night. It's not safe at night and there are no decent restaurants around this hotel. Ok...now for my issues with the hotel: 1) The rooms are designed with the shower behind the bed. My shower dripped all night so sleeepng was difficult. 2) If the shower drip was not loud enough....I had the thugs hanging around the streets outside screaming all night and the sound of the trains from the station that is also across the street. 3) The TV in my room never worked. I asked the staff three times to fix it and it still never worked. 4) The breakfast buffet is a joke. It's open until 10:30 but when I arrived at 10:00 the buffet (the food) was gone and it didn't appear the staff were replacing all the empty plates. I sat down and when I was about to leave someone asked me if I wanted any coffee. 5) All the front desk staff were rude. There is NO concierge and they act annoyed when anyone asks for directions. I stood and watched the staff for five minutes and the service was about one star. 6) I called the front desk FOUR separate times over TWO days to fix my TV and they never once answered the phone. 7) The sheets on my bed were NOT changed by the housekeeping after my first night. I know this because I spilled a drop of juice on the bed and the same stain was there after the housekeeping came. That's five star service.... 8) On my second day the hot water in the shower stopped working. 9) I thought the one good part of this hotel would be the roof deck....but the view sucks and so did the eight euro beer. 10) I've been waiting 20 minutes now since I walked downstairs and asked for my TV to be fixed. Still no technician and I just tried calling the front desk.....NO ANSWER AGAIN. STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, convenient location, unusual cool design”
Reviews.Author: pswe
Reviews.Content: We searched for a hotel with pool and still walking distance to at least some of Rome's monuments. The location is very convenient if arriving to the Termini station, but as around all major railwaystations the closest area is not the best. The roof top pool was a bit cold but very nice with good service. Design of the rooms is a bit peculiar but we liked it. Our booking was made well in advance why we found the price reasonable (EUR 95). The pool side restaurant is open also for dinner, very good food, but a bit overpriced compared to other parts of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking...there is a reason this hotel is so low in the ratings!”
Reviews.Author: DaveEssex_UK
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say. I trust the Radisson brand, well I did till now. Normally contemporary accommodation, quality service and good value. Not so in Rome. In fact, I don't know why they allow this 2* effort to bear their name. Where can I start, well don't be fooled by descriptions of 5* accommodation, and certainly don't think that the extortionate price they charge is related in any way to quality...it's just not. I was on a trip around Europe and this was by FAR the worst hotel I stayed in, so much so in fact it ruined my trip to Rome. Here's the bad points, many of which are written in previous posts, I just wish I'd paid attention: 1. Not in a great area but they do try to blend in - the grafitti sprayed all down the side wall is a nice addition (not). 2. Reception - as soon as you walk in you realise what you've done...like stepping back to some outdated 80's party, this place needs refurbished.. 3. Bedrooms - horrible - bed hard, sound insulation negligible, flooring some horrible rubbery stuff. Stark white walls. Reminded me of a prison cell in a museum i visited. Feature coloured lighting in window didn't work. Window blind, dirty and torn at sides. Shower - as written many times before, doesn't work, 2 seconds hot water then stone cold. For a nice additional feature my hand held (for hair washing) attachment didn't work either - I washed my hair in the sink using a glass to pour water on for 3 days! Love the old 80''s shaggy rug on the floor. Takes you back a bit. Nowhere comfortable to sit either, some horrible metal uncomfortable bench effort.
