Oh, and just how many 5* (supposed) hotels have you visited who have no robes in the rooms ??? or no slippers? BTW room service is a joke too, left my room at 9.30 one morning, maid was in room opposite and said good morning....I came back at 14.30 and she was just cleaning my room then...go figure.... 4. Breakfast....yes 2* like the rest of the establishment. Long life orange juice??? After handing your room number in you were waved into the restaurant and told to fend for yourself. Clearance of dirty dishes very poor, they heaped up round you on your table and adjoining. Oh and hit and miss. If something ran out tough, be there at 8.30 and if it had gone, well it's gone..... 5. Best of all is the pitch black mystery tour from the lift to your bedroom. I've never seen anything quite like it...there is no lighting at all, you wander along over a tatty old carpet hoping desperately to find your room YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED, DON'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL UNLESS IT'S YOUR LAST RESORT

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE NEEDS A REFURB”
Reviews.Author: HUNNY33
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone my parnter took me to Rome for my Birthday, wow i thought great how nice. Just to let everyone now that when you get to the airport its £40 pounds to the center of Rome one fixed price, and £40 back, so that £80 pounds pay out before getting to the hotel. Hotel Radisson well looks good on the web-site but its a no go really, has 2 swimming pools on top which to my amazment had green moss at the bottom, the rooms had nothing going for them in anyway, backed on to a main train station, so no sleep lucky it was one night. just to let you all know this place needs a total refurb, it looks nothing like the web-site and NO WAY a 5 star On the good side Rome was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaao
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! One of the best we have been and definitily recomend it! If you are looking for a modern state of the art hotel in the 'citá eterna', this is the one!

Reviews.Title: “To Visit Rome”
Reviews.Author: MasoudLak
Reviews.Content: I like Roma, but next time I prefer to stay at a hotel nearby old part of city Colosseum or Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Great quirky hotel but fun”
Reviews.Author: positano2010888
Reviews.Content: We pitched up expecting the worst after reading the reviews but were pleasantly surprised. We were arriving and leaving Rome from Termini so wanted somewhere close which it was!! Easy to get to buses and the metro around Rome. The pool area was lovely, attentive guy who gave towels out and moved beds for you. My advice would be ask for rooms away from the station as you can hear it - we were on the other side and once our door was closed we could not hear a thing - the price was very good so what do you expect?? There are not many hotels in Rome with a pool. Do NOT take the Ciao Roma tour bus - it is the less frequent and the girl in the office should win an award for her rudeness (not to me but an older American lady!!).

Reviews.Title: “Quirky - to the point of being weird”
Reviews.Author: Swindoneric
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real mixed bag. We thought that the area around the hotel wasn't THAT bad. The rooms are ultra-modern to the point that you initially need to work out how to turn off the lights etc. The glass bathroom wall wasn't a problem but I guess could be to some people. We were on the 5th floor and were given a smoking room having booked non smoking but there wasn't the stink that you sometimes get. Breakfast at 26 Euros for the full buffet is expensive. The buffet is pretty comprehensive but nothing is cooked to order which you would perhaps expect it to be for that much money. The pool bar is wonderful, albeit 8 Euros for a tiddly beer. Not great but not that bad either but on balance probably wouldn't stay again.,

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointment - Expected 5* not 2*”
Reviews.Author: x_x_fiona_x_x
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome for a long weekend for our anniversary, had the trips booked to sightsee. Had a very early flight, so when arriving at midday at the hotel to find we couldn't check in until after 2, it was inconvenient, as we couldn't change our clothes before our first trip. The room was very basic - Only a bed, chair and tv. NO tea or coffee facilities whatsoever, which was very surprising, and no hairdryer either, which you would even expect from a 1* hotel. When we got back from a long day one evening we fancied having a drink and a sandwich up by the bar, only to find they don't serve snacks up there, so if you were peckish the nearest place to grab food was back at the station, 20 minutes away. As other reviews have mentioned, the area around this hotel can only be described as 'rough & run-down' with a lot of graffiti. If you wanted a 5* hotel, make sure you stay in the centre of rome. Metro is really cheap to get around.

Reviews.Title: “worst idea a designer ever thought of”
Reviews.Author: lexus450h
Reviews.Content: The PITS!! Tent for a shower in the middle of the open room beside your bed and toilet for everyone else to see. Even the bed is on hard boards of timber and you can hear every train that passes by.The service is no where to be seen except for us when our room was still being serviced at 5pm when we returned from a whole day trip in rome and told to come back in 30minutes. AFTER A BIG DAY AT THE VATICAN CITY THAT IS THE LAST THING YOU WANT TO BE TOLD, WHEN ALL YOU WOULD LIKE TO DO IS HAVE A REST IN YOUR ROOM. Dont even consider this one 40 people out of 40 people on our tour thought the same thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Three Star charging premium prices and poor service levels”
Reviews.Author: wmc67
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Radisson Blu for the bank holiday weekend. Hotel is right next to the rail terminal and so get woken by platform announcements. The surrounding area, like most cities around major railway stations, is rough - although safe enough. The hotel has a very modern style but is looking very tired and worn. We had a junior suite with attached double room. The space was good for a family of five, but the bathroom / toilet set up is very open! The benefit of the hotel was the roof top pool where the kids could cool down and have fun. The pool and pool area is also needing some attention with multiple tiles missing off the pool walls and floors which you can catch a toe on easily. Also the decking needs to be screwed down better especially by the pool steps. The pool bar / restaurant is OK but service takes forever and the prices are high eg. 2 glasses of wine, 2 lemonades & 2 cheese & ham sandwiches = €75!!! Overall, we had a good weekend in Rome but would classify the hotel as good 3 star and in need of some love and attention, as well as more staff as service was seriously lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: lisbo
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this hotel at all except the location as it is a long way from most attractions, at least 20mins walk minimum to the nearest and alot further elsewhere, now this doesnt sound far but when you throw in over 35oC and hills then this is a tough walk everyday. However it is close to the metro so this can be used where needed. Hotel very very clean and well maintained with everywhere of the highest order, pool is fantastic on a hot day but be warned very cold in it and not an excess of sunbeds available. Food and bar very good but prices reflect a high standard hotel in a city but pool bar at night is beautiful and Aida is a great hostess at the bar and very good. Would I recommend this hotel well yes a great trendy hotel but if you suffer with walking and/or older then you may wish to consider your options but a pool and terrace do counter the discomfort of hiking a bit..

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, bad location, spoils the 'Rome' experience”
Reviews.Author: lisadele
Reviews.Content: You need to stay in central Rome - near a main attraction. If you stay at this hotel you get a nice swimming pool and 'trendy' but run-down around the edges rooms/hotel. It is not a five star but a good three star. We took teenage boys and so picked it for the pool but there is so much to see in Rome that we barely used the pool. To go out you have to walk 10- 15 minutes to the hop-on hop-off bus (in blazing heat) or five minutes to the metro (which is great and gets you to your destination so much quicker than the bus). I think we would have had a much better time had we stayed near Piazzo Navona or the Trevi Fountain as walking to transport takes it out of you after a while. The area around the hotel is what lets it down the most - we saw a hypodermic syringe and many homeless people. Having said that we had no hassle near the hotel - people just ignore you. It is basically a deprived part of Rome with a transient population - just like all big cities have. The food in Rome was awful ( and really expensive) and we were so disappointed - it is not like the rest of Italy. The best places to eat seem to be off Piazzo Navona. The sights are incredible - particularly the Colosseum. If you are going to the Vatican buy your tickes on line first and you walk straight in and don't have to queue for up to five hours (we got there for 9am and queued for 2 hours). We had two rooms and were updraded on arrival to floor 6 and so had a balcony, an espresso machine, no train noise, bigger rooms and the shower was not in the middle of our rooms. The door on one of our rooms did not lock but the hotel sorted that out quite rapidly. So on the whole - stay somewhere else but if you have already booked it will be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very terrible”
Reviews.Author: martinezjusz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is far away from ideal hotel to stay for holiday. Room was very dirty. What's more, there's an awful stink in room.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Oddball design - but fun....We Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Pambo2027
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a double room. Yes the design is odd and a bit way-out, yes there is only a glass panel between the toilet and the room, yes there is a shower in the middle of the room but it is a fun, quirky place to stay. All the reviews here mention the glass walls etc. but other reviewers are still shocked when they check in even after reading! It is not a hotel that I would recommend for my parents or anybody over 40 but if you want a fun hotel then it could be for you - where else can you get a black rubber floor and an inflatable 'air-bag' lamp fitting?! The area is not as bad as some would make out. It is near the main railway station and I suppose I wouldn't want to loiter outside the station at 2am but then that goes for most cities! It is very close to metro (Victor Emmanuel) or can walk to most sights. Breakfast was nice and drinks at the bar, although pricey, were served well and no pricier than most (inferior) UK City hotels. Recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Close to most, deasent price”
Reviews.Author: NisseNesse
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights in beginning of August. It was easy to find when coming from Fuimico airport via the Leonardo Express train to Termini. Just take the first stairway at the central and across the street. The room was funny with the shower in the middle of the room and the bed in its conjunction. There was an nonworking "contol-all-lightning" just next to the bed and we were only able to flush the toilet in 10 min intervalls. The restaurant on the roof was OK, but I would like to have seen a lighter bar menu than what they offered. We wanted a light snack and ended up with oversized (americanized?) Caesar salad and Toasts. The roof top pool was a big plus. Breakfast, was what could be expected. If you are a light sleeper and are easily waked up by sounds request a room faving away from the Termini station. In the morning the commuting trains were making loud noise.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: IrelandDeeDee
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 2 nights of our honeymoon after our Rome wedding. Orginally I booked it because of the pool , however, as the months went by after my booking and reading all the reviews on this site I became worried at what kind of hotel we would actually be staying at. I take tripadvisor very seriously and use it before any hotel booking, sometimes if there is only a handful of negative comments I will dismiss them as majority rules considering we all have different tastes. Coming up to our July wedding I started to regret my decision and felt maybe the pool wasn't the best reason for basing my booking on. We had booked a non refundable room and if it had been refundable I would have changed at this pont so my only alternative was to email the reservation department explaining my worries. I got an email back very promptly explaining that as their hotel is very modern it isn't to everyones tastes and often this is the reason some people aren't positive it. After her email I felt alot more positive. We arrived at the hotel last Monday, receptionist was very friendly , we were upgraded to a bigger room because we were on honeymoon - junior suite i think. Now I can only comment on the room we were in but it was fab, I have only ever been in one other hotel room that I liked as much and that was in a five star in Malta!! Huge 47 inch tv, massive shower, bath was attached to bed - very funky, seperate toilet and washing area and the nicest feeling rug to walk around in. Also they provided very nice toiletries. The only negative was the train station was outside the room and you could hear trains but this did not bother us we slept like logs in the bed!! The area around Termini - well I can understand what people are saying but it is not half as bad as its been made out in reviews - homeless people are everywhere to be seen in Rome and maybe there are a few more around the train station but its not like they say anything to you. Also there are two entrances to the hotel and the back entrance was fine as far as we saw.Remember it is a very busy place so there are always tourists around. The pool - fab - great area to relax especially if you are in the summer heat! Cocktails are expensive but if you dont want to buy one don't - I didn't and I didnt feel like I'd missed out - any five star hotel I have been in before has always had cocktails that were more than the normal price but thats what you pay in five star establishments. Breakfast - I cant comment personally as we didnt eat breakfast there but we are friends with another couple who stayed there that week and they though it was great. Actually even after a 5.00am arrival back to the hotel they were planning not to miss it! Left luggage - they guy there was really nice - took our luggage no problem and looked after our wedding album , dresses etc.. So all I can say is if you like cool, chic , and modern book this hotel if not maybe another hotel in Rome would be better as the style is different!! We stayed in another hotel in Rome in April and loved that too at the time but the style of the Radisson suits me much better. When we return to Rome on our anniversary I will stay at this hotel without hestitation.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: mouseHerts
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have stayed at a Radisson hotel and it will be the last. It did not offer the 5 star treatment I was expecting. The rooms were shabby and there was nowhere near enough storage space. The blind in one of our rooms, and the curtain in another were broken, although to the credit of the mahagement, they were both fixed immediately. However, there was no one to meet and greet and carry our bags to the room. There were no bathrobes or tea and coffee making facilities in the room. The spa and gym were never staffed when we went there. Often there we no towels to use in the gym and the jacuzzi was out of use. More worryingly, there were no anti-bacterial wipes to clean the gym apparatus after use. Furthermore, there were glass doors on both sides of the changing rooms, which meant that it was impossible to shower and change there. We have stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels worldwide and from our experience, the Radissson Blu does not rate a 5 star. This guest did not experience 100% satisfaction

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Termini. The pool is a...”
Reviews.Author: MJD35
Reviews.Content: Great hotel near Termini. The pool is a welcome treat after a day shopping or sightseeing. This is definately my hotel of choice in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: born2travel123
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on our Mediterranean honeymoon and we were not dissapointed. Located close to the Termini station it was perfect for a few days in Rome before heading to Civitavecchia for our 14-night cruise. We were upgraded upon arrival and the staff helped us with reservations for our first dinner in Rome. The rooms were modern and comfortable. A short walk from the Collosseum this is a perfect location to see the beautiful city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Modern!”
Reviews.Author: Iruska
Reviews.Content: It was our 3d stay in the hotel. Cant add more to my previous comments- great place with a good location by the railway station, in walking distance from the main city attractions (like Coliseum, Forums…) The hotel is very modern, personal is helpful, attentive and friendly, selection of food for breakfast is impressive- I had a chance to compare this with other places in Italy during this summer vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing Run-down Youth Hostel”
Reviews.Author: set_designer
Reviews.Content: Let’s start with the good things: The bed is fine. Not like a Westin or Sofitel, but comfortable. The pool on the roof with bar and restaurant is nothing to write home about but still a relaxing place under the Mediterranean skies of Rome. At least as long it is not overcrowded by the members of business meetings which seem to make most part of clientele. All other aspects can be put in one word: avoid! The Radisson Blue is located in a shabby area behind the station. The whole affair has the charm of a run-down youth hostel and fits perfectly in this ambient. The pretentiously called “minimalist” design is nothing then an excuse for cheap endowment. It does not only look very dated – it is! The guest room is just depressing. The linoleum wavy, the carpet worn and stained, the furniture triggered, the walls damaged by water, the lamps falling out of fixture… Nothing really works properly. The tube of the bath tub is too short to stand upright while taking shower. There is a Nespresso machine – but of course it does not work. You have “one bottom service” – but please don’t ask how often you have to press this bottom until your coffee machine is fixed or your shirt pressed. In between a legion of misguided service staff will knock your door, bringing you shirts of other guests. We booked a Junior Suite which has the addition of a windowless, sad corner with two bare chairs. Also Junior Suites have the advantage that the shower soaks only the entire bath corner, but not the mattresses of your bed - as it seems to be the case in standard rooms. The room is open plan with no separation between tiny bath and room which is very uncomfortable. Only the smelly toilet is visually separated by a glass door. Our window had the sad view to the regional platform at Stazione Termini while the windows to the internal courtyard will present you unpleasantly intimate view to your opposite neighbors. Reception, cash and concierge are all at one central desk – completely understaffed and incompetent. By misinformation we almost lost our train to Naples. Fortunately the train had delay. I hoped to find a five-stars accommodation close to the station – but there can nothing be more far from five-stars then this hotel. All together a very depressing experience in this wonderful city. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this location!”
Reviews.Author: lamb637
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for us through the EULAR Congress. Bad location for Rome. Across the street from the Termini Station and it is a rough area.I wouldn't want to be out after dark . Room was very modern and uncomfortable, bath/shower was moldy and cracked. The hall ways were so dimly lit it seemed scary. The breakfasts were below average. The pool / bar area was the only highlight of this hotel. The bar offers free appetizers during happy hour. We ate there one night and the food and service were very good. Also Michelle at the front desk was very helpful and offered great recommendations for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but lacks required substance”
Reviews.Author: 007solotraveler
Reviews.Content: A expensive stylish hotel that lacked substance - I stayed in a Superior room - minimal storage space - just a rack to hang a few things. Not great when you there for 5 days. Described as a business hotel - not in the rooms barely any space for working at work - provided the free wi-fi was actually working - it kept telling me I had checked out! Breakfast was great, pool fab - but to get to from changing rooms you had to walk through the restaurant! Gym was small but okay. Staff were friendly and helpful. Actual room itself - compact but stylish - no storage space! Shower was fine - not great if sharing though and you are modest! Slept well as room on side away from station - those on station side were quite noisy according to other guests. Location great for transport links - but as with any hotel next to mainline station a little on the seedy side. Value for money - not good at €240 a night compared to other hotels in Rome. Would I stay there again - probably but not at more than €170 breakfast included. Hotel appeared well maintained but is in need of a overhaul - not all electrical points work!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient, great for short stopovers in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ozgirl87
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for a one-night stopover before driving down to the Amalfi Coast. The rooms were clean, comfortable if somewhat compact. The room was very cleverly designed to fit everything in with the limited space. There is no separate room for the bathroom - the shower was behind the head of the bed and a shower curtain was all that separated you from the rest of the room. Comfortable bed, some noise coming from the nearby train station throughout the night. The hotel was in a really dodgy area, I would not recommend walking around at night, however it was right next to the central train station so very convenient for picking up our hire car the next day. We went to the hotel gym in the morning which was well equipped. The breakfast buffet was good and you could eat on the outdoor terrace with views of the city. Would definitely recommend this hotel for a stopover, not for any extended periods of stay as the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A 5-star hotel, that doesn't deserve more than a 3-star classification...”
Reviews.Author: mca112
Reviews.Content: Everything in this hotel is average: Although is a design hotel (quite impressive!), the rooms have poor materials, the showers are not correctly insertede in the wall, the "wardrobe" is constatly falling, the paint in the WC is disappearing, the room doors often don´t close at the first time, etc. The staff: At the reception, were pollite, but quite burocrat, very slow... At the restaurant, slow, quite nasty sometimes, not serviceable... Lot's of room for improvements... The last, but not de least, is in the center of Rome's "Chinatown" , so you can find every kind of harmless emigrants on the streets around the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - great service”
Reviews.Author: Mek69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Radisson Blu for a weekend in Rome and this hotel is absolutely fantastic . The staff was very, very nice, all from reception to restaurant. No doubt taht this hotel is speciel but is excellent. All you need for a weekend is here! Only one bad thing. Location at nighttime is a problem. Termini is a very bad place to be when night falls on.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of 2 stars!”
Reviews.Author: MatthewAParker
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a long weekend in Roma, having spent 3 nights at the Radisson Blu near the central station. For business, I typically stay in Radisson hotels and have come to expect a certain level of service. This hotel does not get anywhere near the level I would expect for a Radisson. Good points: A great bed Hot water (yes, I'm having trouble finding any good things about this hotel!) Bad points: Service. I asked for a non smoking room, and got smoking room without being asked if this would be ok. And before you ask, I did book 3 months in advance for this holiday! I also asked to move rooms, only to be told that the hotel was full. Quality of rooms/building. This hotel tries to play the 'modern' card. Yes it's modern, however the quality of the build is really poor, and on top of that it's poorly maintained. Walls were filthy, lighting system was confusing, the shower door didn't close and lighting was very dim. It was generally very very tatty. (not what I would expect from a 3 star hotel) Breakfast. Don't bother. The food you get from the vans scattered across the tourist attractions have a higher standard! Noise levels. As I mentioned, I stayed 3 nights. Each night there was something that either kept us awake, or woke us up. The first night it was the fire alarm (No idea on saftey. We rang the reception to tell them about the alarm. It was quickly turned off...but what caused the alarm I have no idea! The second night it was the local kids outside playing their loud music. The third night (Sunday), the hotel seems to run a night club on the top floor....thumping music throughout the entire hotel. In summary, this hotel is pathetic and not worth of the 'Radisson Blu' badge. Don't stay here, find a local 2 star hotel run by a family. It's not worth the €150 p/night I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: volleyballgirl88
Reviews.Content: Good points: -Love the modern design of the hotel, funky toilet lights and bathroom - Room service was excellent (both the service and the food) - The staff was also helpful in restaurant recommendations and helped us call to book. Considering that some other 4 star establishment refuses to do that I thought it was pretty nice of them to do so. Bad Points: -Despite of the modern design, it was badly designed. E.g. Shower doors doesn't close properly, and therefore it scratches bathtub every time. - Also agree with other comments that it's fairly hot during spring when the air con doesn't work, but that happened in our Barcelona hotel also I am thinking it may just be a normal thing for Europe(?!). I think in the end we just swtiched off the heater so at least hot air won't come out. - The pool and jacuzzi was out of action for maintainence which was disappointing because it's quite a nice warm spring day when we stayed -The first room we had was facing the train station, and it was BAD. The trains were so loud and we were woken up at 6:30am in the morning. The redeeming factor was that the staff were really helpful when we complained and they helped us change rooms. At first there was only the handicapped room available but the staff took the initiative to look at whether there are any cancellations and find us a similar room we had the previous night on the quieter side. Advice for travellers: -Ask for a room that does not face the train station, it will keep you up all night and it starts again 6:30am in the morning! - I don't know whether it is new or not but there is a 100% satisfaction guarantee thing or else you get your money back. I strongly advise that if you are unsatisfied to use it. Thankfull we never had to come to that point we had to mention that, but I certainly kept that in mind

Reviews.Title: “Keep your credit card away from them”
Reviews.Author: ramsdal
Reviews.Content: I boked a room from April 12 to 16 on the internet. Because of the vulcano problems, I had to extend my visit until April 19. When checking out , I paid my invoice with my VISA card. During my trip home to Sweden, I could not use my VISA because the limit on the VISA card was exceeded. Coming home to Sweden , I found the reason. Radisson had charged my visa with additional 396 EUR 2 days after leaving the Hotel, and they also had 615 EUR reservations on my VISA . They did this without any notice to me. I got my 396 EUR back, 11 days after leaving the hotel. But I had to write a lot of angry e-mails in order to get attention from the staff It is now 11 days since I left the hotel and 'the 2 reservations running up to 615 EUR are still not taken away, so I can not use my creditcard. The 3 days extention of my stay became a bit more expensive than the first 4 days. According to the staff , I should have booked these 3 days via internet instead of talking directly to the personel at the front desk, in order to get the lower "internet price". During the last 20 years, I have had approx 25 hotel nights per year, and I have never experienced anything like this.

Reviews.Title: “COLD AND STERILE”
Reviews.Author: alanpho2
Reviews.Content: I staid at this hotel for business a couple of night; the rooms are not bad.. but unless you are a fans of modern interior design I would suggest you to avoid this hotel; despite this the rooms have a decent living space; the bath is directly behind the bed in an open space layout; wc is separate behind a glass door. Good breakfast with a good variety of food. I personally find my room very clean. The windows in the room do not open completely. Not something I appreciate . Location very central, but because it is just 2 minutes walk from the main train station, the area is not very nice and charming.

Reviews.Title: “"Good from Far - Far from Good" Comes to Mind”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is located next to Rome's Termini main train station, it is not a very good area at all. I was very aware and cautious - in the daytime! Night time is probably even sketchier. Beware - this hotel does not run Air Conditioning in the rooms until May 1 - so if it is hot like it was when i stayed there, there is no relief. They sort of air condition the hallways but I guess that is a different system. At first glance, the design of the hotel is cool and modern. But then when you look more closely, it is getting very worn and weary from all the travelers. Bed was comfortable. Safe was low on battery and was not reliable. Wifi is free - but you are limited to two devices and then after that you have to pay. Service was not great. Value for the price paid was also not good - 210 Euro for a smallish, very hot, worn out room in a hotel that is in a bad location and where service is unresponsive until about the 3rd or 4th call to the front desk. Yes, I have high standards because I travel a lot and I expect a lot for higher end hotels. When they fail in service quality and value, I will write about it here on TripAdvisor. The Radisson is definitely a hotel I would NOT recommend. There are nicer, cleaner, cheaper hotels in Rome for sure and I will be going back to them next time.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you need to be next to Termini, there are better hotels in Rome”
Reviews.Content: After staying in Radisson's from Norway to Seattle: you are expecting the staff and services to be attentive and up to par. On this 4-day stay it was very disappointing, in-fact I felt the health/safety of the guests were compromised. In hindsight, I kept trying to talk to the desk staff and forgot to ask to speak to the manager. Avoid room 613 at all costs! I had reserved a superior room( rm 613), but for the price and layout of this room (1 bed/1 chair), you are better in a standard room. I even asked to be downgraded because the bathroom is badly designed and poses a slipping hazard. The shower head pokes out of the ceiling straight down and water gets everywhere. What makes it worse is that there is no separation between the shower and sink/toilet your toilet paper gets wet along with any any items you have in the bathroom... and until the water drys out in the afternoon, your walking in water. (others have photos of what i am talking about as well in the hotel gallery.) Without any notice given before hand and when you are expecting to sleep in on your vacation, there were repairmen working in our hallway makings lots of noise installing wires into the ceiling. Their equipment was strewn everywhere, not safe as well when trying to walk to the breakfast buffet. Save your money and buy food at the Spar market at the station for your breakfast, drinks, alcohol,water, etc. After the second day you are tired of the selection and pre-prepared foods. Everyday the food was just luke-warm no matter if you showed up early or late. You ended up bussing your own table so you could have a place to sit because the staff would just walk right by. I wanted to like this hotel and its design but will consider other locations on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “It's a hotel, it is over-priced for what it is”
Reviews.Author: leighbissett
Reviews.Content: Service - it is Italian Service, a little slow, a little muddled and not brilliant for a five star hotel. Rooms - the rooms are lovely. There are no special amenities in them, forget a free bottle of water, forget any kettle, tea or coffee - an expensive bar with water in them and 6 euros for a cup of tea from the upstairs terrace.The rooms however are comfortable enough. Amentities - The pool can only be used in the summer months - it is not heated, just be aware of that so it is not really used. Tiny gym (and I mean tiny). The spa and sauna are fine, can fit about 6 in each. The exterior is very bland but the interior is quite fine. At the end of the day, it is a chain, there are no extras and you can get better value for money from a 3star hotel in Rome - so I would advise looking about. Every morning we were woken up by some noise or other outside our door. Leigh

Reviews.Title: “Great design - but a tourist hotel, not a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark241
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel. I really love the design of the place. The reception, the rooms, even the food is creatively designed. It makes a huge change to the normal blandness of city hotels. However in all of this, they seem to have forgotten two key ingredients. Service and maintenance. Let's start with the basics. If you are hotel and put an espresso machine in a guest's room, and the guest uses it, when you remove the dirty cup, do you a) replace it with a clean one, or do you b) not bother. Over several days of dwindling coffee supplies and working through the assorted glasses and other beverage containers in my room to find *something* to hold my morning coffee, I had to resort to leaving a reminder for the maid to kindly leave some new espresso cups and refills. In a 5* hotel? Then with the more complex stuff... if you have a huge party on your rooftop bar, which guests should you book into the rooms beneath it? a) Those people attending the party, or b) business travellers who probably want a quiet night's sleep? Having a huge party above your head, with the aircon vent for your room seemingly somewhere near wherever all the smokers are congregating, is not fun. The hotel rooms are also in need of a bit of a tune-up. The rooms are really very well designed, but are getting a bit rough around the edges. I'm not suggesting they should strip out the rooms, but the are basics that they should sort out, like heavily-scuffed tables, or the fact that my bed's headboard could move 6in back and forward, presumably after being subjected to years of abuse from amorous guests. OK, so the food is good, there's free wi-fi (always a bonus), but the level of service and room maintenance is really that of a 3* hotel, and it just lets it down. If you're in Rome for a weekend and want to stay in a cutting-edge, designer hotel, then this is the place for you. The first day or two you will be so impressed by the hotel and it's design that the poor service / maintenance doesn't really bother you. But if you're a business traveller, and you stay a couple of times, the hotel's failings become more and more evident. The hotel has staked a claim for its core market. And it isn't business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: BPH123
Reviews.Content: I loved the Radisson. It's built on the site of an ancient cemetery. The hotel was also built above an excavation of some old Roman buildings which you can see to the left as you enter. There's an old aqueduct visible to the right. My boyfriend and I were there during Carnival. On two of the five nights we slept there costumed revelers attended wild parties on the seventh floor. I liked the layout of the rooms. The shower is in a frosted glass enclosure behind the bed, and the toilet and the bidet are in a separate room. I found figuring out the somewhat odd lighting system to be fun, but be sure to insert your card key in the slot nearby the front door or the lights won't work at all. I lost the umbrella I borrowed from the hotel at yet another carnival party out at Qube - a tacky, gaudy, gay disco that had the coolest masquerade crowd ever.

Reviews.Title: “Strange place with lots of pluses & minuses”
Reviews.Author: crucio
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Radisson SAS in Rome. We were first put in one of those rooms with a shower right in the middle but, when some things malfunctioned (blinds, lights, etc.) we were moved to a much better room. We loved that this place was so close to the train station, and that we were able to book it at a fairly cheap price (for Rome, that is). However, I didn't really understand the decor (the light inflates/deflates as you turn it on/off) or what they were trying to accomplish when this place was designed. In any case, there was no door to the bathroom or the shower so privacy did not exist. I would not recommend this place if you're travelling with children or friends. The breakfast buffet was huge but, despite the variety & visual appeal, tasted awful.

Reviews.Title: “Done the job”
Reviews.Author: bigmaninc09
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 3 nights whilst on a sight seeing misson of Rome. This hotel is located right next to the termini station and approx 10 minute down hill walk from the Colosseum. Has a Spar convienience store, internet cafe, Terravsion cafe (coach company and really cheap) just across the road. Dont eat at the hotel unless your loaded as there are lots of authentic side street Italien restaurants every where! The surroundings arent scary, its a CITY! lots of different people and cultures walking around at all hours, everyone seemed friendly to me. The hotel have these A3 sized maps of Rome which you can just ask for at reception, they are great and easy to follow, i used this map for the entire trip. Breakfast was great with a wide selection of cereal, fruit, tea, coffee and a full english (not as good as the ones you get in the UK). People on here moan to much about pointless things such as " there was a stain on the carpet" or " the sink had a chip in it" GET REAL! its a nice hotel, comfy bed, hot shower and a good breakfast. Your in ROME, how long do you want to be stuck indoors for, go out and enjoy the city! ciao

Reviews.Title: “Good value and excellent atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: SwedishNc
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blue Es. is a unique hotel. Very modern and interesting architecture, with restaurant and and pool area on the roof with great view over Rome. Its located just across the street from the Termini Railway station with direct express trains to Rome international airport. However, I agree with other reviews that the area itself around the Termini Station is not very nice. But we never felt unsafe when walking there and with just a short walk you are in Rome down town. Rooms are bright and very clean, however I agree that due to the lay out you don´t get much privacy. The bathroom is integrated in the room, however the toilet and bidé is in small separate room with glass door, but for solo travellers or couples the room lay out should not be a problem. The only bad thing I can say about the room is there is not much space to put clothes and bags, as there is no real closet. The Hotel staff is nice and helpful. Breakfast buffet on the top floor is GREAT with excellent service and delicous food and drinks. I can highly recommend this hotel. Not sure what the official rating is, but its definately a good 4 star hotel. Finally, a couple of recommendations: "Cecio" is a a nice cosy italian restaurant 5 min walk from the hotel . Regarding sightseeing tours with bus, the hotel recommends "Ciao Roma". We had several bad experiences with this company. They skip several trip in the time table without any notice. They even skipped the very last trip for the day without any notice or information and left 20 people standing in the other end of Rome on a Saturday night. My recommendation is to try a different carrier, there are pleny to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist to the point of discomfort!”
Reviews.Author: crob9
Reviews.Content: Although rated as 5* this hotel is for those seeking the minimum of comfort! The bed was comfortable but the rest of the room does not encourage one to linger. Stylish yes, clean yes but the furnishings, such as they are, are sparse and solid. The shower and only sink are right behind the bed, which is in the middle of the bare walled room. The toilet has a frosted glass door and poor ventilation. there is a good LCD tv but only one English channel, constant news! Clothes are hung on a shop type rail next to the shower. The Brochure claimed that tea and coffe making facilities were in every room. no such luck!

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL, BAD AREA, GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: 2quteDurban
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern, based on the principles of less is more. The rooms are quite cool, well sized rooms. Although the bathroom is part of the room, the shower windows are sand blasted and the toilet is self contained in a little room of its own. Considering the price of othe 5 star hotels , this hotel was good value. You could stay in a better location(i.e near the spanish steps) but you would not get the size rooms or decor unless you were sending another Euro 100. The shower was a problem as water does not go down properly, but u can work aroubnd this. I found the staff very helpful and friendly during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: HelenL187
Reviews.Content: Had a glorious stay here. Only planned one night but stayed 3 despite the cost. Service good, rooms quirky but well laid out. Only thing that spoiled the week was my white linen trousers came back from the laundry cream and two sizes smaller....

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in a not so nice area.”
Reviews.Author: leaolima
Reviews.Content: Radisson Rome is a very nice hotel, wiht all the servicies and facilities. More than the expected for a urban hotel. A little bit trendy with a very pro staff. Location is its small weakness.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: hn1708
Reviews.Content: Too many reasons not to stay here again but here are some of them- The superior rooms are directly below the bar so expect lots of noise at night and early in the morning. The rooms are terribly laid out with an open plan design so your bathroom is 2 feet from your bed and the shower is only enclosed by a curtain. None of the english TV channels worked and we had great problems with the pay TV which showed adult films accidentally, so beware if you have children! The location is in a very poor area of Rome and i did not feel safe walking around at night. Homeless people sat and drank cheap alcohol right outside the front door. If i were the Radisson i would get rid of this hotel as i won't stay in any of their hotels ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobinW2
Reviews.Content: Very modern luxurious hotel in heart of Rome. Clean and with a touch of history built in

Reviews.Title: “Shy, don't stay here !”
Reviews.Author: rjsol
Reviews.Content: With shower behind the bed, with see-thru glass doors and wall to toilet/bidet, not much privacy ! That said, I've had room with shower where it should be, in the bathroom, there are, if not thrown out, also bathrooms with tubs. Shower curtains had shrinked since new, should have been replaced long ago, now almost impossible not spilling water on the floor. Room for two if you must. No chairs, only a hard-plastic chaiselounge with extremely thin cushion, not comfy at all. You are supposed to do anything in and from the bed, which has back supports. My back support was out.of-order, not possible to straighten up. Only a small shelf for toiletries over sink, this also behind bed, within room. Items had to be placed on elevated floor. TV with arabic channels, BBC World, CNN, all the Italian channels, movie channels. Also French, Spanish, Austrian channels. When entering room there was a definite smoke smell, either from the room attendant or from former guest (we had not asked for smoke-free room). Clean. Good ventilation, no odour when we came back a few hrs later. Soap was missing, did not ask for one, (as a test), we had one next day, but only one piece to share among two persons. Problems with key-card, we had two rooms, for one of the rooms the card did not work at all first night. For the other a very perfect insert was needed, we had to try several times before door unlocked. Room faced station, but not overly disturbed by train or car noise. (3rd level) OK breakfast, has been better, and somewhat inferior to other SAS Radisson hotels I've stayed with. Too noisy background music in main breakfast room, noone thought about acoustics when planned. Hot food containers not filled up. Fried bacon rather raw. Staff could have been quicker in cleaning up used tables (personnel reduction?) When I asked for bus departures for Fiumicino reception staff maintained there wasn't any, only to Ciampino. But last time to Rome we had bus from F which brought us to other side of Piazza dei Cinquecento, in Via Volturno. On same place as then there were timetables for deps to C and F. Staff suggested this transport was reserved for the nearby hotels there, possibly, but we were not asked, we took bus both ways last time. Bus is only half the price of Leonardo Express Train, but takes longer time. The Leonardo entrance (Termini track 25) is right around corner from hotel, from bus stop it takes 15-20 minutes walk, 10 from Termini main hall. Apart from this, efficient reception staff. I have not seen this side of Termini as an unsafe area, are skaters dangerous? Iron gates to hotel block supposed to be closed between 0100 and 0600, did not test this, were in bed before midnight. Did not have time to try Spa. Ooutdoor pool and bar on top floor closed for season. Seems to me they try to be first-class, but don't succed. No qualms in recommending this hotel to others but cannot give more than a 3 this time.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Should Be Ashamed To Have This Hotel In Their Portfolio”
Reviews.Author: bads5291
Reviews.Content: As a travel agency owner that has stayed in excellent Radisson city centre hotels in Paris, Amsterdam and Berlin, I was more than disappointed by the Radisson SAS Rome. I arrived for my first 2 night stay with a friend....we had requested 2 beds but when we got to the room there was one king bed. They did come and separate the beds but it seemed as if we were putting them out. We had trouble with the keys to our room and the bathtub had hot water but when we switched it to the shower we could only get cold water On my return stay, a few days later, as I was alone, I had requested a large bed, but of course, you guessed it, when I walked into the room their were 2 totally separate beds. They did switch rooms for me, but who needs the hassle when arriving in the evening? And this after entering the lobby to find a line-up at the front desk as there was only one person working. The hotel is very modern.....not something I have a problem with, but it was very dysfunctional. For example, getting off the elevator on any floor, it is extremely dark. The sink in the second room.....please note that I didn't say bathroom as the bathtub and/or shower is all part of a unit behind the bed, but in the room.....had nowhere to put anything.......only on the ledge about a foot off the ground. Also very poor storage space. The only seating in the room (besides the bed) is a combination chaise lounge/chair in front of the desk, an extremely hard piece of furniture with a flimsy pillow.....not inviting at all. Lastly, service was adequate and I dealt with a number of different staff....nothing at all notable or even worthy of mention. At no time were they able to provide an adapter for my computer.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it at any discounted price”
Reviews.Author: travelbuddiesUSA
Reviews.Content: We did not find the area "scary"; although it isn't as nice as other areas of the city. We had 3 rooms and none of us were pleased with the cleanliness of the rooms (i.e. blood on wall, mold under rubber shower mat, drinking glasses). Each room had something in disrepair (i.e. broken or missing lights, broken fridge, chaise/desk combo broken). Other than 1 young lady in the restaurant/bar, the staff was unfriendly. The restaurant is expensive and not the food isn't very good. One weird thing is that waiter poured the water by holding the bottom of the bottle which resulted in water splashing on the table, on us and onto our plates. The rooms do not offer much privacy as the toilet is separated by a piece of glass & the shower is connected to the bed. So, if you do stay at this hotel make sure you only share your room with someone with whom you are really comfortable. The lighting is not very good, so be careful shaving or applying make-up. We also have the impression that they are not very concerned with their guests. There was a private party in the bar. Not only could we hear the music from the party, we could "feel" the music. While there's no problem with the party itself, the hotel either needs to work on sound-proofing or set time limits for week night parties.

Reviews.Title: “Wierd hotel in scary location”
Reviews.Author: FMBurns1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I reserved a room at this hotel for 3 nights. He had been to Rome before and knew the Termini area wasn't the most scenic but thought the hotel looked cool (plus we had points for a free night). As we walked through the area in daylight, we were already concerned. We've both lived in major cities our whole lives, so it's not that we're not used to cities....this area was seedy. When we got to the hotel, it was cool but definitely strange. The staff was very courteous. The bathroom was SO wierd with the open shower concept - the whole bathroom got soaked. We went out site-seeing and convinced ourselves that the hotel wasn't that bad. However, when we were walking back we were reminded of what we hated. We got back to the hotel and decided staying there would ruin our entire trip. I will say the staff was very nice and let us check out early with no additional charge, which i definitely appreciated. I was proven right in our decision after waiting with every other guest for a cab to go out at night (nobody walked out of there at night), some very overpriced drinks at the pool bar (the pool area was very cool) and a truely disgusting free breakfast the next morning. I would only stay at this hotel if I were in Rome for 1 night and only cared about being close to the train station - there are cool aspects about this hotel. However, as a base for siteseeing, I would definitely not stay here. We got a room at a much smaller, nicer hotel right by the Spanish Steps, where we felt comfortable walking around at night!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as people say!”
Reviews.Author: HazzaGrazza
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back from the Radisson at which I stayed 4 nights with my boyfriend. We found the hotel on offer at lastminute.com and paid half price. I would like to start by saying that if we had indeed paid full price for the hotel we would of been a bit let down but to no extent was it as bad as some of the reviews below seem to claim. Check in was fast and within 10 minutes we were in our room. Throughout our stay the staff seemed to be friendly and helpful. The room itself was not as small as some people made it out to be. We had a standard room with a bath. I agree that some of the fixtures and fittings were not working and things could do with a lick of paint. The fridge in our room did not work but that was about it. The desk was scratched up and the control buttons for the blinds and lights near the bed looked a bit shabby and wires were showing etc. I slept like a baby in the bed and found it to be very comfortable. We unfortunately had a room overlooking the train station abnd at 6am we could hear the trains an announcements but after the first night I got used to it and it didnt wake me again. This could be a problem for light sleepers. On a plus side on the first day out TV was upgraded and we got a nice big flat screen. Our room was cleaned everyday and the cleaner did a great job. The bath was also relaly big and deep and that was the best bit! I requested a bath before we left so I would advise others to do the same as the bath also has a shower. We had a few mix ups with charges to the room. They kept charging us for the nights stay and for room service. This was easily cleared up with a pop down to reception. Now lets get down to what the main issue people seem to have with the hotel......the location. I think some people may have lived a very sheltered life if they found this area dangerous or scary?! Its right by the station so is really quick to get anywhere. Its a 20 minute walk to colosseum or trevi fountain. The area near the hotel always has tourists coming to and from the station with their cases etc and I never once felt threatened, even late at night there are lots of people around. There is lots of graffiti etc and if you want to stay in a more pretty area then dont choose this hotel. There is also a spar in the station literally 2 mins from hotel which is handy. We took water and snacks back to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Place”
Reviews.Author: csleeper
Reviews.Content: I do travel for a living and have stayed in COUNTLESS hotels all around the world... This hotel is not worth the money. The shower is TERRIBLE and is in the middle of the room with a curtain that doesn't close all the way which allows the water to go EVERYWHERE... and the air comes in making it cold. The hotel has hundreds of rooms and ONE computer in the lobby for the whole entire hotel... the fee is something like .36 cents per minute. The hotel is close to the train station but beware the hotel is in a VERY scary location with tons of tourist trap restaurants around it. The hairdryer in the room was on its last leg and the lighting unit was broken...

Reviews.Title: “terrible!”
Reviews.Author: meltemozgur
Reviews.Content: very expensive, dusty, staff is apathetic, location is very bad... too noisy & dangerous at night, if you stay with kids there is no privacy in one room so you have to choose double room! if you want more privacy, especially during in toilet, you can't!. İf your breakfast is not included pls do not try, it is too expensive,not to be worth powder a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel fine, location so-so”
Reviews.Author: oy-bell
Reviews.Content: We got a 'Top Secret Hotel' deal for €57 on lastminute.com which is an incredible rate for anywhere in Rome. The hotel exceeded our expectations having read some of the reivews on the site. The room was clean and despite Termini train station being right outside our window, we were not disturbed by any noise. The room looked a little scruffy (e.g. the plasitc work desk had lots of scratches, paint coming off etc but that's hardly a major holiday stopping event!). It had some nice features like being able to open/close the window blinds from bed, and good reading lights that don't annoy the other person in the room. The hotel also had free wi-fi. We didn't use the pool so can't comment on that. The neighbourhood it's located in isn't great and expecially if alone, I would get a taxi to/from the hotel at night. Overall, the hotel was modern, funky and clean. The staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: s80chris
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel. Great check in staff. Roof top pool and restaurant are a fantastic way to spend the evening after a tiring day site seeing. A bit pricey but worth it. Rooms are uber modern - the tub in the middle of the room could be a problem if you are not "close" to roomy! That said they are curtained off. 4 wings to the hotel - ask for any of the 3 that are not facing the station otherwise you will hear the platform announcements, all night. Located right next to where you get off the Leornardo express.

Reviews.Title: “good points and bad points”
Reviews.Author: Donna321
Reviews.Content: a very convenient location for travelling around rome, less than 5mins walk from buses, taxis and just across from train station (wasn't bothered by noise). the area is safe, despite appearances at night! we had a couple of problems with our room, so we were moved straight away. I found the rooms comfortable; I suppose, for the radisson some features do look rather cheap, partcularly the furniture.....but the bed was comfy :) the seating at the pool bar and restaurants however were so uncomfortable that I couldn't lean back on them by day 2.... ouch! Likewise the sunbeds at the pool, towels are provided, but only one, as i found out when i asked the pool attendant for another, he SHOUTED, no! one customer, one towel! Hm, he was a bit big and scary frankly, so i did not pursue it, but really the hard, plastic sunbed was torture! Why don't they have cushions?! The lighting in the corridors is downright dangerous and also quite intimidating for a woman alone - think concrete carparks at night.,.... The cooked breakfast was cold EVERY morning, which i think is absolutely disgraceful, especially given the cost. I'm hovering between a 2 or 3 score, the staff ( most of them) made it worth the stay :) so thats why my score is 3

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - despite ridiculously anal reviews on this site!”
Reviews.Author: MaggersMaggers
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on this site before I went I was worried about the hotel being a dive and being mugged by the 'rough' locals. Fortunately on arrival I realised that the people writing these reviews were slightly deluded. The hotel is admittedly next to the train station but any internet search would tell you that! We had a room on the railway side and had very little noise disrupting us. Also, having flown and then caught the train this lack of distance between the two was very useful! So, the decor. People also complained about the upkeep of the hotel. Firstly, this is not the average hotel, especially in Rome. I got the impresssion that the people who hated this hotel might have been better of staying in the Ritz/Savoyesque hotels on the Via Cavour. This place is ultra modern and unlike anything (at all) in Rome. For architectural purists a modern building like this could be seen as sacrilegious. For those who like that sleek, minimalist design it is amazing. Admittedly there were a few things in the room that could have been neater, i.e. a few TINY bits of paintwork, but lets face it if you go on holiday how much time do you actually spend in the room? One final note however on the room. the person who complained about only having BBC news on the TV, really, there was also CNN but do you honestly go on holiday to another country to watch English TV? The thought of only having two English TV channels seemed like startling logic to me! Also in terms of facilities the library where breakfast is served and the pool are both excellent parts of the hotel! I was amazed to read the reviews of the staff being unhelful! Every member of staff from the concierge to housekeeping and porters were flawless. They helped with every query and were fluent in English (for when my Italian broke down!) and could not be recommended highly enough. Maybe the people who found them unhelpful were making their lives difficult? Who is to say? The location. Despite the reviews I realised that the hotel was not miles away from the Colloseum and central Rome. We found that by walking along Via di Giovanni and Via Cavour we were at the Colloseum within 15 minutes. This was not a long walk and actually was a great way to really suss out and see the 'everyday' parts of Rome! Finally the people around the hotel. I was concerned by the area being described as rough. It became apparent quite early on what was meant. Unfortunately it seems that by rough the writers of certain reviews meant ethnic minorities who live and work in Rome who, after work, socialise with their friends by having a drink along the streets (remember that there is no law against this in Italy). This to me seemed perfectly sociable and non-threatening. We walked through this area a lot of times and never once felt unsafe! I find that when I am on holiday that I like to enjoy the city rather than cast judgements on the locals. For me, the area was just like walking through areas of London, a suburb full of different cultures and everyday people who work hard and relax at the end of the day. Ultimately I can sum the stay up in one sentence: Cool hotel, superb design and furnishings, good service, friendly and helpful staff excellent facilities and a lot of misguided, hype driven reviews on this site. I can't reccomend this hotel highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good but not close to centre”
Reviews.Author: 2572dave
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine in itself, service was acceptable. Rooms have been done to a modern standard with frosted glass everywhere and modern fittings. Although some of these had started to break. Location of the hotel was the main issue why i wouldnt recommend to a friend. Close to the train station - you could hear the annocements. and the area that it was in was covered in grafitti and no too wasy on the eye when compared to the rest of Rome. Once away from this area, Rome was completly different

Reviews.Title: “Great for a hot summer!”
Reviews.Author: Eli555
Reviews.Content: During my stay in Rome there was a heatwave coming up from Africa with temperatures up to 40 degrees celcius! It was impossibly to go sightseeing during the day so we spend many hours on the rooftop pool which Im SO HAPPY that we had. I dont know how we otherwise would have endured the extremely hot days! There is a "lifeguard" in the poolarea handing out towels, and if all the sunbeds are occupied you can get a matress from him. Big enough pool and lovely atmosphere, I loved it!! The rooms are quite small, funky interior but not functional. In room safe, good A/C, free wireless internet. The breakfast was disgusting, we had it included in the room but actually went out for breakfast. The historical citycenter is a 15min walk , there is a metro 5 min from the hotel and Termini station just around the corner. All in all I would say its a great hotel for a warm summer, since you would spend alot of time at the rooftop pool or outside. For the winter I would recommend something closer to the hostorical center.

Reviews.Title: “Rough neighborhood, odd hotel”
Reviews.Author: MississTravel
Reviews.Content: The neighborhood is not great, but on the plus side, you're right across the street from the airport train terminal -- it took us no more than 10 minutes from the time we left the hotel til the time we were on the train, including a few minutes of grappling with the ticket-dispensing machine (don't forget to stamp your ticket before you board your train!). Otherwise, we took the metro once, in the morning, and then stuck to cabs the rest of the time. The hotel itself looks like it was built in the '60s with a "futuristic" theme. There is no privacy in the rooms -- a smoked glass door to the bathroom, and the shower in the middle of the room. The shower curtain doesn't close all the way -- so the floor outside the shower is wet by the time you're done -- and the shower also doesn't drain well, so you're standing in your own shower water most of the time -- it was so gross, I only showered once in the room during our stay and then tried to use the pool's shower room, which was equally yucky. I still get the skeeves thinking about it. The pool is nice except that it seems like a popular spot for Italians to have business lunches and after-work drinks, and I'm not a big fan of cavorting around in my bathing suit in front of people in business suits. Staff was OK. Never tried the restaurant because it was crazy-expensive. Honestly, the best part of the whole hotel was how easy it was to get to the airport train.

Reviews.Title: “Never, never, ever again!”
Reviews.Author: Duvidel
Reviews.Content: A cold, spartan, functional hotel with the least friendly and helpful staff it has ever been my misfortune to encounter.

Reviews.Title: “past its sell by date”
Reviews.Author: merseysidecaz
Reviews.Content: I actually found 10 fauilts with the room, from tv remote not working to no hot water from shower head and mould growing around the bath/shower screen. The funcky furniture was uncomfortable and in most cases dirty. The bed was comfortable & the air con. worked well. Breakfast was always served cold inspite of their efforts to keep it warm using oil burning candles. How many stars does this hotel boast? My rating 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely designed, comfi bed, but overall dissapointing for Raddisson.”
Reviews.Author: FrqntTrvllr72
Reviews.Content: Despite of the negative comments about the rooms, I did like the design, although I admit the rooms are (too) small (for the price). The bed was very comfortable like I'm used to in Raddisson hotels. Fridge and the funny blow up lamp not working. Reception staff downstairs very polite and friendly (didn't test what they are like if you have any complaints). I loved the rooftop-bar and pool, but the service at this bar was terrible. I walked to the bar to order because the waiters considered making up the empty tables more important than serving customers.. Don't order the Eur 10 'Fresh fruit cocktail' if you expect freshly squeezed juices in it. A disadvantage about the beautiful pool is that it's opened from 9 am - 7 pm which means that business people are unlikely to have the possibility to use it before/after work. We went for a swim at 7.15 pm, but the pool was closed already :( The location could be more central (not at walking distance from Trastevere/ Piazza di Fiori/ Piazzi di Popolo). And I wouldn't feel comfortable walking in the shabby streets around the hotel alone at night (being a woman). Wi-fi in room was quite slow.

Reviews.Title: “Very funky and enjoyable but there could be better attention to the customers”
Reviews.Author: DinkyN
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel (despite some of the reviews on tripadvisor) because I wanted a reasonably priced hotel in Rome with a sun lounging area and pool. It is in easy walking distance of most of the sights in Rome, I used public transport to get to the Vatican but otherwise I walked everywhere. The room was very funky and suited my taste, I thought it was fun. The staff were mixed but generally good with one or two exceptions. When I arrived they had given me a room overlooking the train station, I explained that I was on holiday and didnt want the noise of the trains in the morning so they moved me to the other side of the hotel with no problems. I was not bothered by any noise from the market nor the station. The hotel wasn't particularly busy which meant the atmosphere in the evenings wasn't great so I generally went out, I agree that it is not in the nicest area of Rome but I felt safe and was happy to walk on my own, a couple of times when it was very late and dark I easily got a taxi and it was pretty cheap. The biggest dissappointment that I had was that the pool was closed for maintenance. This was extremely frustrating because I had specifically asked before I booked whether the pool would be open for the duration of my stay and was told yes. When I complianed the man on reception was very apologetic, he explained that it was emergency maintenance and then credited all of the extras that I had charged to the room (about the equivalent of 1 nights stay) and also organised for me to keep my room late on the day of departure. I was very happy with this gesture as an apology. The hotel is really easy to get to using the train from the airport which is much better value than a taxi, it was very easy to find following the directions that the hotel emailed me.

Reviews.Title: “The Jetsons go to Prison”
Reviews.Author: Jonster112
Reviews.Content: "That's your hotel up ahead," the cabbie said as we headed down a narrow Roman strada. "You mean the one that looks like a prison?" "Yes," he laughed. "That one." "Do they issue numbered jumpsuits along with the slippers when you check in?" Seriously, this is one strange looking hotel. At night, the rooms are framed in multicolored, neon lights which give the facade of the place an incongruous "Hollywood Squares" look. You expect to find Judy Jetson sitting behind the odd reception "desk" which is actually a cloth-covered (and rather dirty) donut-shaped enclosure lit from within. The staff and engineering personnel (our air-conditioner wouldn't come on) were all gracious and willing to help but I have never encountered such a badly-designed hotel room. Like others have said in their reviews, the tub was in the center of the room, enclosed by frosted glass, seriously cutting down on the square footage. In many hotels now, the air conditioning and lights come on when you place your room card/key into a slot inside the room and turn off when you remove it. In this room, hanging off the wall like a collapsed lung, was a ilttle inflatable egg-shaped fabric lamp like nothing I have ever seen before. When you enter, this lamp turns on and a small interior fan begins to inflate it until it becomes about the size of a small, glowing pillow. It serves no useful purpose but to be annoying, as you can't read by it, and the whir of the electric motor is constantly keeping it inflated. I'd have to say that this lamp kind of symbolized the entire Radisson/Rome experience for me. Modernity sans comfortability. The hotel sits on the edge of central Rome in a neighborhood just in back of the main train station. There is a gritty feel to the area, and graffiti is everywhere. However, graffiti is everywhere else too, so don't let that swing your opinion. If you can get a good rate, I'd give this hotel a shot. Otherwise, I'd spring for something along the Via Nazionale where you will encounter a more pleasant environment. There is one big redeeming feature to this place - the rooftop pool area. It is nicley designed and relaxing. There is a bar up there too. I suggest downing a couple of shots at the pool before they take you to your room.

Reviews.Title: “What else can I say?”
Reviews.Author: canuck26
Reviews.Content: The previous reviewers said it all. Stayed there for a business conference June 12-14, 2009 Tiny rooms, a bizarre shower as a headboard. I could not get the curtains all the way around therefore getting the floor all wet, peeling paint...... I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Scandanavian minimalism gone amok...... It does have free wireless internet though which is unusual for European hotels

Reviews.Title: “Please staff that front desk! Answer the phone!”
Reviews.Author: MCMember
Reviews.Content: Another stay (3 nights) at the Radisson Es as part of a business trip. It remains a very convenient hotel in the city centre (although the area especially at the back near the station is a bit dodgy) and of course if you're into design this is the place. Rooms are not huge (20 sqm) but well-fitted and with a comfortable bed. The Overall atmoshphere is pleasant but the hotel can be busy at times with many conferences and corporate events - where this becomes less acceptable is when that prevents access to the bar or Restaurant. There seems to be a recurring problem with getting the front desk to answer the phone: Room service requires letting the phone ring for over one minute and the same happens for external calls to your room - so this is NOT the 100% satisfaction promised. One gets a feeling of the problem when checking in and out with waiting times not up to standards. The Hotel may offer you his Limo to get you to the Airport: just remember it is 55€ whilst Taxis have a fixed charge of 40€ (which they will generally negotiate up at 45€), so the Limo, which is a minivan is only useful if there are several of you with bulky luggage - The Hotel will call you a 'normal' taxi with an indentification ticket upon request though (if you can access the front desk, that is ...)

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Rob_0004
Reviews.Content: Not knowing where to stay in Rome and the level of quality of the hotels, I decided that the Radisson would be a safe bet as I have stayed with them in other countries before. The distance from the main train station is great (although the area has a ghetto feel to it and you don't feel like you are in Rome) and that is where it ends. They have attempted to make the rooms look new and modern but have only achieved a trashy feel. The toilet has a slightly frosted glass door so no privacy. The shower is a cubicle in the middle of the room with slightly frosted glass (maybe romantic and sexy for a couple, but not so good for two friends sharing a room). The head boards of the beds kept on falling off. The entertainment system did not work. There is room climate controls but they are fake and there is only one setting for each floor so you die of heat. You can't sleep with the windows open due to the noise from the station. When complaining about the temperature it took them 2 days to move us to a cooler floor. And to top it off even in the second room, the head boards were falling off and generally the quality was about a 2 star level. The attractions are within walking distance if you are fit and willing to walk many miles to get to them. At the end of the stay as compensation (after a complaint) I was offered a free nights stay next time I return to Rome, but what I tried to explain is that the hotel is awful so why would I voluntarily stay there again?!? Absolutely the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson, Rome, Italy - Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ZeusPlatz
Reviews.Content: Surrounded by beautiful, old architecture, the modern lines of the Radisson stand out like a sore thumb. While close the the train station that we needed to access to reach Civitavecchia and the Port, a cab had to be taken to reach any of the usual Roman must-sees. The room was disappointing and tired, but most disappointing was the service: while everyone was very polite and friendly, the staff was clearly UNDER-staffed and getting room service required a trip to the restaurant since no one would answer the phone either at the front desk or in Room Service. I will certainly find some place else to stay next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Mimagui
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Radisson Rome in April 2008. Despite of the bad reviews I’ve read about this hotel, I decided to bring my family there. The location isn’t the best, it’s not like ur surrounded by beautiful monuments and amazing restaurants. The hotel’s design is very different, very modern, but not much pratical, but it was a nice experience to stay in such a modern place. The rooms are very simple, too simple in my opinion, but comfortable and are very clean! I always check if everything is clean in a hotel, and in this one I couldn’t find any mistake! The food at the restaurant isn’t bad either, but I was expecting something more..italian! the lasagna my husband asked for was like the frozen ones you buy in the supermarket. the waiters were nice and the service was very well coordinated. The reception staff was very helpful, our check in was made by Melissa, always smiling and helping us with all the details, an amazing english (never expected that in italy) it was the first time we were always treated by our names and always asked about our stay. The room service was ok but the food during the night was really poor, I’d rather go and buy something outside… It was a pleasant stay, but it could have been better, maybe we’ll come back

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday Present...”
Reviews.Author: aki10
Reviews.Content: Great location - walking distance of the many sites plus easy to get to buses, metro and the station. It's worth visiting the market opposite the hotel and the local mainly Asian shops - this was a nice surprise. Quirky room - interesting design, not everything is practical, bath / shower room isn't private which could be an issue for some. Hotel is has a number of surprises because of its design and decor. Very good breakfast. Great rooftop pool. Very friendly and helpful staff. If you want a normal 4 star hotel that could be in any city in the world then go somewhere else - if you want a slightly different experience with some pleasant surprises but where you may have to compromise on some things then this hotel is worth a try. This trip to Rome was a present to my daughter - the hotel was a special part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever, ever again......truly awful experience”
Reviews.Author: BracknellMember
Reviews.Content: Hotel was undeserving of 3 stars. Seating area in reception is marked on the head rest and the seat...looks like dried liquid. They are fabric though - and clearly well used, although not by us. Shabby rooms SHabby furniture Old and warped wood Lack of storage The reception desk is made of a fabric stretched over wire - cheap and nasty The reception is dark and unwelcoming Outside - market is smelly, noisy and dirty LOTS OF GRAFITTI - particularly 'aliens go home' and Rome for Romans on the wall adjacent to the hotel.......... Half of the hotel is a multi story car park - that's the first view Does not display a star rating..... Night time - we felt intimidated by the groups of grown men and beggars and didn't venture for long due to this Area is dead at night - the restaurants were virtually empty and expensive for what was basic cheap food The mini bar was extortionate - 7 euros for a coke!!! 12 for a spirit AND 4 euro for a very small water. The bath was effectively in the bedroom, separated by a glass partition - the door of which would not close as the wooden slab which the bed and bath were both housed in had warped. Dangerous. No wardrobe - a hanging steel pole with 6 hangers on it. Torn blind - also it was blackened and dirty Dirty 'tide' mark all around the bottom of the walls (as there are no skirting boards) Nowhere to sit aside from a metal half bench with a stained 1/4 inch grey pad on it.
