Breakfast was OK Didn't use room service - given the 7euro charge for a coke from the mini bar - we were afraid to Staff were pleasant enough though.....

Reviews.Title: “Overheated rooms, dodgy area,”
Reviews.Author: JoleneGalway
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the hotel. When we arrived the room was unbearably hot and we were informed that air conditioning is only used in summer.The only solution was to open a window.It was impossible to use the room that afternoon as the sun was shining straight in and the open window didn't seem to make any difference. That night we were woken up by piercing whistles from trains coming into the nearby station. To leave the window open or not ......that was the question. The room decor hadn't aged well. Plastic shelf/counter top was all scratched . Wooden bath /shower surround had become warped and consequently the shower door wouldn't close. Mini bar seemed very overpriced and therefore we did not avail of it. However the bed was very comfortable. Lobby area very bare with some plastic benches and a few armchairs. The hotel is located beside the main railway station. This is convenient for travelling by train but the area felt quite unsafe with lots of graffiti , litter and unsavoury looking characters hanging around...definitely not conducive to a relaxing stroll after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: caroboto
Reviews.Content: Plus: - Design - Roof terrace with 180° view - 2 metro lines not far away Minus: - Breakfast for 26 € (I paid already 203 € for a room) and really nothing special, poor, nearly continental meal - Hotel is located in a heart of indian/chineese district and its habitants are often standing in front of the hotel, smoking, talking, shouting, laughing, which is quite annoying if you have your room on this side (I had) - District a bit scary in a evening (there is also a train station just behind) - Furnitures design, but everything very used, scratched or dirty in a room - All their services very expensive- laundry, internet etc - You will take 25 minutes to go to Colloseum, same to Vatican etc. So for me it was a bit far away.

Reviews.Title: “A real disappointment”
Reviews.Author: adambena
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real disappointment. The concept was to have an imaginative and new design in an up-and-coming area, and what turned out was a cheap-looking design in a dumpy area of town, without the bare minimum of what you'd expect of a hotel in this category. The area is very convenient to the Central Station, but on the ugly side of it. It is next to the public market, so there is a massive amount of cardboard boxes thrown around during the day, which are then (noisily) crushed at night. The hotel decor is extremely dark and worn. Rather than emphasize light in such a beautiful city, the hotel is dark everywhere. In winter, the rooms overheat, and the hotel does not have air conditioning to dissipate the heat. So all you can do (the front desk confirmed this) is open the window (it opens about 8 cm), let the noise and smell of the open market in, and hope some of the hot air bleeds out. The beds were comfortable. The flooring was padded and comfortable. There is suitable internet access, and it's free. The staff tried (within its limited ability) to be helpful. These are the only positive things I can say about the hotel. Everything else is unfortunately negative. It's dingy, in a smelly and garbage-strewn area of town, without many redeeming features. I'd stay here again if there were no other choice, but I'd look for another choice.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: piopio2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a weekend trip with my wife, I had a roomwith balcony on seven floor, the breakfast was great so the restaurant but over the top the friendly staff made my trip a good one. I will go back to this hotel in case of a return to Rome. Giovanierd paul

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings...”
Reviews.Author: Floridamom1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for a total of five days in October, '08. Though over the top regarding the contemporary surroundings, by and large the rooms we occupied were comfortable. We were part of an Insight tour, spending two days at the Radisson at the beginning of the trip and three additional days on our own at the end. Though the neighborhood left much to be desired, we never felt threatened as we walked in the area. We appreciated the close proximity of the subway, especially during the last three days of our stay, when we were not part of the Insight tour. The bathrooms were somewhat off the wall, especially at the beginning of the trip. Our shower was located in the middle of the room, adjoining the top of the bed, separated from the room by nothing more than a curtain. A more solid partition would be helpful and having the shower in a real bathroom would have been even better. The room we were given after our tour ended had an actual, large bathroom but the shower was not partitioned off at all. We were told it was the handicapped facility. Both bathrooms had glass walls and we would have appreciated more privacy. But...when in Rome. Breakfasts were excellent though someone needs to learn to make a decent cup of American/Canadian coffee. However, the abundance of good food more than compensated for the coffee and we soon learned that lattes were available. They were a welcome morning treat. Our dinner, which we had on our last night in Rome, was one of the best we had in Italy and the service was wonderful. We couldn't have asked for a better dining experience. Most of the staff was obliging, though one gentleman at the desk made us feel as though we were imposing on his time. His arrogance was not appreciated though all other desk personnel went to extremes to be helpful. Cleanliness was not a problem, the beds were comfortable, towels, etc. were plentiful and of good quality and after figuring out how everything worked, especially the key card and the need to use it to turn things on, we were fine. If you need to get around Rome on your own, it's a grand location but the hotel does not provide an Italian experience...at least not the experience North Americans are looking for. Would we return? Possibly. Rethink the bathrooms and you will have happier guests.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm....................”
Reviews.Author: BellinaRaffy
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference so I personally did not select the hotel... here are my thoughts: 1. AWFUL Location... really bad area of town, I personally would not walk around the area alone. 2. Rooms are super modern & funky... not my personal style but cool! Although I agree that rooms are tires and worn in already. But, they are clean and that is always a plus! 3. The light switches in the room are really complicated! 4. Food in the hotel- menus is really basic and not Roman authentic! 5. STAFF was super kind, helpful and willing- which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to look cool but tired and run down”
Reviews.Author: travelwellallthetime
Reviews.Content: not a great stay. right next to the rome central station, "termini" good for transfers etc etc but noisy next to trams and the station. and you do hear every train announcement. place looks cool from photos and when you arrive but you soon discover its quite run down and tired and not well maintained or clean. room was small and nowhere to sit apart from the bed. tv had 9 channels only 2 in english and who wants to watch english news all day ? room door handle kept falling off bed was uncomfortable and sheets were like tracing paper around bed and headboard was dirty bathroom only had a shower which was rubbish nowhere to hang towels once you stepped out of the shower ? duh ? could hear the next rooms tv all the time plus smell the smoking which is not good when my room was meant to be non-smoking plus: free wireless internet but all radissons offer than anyway breakfast was chaos with lots of rude guests pushing around, plus no quality food at all.

Reviews.Title: “bad!!”
Reviews.Author: dinglenoam
Reviews.Content: My other half chose this hotel as part of my 30th birthday present. He booked a junior suite for us to have a nice weekend away together as a special treat. The problems started as soon as we got to our room. It definately wasnt a junior suite, so ringing down to reception I asked what kind of room they had booked us into. I was advised that it was a standard room to which i replied this isnt what we had paid for, we had paid for a junior suite. The man on reception the proceeded to tell us that we hadnt in fact booked a suite and he had the paperwork to prove it. I then had to say about the paperwork that we had and eventually he rang us back and said we would be moving rooms and someone would be there soon with a new key card. Another half hour later the baggage porter turned up with the new room keys and we finally got to our correct room. The lights were broken and in the first hour in our room we were disturbed 3 times by the cleaner/mini bar person and then the turn down service maid. Then as we went to leave the room the door wouldnt lock and again we had to ring down to reception to get someone to come to help. 30mins later still no sign so i rang down again and explained that until someone came to see us we couldnt go out as our room wouldnt lock. eventually maintenence turned up and fixed it. The reception staff were quite rude, no warmness at all, the breakfast was lukewarm and then to top it off the jacuzzi in our room didnt work. when we spoke to reception all they were prepared to do was knock off the 14 euros for the coke from the mini bar, Surely a faulty jacuzzi is worth more than that as the room wasnt cheap. Will definately not stay there again and as i work for a uk travel agent/tour operator i will definately not be sending any clients there and will be doing all possible to put them off. Rome is lively and there are so many other nicer places to stay, the grand minerva at the panthelon is fab and has a lovely roof terrace, a bit pricey but much better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Poor or No Service”
Reviews.Author: iaac
Reviews.Content: The hotel and rooms were very modern and well presented from then on it went down hill. It took longer than 24 hours to open the interconnecting doors between rooms, having to ask three times. The rooms were not made up after the first night and when we asked at 3pm why we were told they had until 5pm. After returning from the pool at 6pm the rooms had still not been made up and we were told the staff had left for the day. When asked to supply clean towels for both rooms after 2 hours security appeared with towels for one room. On checking out, reception staff were not interested and asked us to put our complaints to Head Office in Belgium, we are still awaiting a response from them. Was offered a free nights stay after responding to an email about our stay but with flights from UK one night is not viable and they have never responded for how many people this would be for, we went with a family of four. The hotel advertise full refund if complaints are not rectified within 24 hours, obviously does not extend to complaints that last 2 days!!!

Reviews.Title: “radisson sas rome”
Reviews.Author: mgslk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson in Rome to celrbrate our 25th wedding anniversary. I just wish we had read the reviews before we went as we would not even have condidered the hotel. What other people have written happened to us without exception especially the surliness and incopetence of the restaurant and bar staff.(we waited so long for drinks and to pay the bill .we eventually were given them for free). If you want 5 star luxury and service dont stay here. If you want value for money stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Do not be put off by opinions of the locality”
Reviews.Author: Liffey
Reviews.Content: We admit that we were a little concerned about the area and the hotel before our stay, having read various reviews. I am glad that we didn't change our plans. We would definately stay at the Radisson again. Ok, the area won't win any awards for being the prettiest in the world but it also isn't the worst. It is near the station - very handy for metro and buses - and it's also a place where ordinary people live and work. Yes, around the station there are some people who could be described as having chaotic or irregular lifestyles but they posed no threat. We walked out and about after dark until late into the night and it was fine. There are a lot of budget and backpacker hotels around so the streets were always busy and the locals also are out and about. There are restaurants and bars open until late. As long as you exercise the same, sensible caution as you would in any city (especially the not-so-touristy parts), you should be at no greater risk than anywhere else. Grafitti and rubbish is evident, and I admit to holding my breath when walking past the bins on the road than runs adjacent to the station but the convenience of the location and the facitilities of the hotel outweigh that. There is a Despar supermarket across the road to the rear of the hotel where you can buy drinks and snacks. You can walk to some of the major tourist attractions, such as the Colosseum, or take a short bus or metro ride. The Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore is very near as well as shops, bars and restaurants. As for the hotel: it it super! We got a room with a balcony. We did get noise from the trains but no one stays in a city and expects total quietness. At nightime, with the window closed, we slept well in comfortable beds.The balcony could do with some furniture though. There was only one chair in the room, which you can move onto the balcony so even an extra chair would have been a help. The design aspect has already been well documented so I'll only add that if you don't like modern, give it a swerve. Also, there's not much privacy. It's fine for an old married couple like us to have a shower and loo without much screening, but some parties might be a bit embarrassed. The toilet has a frosted glass door and the shower is in the room, not behind a wall or door. It has a curtain but it's not easy to be modest. The staff are ultra helpful and friendly. They couldn't do more to make your stay more comfortable. They gave us maps and advice on how to get to places, including printing off maps from the internet for us at no charge. The rooftop bar and pool is fantastic, although the pool was not heated and got a bit chilly, even in the Roman heat. You are served with nuts, olives and crisps every time you sit down and order a drink and they have a free buffet at the bar in the evenings. Drinks and food are pricey but the staff were always coming round with complimentary slices of melon and dishes of olives etc, so you do get treated very well. They also serve fine food in the restuarants. Our only major moan was that on two nights (over the weekend) the whole bar and pool area was closed off in the afternoons and evenings for private functions. This isn't fair to hotel guests who have paid to be there but can't use the facitilies. If you were only there for those nights you would be even more disappointed. I think this is wrong and should be reviewed by the management. However, when we commented on it the management did take note and we were compensated for the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “bad localization”
Reviews.Author: botticini
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern,the room needs to be painted, the walls are dirty, is confortable, but, the localization is terrible, near ,too near to Termini Station, with a lot of homeless and beggers, the staff is good a modern hotel but be alert about the localization,

Reviews.Title: “New Style Hotel...But Lacks a lot...”
Reviews.Author: aqallah
Reviews.Content: I stayed five nights in the hotel and I think the hotel was special in being designed differently. It is not like other hotels where a red carbet is put at the entrance, very big pictures are fixed on the wall, too much cieling lights ... etc. I have seen this type of hotels for the first time and this is the only thing that made this hotel special. The hotel failed to provide warm welcome at my arrival time. It is very hot and not well-conditioned where sleeping in the night was not comfortable and the room in mid-days was really hot. Room sound isolation was too bad that outside walks are heared. The location of the hotel is close to the train stations and too much noise was coming from there. Gym is too small and not equipped with full fitness equipment and I believe this is the reason why you dont see a photo for this room in the hotel website. Breakfast was ok and resturant team was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: RonnieIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our Honeymoon stay and were very happy with the hotel. The staff were lovely and we got a free upgrade. Area of Hotel is not so bad, and as we had alot of luggage, it was great to be so close to the train station. Overall very happy with this lovely clean and friendly hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to usual SAS standard”
Reviews.Author: rugbynutlondon
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed in a number of Radisson SAS hotels and they have been excellent ( eg Prague and Krakow) so I expected the same standard from the hotel in Rome.I was disappointed by its location ,the minimalist rooms that dont really work-for example the bathrooms are effectively part of the open plan bedroom,and the general lack of atmosphere in the restaurants and bar.Overall the hotel failed to impress and I would not stay there again even if the room rates were much lower.Ill be back in Rome next year and will stay closer to the centre in a traditional hotel .

Reviews.Title: “for business travellers who don't order room service”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller2
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the radisson SAS rome (near the termini) for two days in July 2008. I am a business traveller, arriving from the west coast of the united states after 21 hours of travel. I arrived at 1pm for a 2pm arrival time and asked to have a quiet room (requested ahead of time). They said I'd have to wait until the 2pm check in time to have a quiet room. I went up to the roof to the bar between 1 and 2 to have some lunch. The menu was rather sparse - I ordered a caesar salad. The salad came with chicken, although none was specified on the menu. The salad was made with mixed greens rather than the traditional romaine lettuce found in a caesar salad. It also was not really dressed, although it had a bit of some kind of mayonnaise mix on top. They brought me a full bottle of olive oil and also of balsamic vinegar, pepper and salt mills for me to dress it myself. So this was some kind of roman version of the classic caesar salad (invented in mexico if you don't know the story). At 2pm my room was ready. I had ordered a deluxe room, which means it is the standard size, but on the 6th floor with some extra accouterments. My room has a queen bed. It turns out to be very quiet and I was able to sleep well from 2-5pm after the long flight. The room has blackout shades, motorized, to completely cover the floor-to-ceiling windows. True to its advertisement, the room has hardwood floors and a built in platform bed made from the same material. I believe it is teak. The shower and sink are behind a pane of glass behind the bed. It is a very modern design, just fine for one person alone in the room, but it does not afford much privacy for two. The toilet is in a separate enclosure walled in by frosted glass. The room has flat panel TV with remote, but it is very small - more the size of a computer monitor rather than a TV. The desk is one solid slab of 1 inch thick tempered glass, cantilevered out over the minibar/safe. It works and the desk chair is quite comfortable, although not particularly ergonomic. The entire room is done in white, very minimalist, no paintings or anything on the wall. A strange sort of lighted shade that inflates by a fan is suspended from the wall over the side end of the desk. I am a big fan of hardwood floors and find that my dust allergies are much better in this room than the typical carpeted hotel room. I asked for non-feather pillows when I arrived at my room. The housekeeping staff was in the hallway and they brought them to me right away - communicating with me in italian and some hand signals (I don't speak italian but I understood them anyway). They were quite unafraid to try to talk to me with a combination of hands and fragmented english/italian and to make sure I was happy with the service. As a business traveller, I prefer to dine in my room so I can have quiet and work on my computer. I ordered room service both evenings. The first nite was fine. The second night my cheeseburger arrived barely cooked and I had to send it back. The phones were not working properly so I had to bring it up to the seventh floor bar myself to ask for it to be fixed. But that succeeded and a completely new cheeseburger and fries appeared at my door after another 20 minutes. I went to the self-serve breakfast this morning. There were alot of tourists at the breakfast, mostly from asia, north america, and the UK. The breakfast has alot of choices, both the standard hot food (eggs, bacon, etc) cereals in boxes (mostly the standard kelloggs fare), some fresh and dried fruit, pastries and toast, coffee, tea, juices, and a few bottles of alcoholic beverages. Other than the hot food temporarily running out due to its popularity, there were no problems with the breakfast and the food was pretty good. I've had much worse self-serve hotel breakfasts and not too many that were better than this. The guests were uniformly polite and well organized as were the wait staff. It is hot in July in Rome. My room has its own AC unit with a controller in the room. I need to keep my key card in the slot by the door in order to run the AC during the day. This means that when I come back after some hours, the room is a bit hotter. Nevertheless, the room AC is quite good without any problems such as mold or smell. I am quite happy with the climate control. It is reasonably quiet, although tonight I can hear people talking through the wall in the next room, although they are not terribly loud (earplugs should block out everything if need be). Overall I am reasonbly happy with my stay, in particular the room itself. The location is near the termini - which is convenient if you are coming in on the leonardo express train from FCO and only staying a short time, with business near the termini. The neighborhood is not the nicest, but it is OK during the day. I was able to walk with my rolling carry on bag from the termini to the hotel. My biggest complaint is the bar/room service food. The menu is limited and the food is rather strange. Room service staff answering the phones do not seem to know the menu very well - they can not answer basic questions about the food, such as "what vegetables are in the `grilled vegetable' dish". Also food preparation is mixed and for such prices (they are expensive) I would expect better uniformity, knowledge, and quality. The hotel staff (except housekeeping) seems to speak english well and they are friendly and genuinely helpful. Modulo the food I'd probably come again if I needed a hotel near the termini. I'm not sure I'd recommend this hotel for couples due to the lack of privacy in the minimalist room.

Reviews.Title: “Falling behind now..”
Reviews.Author: Tertitt69
Reviews.Content: Have now stayed here twice, and must admit the second stay was a bit more disappointing. The hotel itself has a very good standard, but rooms are very small considering it is a Radisson SAS (where rooms always are very spacious). Even though it is purposely built in minimalistic style, it does feel a bit too minimalistic at times - such as where to put luggage, clothes etc - you will have to leave it in the way in your room. The rooms seem to have been changed somewhat as well - this time it really seems to be in favour of the minimalist exhibitionist, as the bathroom and shower is now more of an open solution. Last time there was a free surprise in the room when upgrading to one of superior standard, this time there was none. Breakfast is still great, but the selection was also somewhat reduced compared to last time. The location of the breakfast room is great though, with glass windows in all places. The fact that the air condition is not put into service at this time of year isn't a surprise, I have experienced this all other places in Italy as well and must be due to the fact that Italians freeze until temperatures exceed 30°C or so. Hotel staff is very professional and service minded, and they usually sort out most challenges that might be there - even including repairing the LCD-TV by reattaching the duct tape to the transmitter (I wonder why the power plug was out in the first place?) With a minimalistic style hotel you will be hard pressed to find anywhere to sit comfortably, including your own room, and least of all in the reception area, which feels bad when you have to wait for the room to be ready for check-in. The best place of all to be is the wonderful terrace roof, sporting views of Termini (admittedly not the most attractive 'sight') but also other parts of the city (though no known monuments apart from the cupolas of the Santa Maria Cathedral). It was therefore a letdown to find this terrace off-limits to normal guests when they had arrangements there, which happened on two out of five evenings. The hotel location is far from superb - although it is conveniently located next to the Termini station and right beside the exit from the airport express train, with a Despar store located right inside. The order and cleanliness of the vicinity was even worse than last time - overfilled garbage bins smelling in the evening, as well as some parts obviously being used as toilets. It is better to head straight inside the Termini station and walk all the way underground to Piazza Cinquecento than walk along Via Giovanni Giolitti actually. Overall, should I return to Rome I must admit I might consider searching elsewhere. A 5 star rating to this seems to be over the edge too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bovi33
Reviews.Content: Traveled to this hotel for business in February - Room booked by Andrea B. in Sales who was very amazing. The hotel is great, most impressive I'd say is the staff. They were very helpful and quick - had excellent restaurant & nightlife recommendations. The food is excellent - i was surprised by the high quality of the room service. Overall, highly recommended Rob

Reviews.Title: “Not Special, But enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: zoobootwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the first three days of our honeymoon. We found it to be nothing special, but it wasn't below average. Overall, not bad for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever”
Reviews.Author: sptl
Reviews.Content: Seriosly, keep away! The location couldn't be worse, right in the train station part of rome, which is full of billboards and odd people. Far from every single monument in Rome. rome has it's charm in its own streets, couldn't see it because our hotel was so far away from everything we couldn' walk. Rooms try to make that "modern" design and are actually hideous, bathroom extremely small. Staff very unwelcoming and there are parties going in the lobby all day/night long. Seriously hated the experience!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: MiguelBarcellona
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend arrived at Radisson SAS es. Hotel Roma on 07th of March for my birthday. We have seen some pictures on the Hotel Website and we booked it. We come from Spain and for us were the first trip to Rome. At arrival reception was pleaseant and efficent, we received suggests and important information in order to enjoy the city. The room was great (a standard room) and clean. Breakfast and Restaurant (aperitif and one dinner) were very appreciated. Employees were friendly. I think this hotel is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FriendsSurrey
Reviews.Content: Although hotel itself is not too bad despite design of room(bathroom integral in room). It was clean and staff overall friendly.Not even any tea and coffee making facilities in the room, or any cupboards or draws. The TV had very basic channels, and the movies were not available as the server was broken!!!!! BUT the location by the station is VERY unwelcoming due to many down and outs/tramps/drunks/drug addicts on the streets. (Had to get taxis in the evenings) as felt very threatened and unsafe walking by such people. Urine and excretement on the streets. If we ever return to Rome, we will stay in the center of the City, and would not return to the Raddisson!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travellerxzx
Reviews.Content: What I did like: - I was satisfied with the work of the cleaning staff - I liked the food there - the number of the available elevators What I did not like: - You cannot sit in the hall while you are waiting because there are only a few pathetic unstable plastic benches (and I mean every single word of the last 4 words) - the staff is incompetent/unorganized/untrained whichever, they almost failed to do their job several times - the fitness room is poorly equipped and poorly air-conditioned - the rooms are very small and every single wall inside was out of glass, even the toilet's - the room had a balcony but what for? We could not sit outside to sip a wine or to talk because there was only one uncomfortable, stained chair in the whole room (I checked an other room, same situation) - there is no place for your baggage to put on except the floor - there is no storage place in the room - the WLAN failed to work in the room and both UTP connectors missed (I mean there were only gaping holes where they should have been) - the air conditioning failed to work so there was always quite hot in the room unless we left the balcony door open - the corridors are dark and depressing - the hotel resides next to the main rail station (Termini) so the environment is not a nice one

Reviews.Title: “Fairly nice”
Reviews.Author: Nessie1978
Reviews.Content: We had a very good deal with our travel agent and got a few nights for free, breakfast included. My husband, who proposed in Rome the day ofter Valentine’s day, had been there before twice, so he was a good judge as it came to hotels in Rome. If you stay in Italy you should not expect great luxury to begin with. The Radisson Sas at Termini station was in my opinion nice. We liked the design and the bath room and the breakfast was beyond what you could dream of in Italy. We did read the mixed opinions on tripadvisor before booking, but this time we did not agree. If you are paying the standard rate for a Radisson hotel, then I do agree that it is not worth the notion 5* hotel, but our deal was very reasonable (I think we paid like we would do for a 3 * ). The location is not that bad either. Close to subway and termini. Again, this hotel in the centre of Rome would cost at least three times as much. I suppose it’s also a matter of taste. If you prefer the classic type of room and furniture then you are not at the right place at the Radisson. This hotel is for people expecting a comfortable stay in a nice clean and minimalist design room, but don’t pay full prize, because like so many hotels in Italy and certainly in Rome, it may be 5* but it just isn’t.

Reviews.Title: “Be Forewarned!!!”
Reviews.Author: AMKQatar
Reviews.Content: How anyone, sane and sober, likes this place, is just a big question for me! I have stayed in many hotels from top 5* 4seasons to cheap 2* hotels. It is no problem to find incompetent staff, poor service, bad location, worn out rooms, in 2*s. Absolutely fine! You get what you pay for. But when such a hotel market itself as 5* and charges 5* rates and acts as 2* then it is NOT fine! First, let's speak about design. I can't believe that some reviewers in fact admiered the so-called design. Hotel looked from outside like a parking lot. Lobby with non existent seating. Prison Corridors. And when you open your numbered Execution Chamber, you find it is nothing but white box of cheap stuff. For voyeurs and exhibitionists this is the perfect place. No privacy inside as you can watch the person sharing the room with you showering behind the clear glass panel the divides the shower from the room, and when you open your curtains you will be fully exposed to guests in the opposite part of the hotel. Then, the location, the only good thing about the location is that it is adjacent to Termini station. It might be convient if someone is staying overnight or need the train constantly. But if you are spending more than 2 nights in Rome and will not use the station, what's the added value for that? The area is dodgy, not comfortable and nothing is in a walking distance. (30+ min)! At least, some one in the managment could have thought "The Radisson SAS is disgusting. The nighberhood is creepy and interior is depressing. So let's make that up with the service." And here it get's really furstrating!! That's how this hotel proves how cheap it is! I have never ever seen a 5* or 4* star hotel that employs a complete cader of amateurs with no experience in the hotel industry. They looked pathetic! A bottle of Diet Coke at the bar will need 20 mins to arrive. Room service poor and staff not sure what to do. Reception staff were disrespectful. When we asked the lady behind the desk to speak to the manager on duty, she just told her colleague, who we have seen working full time at the reception desk, to present himself to us as the manager!!! Another reciptionist was really bothered when we asked him to give us information on tours to Pompeii!! That's how bad it is! Please, do not go there! and Radisson SAS, SHAME ON YOU!

Reviews.Title: “You can do much, much better at other hotels in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jsmerkle
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for business and spent two nights at this hotel. Absolutely awful on so many fronts that I re-booked myself at a much better hotel for a much lower price. Unbelievable the rates that this hotel charges given the quality. Here are the main things to keep in mind if you find that your company has booked this hotel for a meeting: BAD LOCATION = BAD SECURITY It's located next to the train station (Termini) and as every traveller knows, that means that the neighborhood is very sketchy. What a shame to be in Rome but not to feel safe walking to & from your hotel! I ended up taking cabs everywhere which was silly since Rome is generally speaking a very walkable city. POORLY MAINTAINED Although I'm sure it was great in it's day (the 80's?), the uber-modern design feels very tired and dated. The shower head was old, the molding on the shower needed to be replaced and caused water to leak all over the floor, etc. The carpet was also in pretty bad shape. It took 5 min. for me to get any hot water out of the shower or the sink, which was a tremendous waste of water. BAD SERVICE The front desk was miserable - I had to call down to the front desk on a few occasions and no one answered the phone. The phones in the rooms do not have voicemail so there is no way for people to leave a message with a guest. NOT GOOD FOR BUSINESS TRAVELERS Althought my company booked this hotel for a business meeting - and it appears that this is the hotel's main source of business - the rooms did not accomodate business travellers. Only one outlet was exposed in the entire room - all of the others were built-in to fixtures and inaccessible. There was no real desk space, and the desk chair was more of a backless chaise bench that didn't provide any support at all. Bottom line, if you have to attend a company meeting at this hotel make sure to book your accomodations elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: linda045
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for 3 Nights (Weekend). Booked a nice offer through their homepage. We enjoyed it very mutch! Nice, designed room, with a big bathroom. Excellent and various breakfast. Very expensive though to take a cop of coffe or a drink at the bar in the afternoon/evening. Nice service everywere. We missed a bathrob and towel, but within 5 minutes had it brought to us on the door. Friendly staff helped us book restaurant and helped us with sightseeing. Another good thing - we came by train and just walked across the road to get to the hotel. Maximum 5 - 10 minutes walk! Neighbourhood was ok. Lots of Kina/Asia stores and markets (both clothes and food). Walking distans to st:a Maria and Colosseum, and a couple of nice restauants.

Reviews.Title: “Quite bad”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite bad. Very modern building but the rooms are aweful. The bed and pillows are quite soft and not very comfortable. And why would you want to have a shower in the middle of the room? The room gets wet from all the water splashes and the white shower curtain touches you all the time - I wonder for how long this has not been cleaned! Not really a business hotel. No idea what Radisson is trying to achieve with this hotel concept besides losing customers.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: Gilbeymack
Reviews.Content: This is supposed to be a five star hotel. Well I'd expect a bit more for five stars. I soaked and damaged my watch attempting to repair the shower when the tap fell off. Modern interior design is one thing but this place was just, well, industrial. The location (overlooking Termini Station) is a bit dodgy and walking back to the hotel late at night was rather unnerving to say the least. I'm from Liverpool and even I was wary! Won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location to Train Station”
Reviews.Author: DLE1
Reviews.Content: Regardless if you are arriving to Rome by train or plane, the Radisson is a convenient hotel for you, as it is just around the corner from the Termini (the train from the Rome airport to the Termini is about $12 euro compared to over 50 by taxi, so its certainly the cheaper alternative). The Radisson is very modern inside (including a shower in the middle of the room - very interesting). Its also only a couple of blocks to another of the Rome subway stations, although its kind of a sketchy walk late at night. I used Radisson gold rewards points, so I can't speak to the value for your dollar, but the hotel was very nice and conveniently located. It also included a nice breakfast on the top floor of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sedona2222
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. The rooms try a bit too hard to be cutting edge, with a lot of the cool aspects more for first impressions (which are good) than practicality (only average). The lights required inspired guesswork to operate. One of our two rooms had a wet bathroom, which lived up to its name: everthing was completely soaked by the end of a shower: what is the point? (bizarrely, part of the roof fell in too). The other room had a strange glassed-in bath in the middle of the room, together with a miniscule toilet cubicle. Finally the (in)famous inflatable lamps are harmless, and good for a laugh. However for all the quirkiness, the basics worked: decent size, beds were comfortable, the ac was fine (if with odd controls) and everything was quiet. The roof pool & restaurant is certainly impressive, but the pool was too cold for the kids, and the food is expensive (they also couldn't make a cocktail for love or money!). The breakfast spread however was one of the best we've seen in Italy. Proximity to Termini (10 mins walk) is good, and the area is no rougher than the rest of the vicinity. You don't feel unsafe walking round during normal hours. The location is OK for touristing, but you'll generally have to get a taxi or metro to go anywhere interesting: at least you've got the two metro lines nearby. It also has a large enclosed daily market opposite which would be handy for cheap snacks.

Reviews.Title: “great design but not so comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Crina S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Radisson SAS for a long weekend in March. I kind of choose this hotel over other 3 hotels left, because it was a very big congress, so I was somewhat forced to stay in Termini area, which is not what I would have chosen The location is great for one night stay and for the bussines people, but for 2 young women alone who want to enjoy the sights it is not convenient. The hotel is in front of a " chinese cheap market" or something which means all the day a lot of seedy people are staying just in front of the hotel. We always took a taxi to arrive to center fo the city instead of walking to the metro. The rooms were not very practical, as the other reviews are saying, but the biggest problem of all in my opinion were the very very thin walls, as the couple who stayed on the next floor argued a lot during all the 3 nights and I could practically hear everything. Othewise, the design was nice, the breakfast was rich and the champaigne at breakfast a decadent touch:) I would go there is I had an overnight stay or if it was coverd by bussines expenses, othewise not a good ratio quality price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for train spotters - otherwise a shocking experience”
Reviews.Author: TheElvesofFelsted
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 1 night here as I was speaking at a conference based in the hotel. As previous reviewers have commented, the hotel is located next door ro the railway terminus in in Rome. And I mean next door! The view from our 'superior' room was of graffiti and line after line of railway track, as far as the eye could see. The balcony was more like a window ledge. In fact you would have struggled to put a pot plant on it. With the windows shut you can hear the trains. Pulling the shutters down did not help and Italian train drivers do not stop work at night and sound their whistles at regular intervals out of jealously of those tucked up in bed! The rooms are small and impractical - there are no wardrobes, just a small rail suspended from the ceiling. The drop from the rail to the bench below is so short that their is insufficient space to hang even a short dress, never mind longer garments. There is absolutely no storage space. The bathroom is separated from the bedroom by a clear glass panel, which would not suit everyone. Thankfully, the toilet cubicle was behind frosted glass, but still little was left to the imagination. The TV had a mind of its own and managed to switch itself on unaided by us! The corridors make you feel like you are in a prison and the service does nothing to convince you otherwise. The staff seem like students doing part-time work in holiday time with little interest in providing a service. There appeared to be a lack of experienced personnel to take charge. When we went for dinner in the hotel at 8.30 we were were told that the 'fine dining' restaurant was not available as this reserved for the conference group. The only option was the bar, where the only tables where they were prepared to serve food were occupied. We were invited to take a drink and wait for a table. We were told that food could be served where we were sitting, whilst the people next to us in the same seating area were served a three course meal from the fine dining menu. Eventually, at 10pm we were told that there was a mistake and they had forgotten us, so we gave up and went to bed! Once in bed, we were reminded of the trains - constantly - all night!! In summary, the hotel is not located in the nicest part of Rome, the rooms are hideous and service of any kind is non existent. We would recommend that you stay somewhere else. It is as bad as other travellers have documented!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: akaNewcastle_England
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a visit to Itay, staying at the Radisson for three nights at the start and one night at the end of our two week holiday. If we had not already booked, we would not have gone back the second time! Reception was unwelcoming, no offer to help with our luggage, the corridor from the lift was dark. The door of the room did not lock, air con had to be fixed, the light along the front of the window did not work and the tv did not work. The design of the room was unusual but unfortunately not functional and you do need to be very close friends when sharing as the shower is surrounded by glass right behind the bed and the toilet door is also glass and free hanging in the door space. The bath was also problematic to get into and out of due to the design. We tried to eat at the bar by the pool upstairs, but after waiting 20 minutes gave up and had a nice - much cheaper, meal just along the road. The area was awful - smelly and dirty and not convenient for sightseeing. We chose this hotel as Radisson has a good reputation and having stayed in one previously thought that this would be as good - what a disappointment. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fab pool but beware of ants!”
Reviews.Author: Hawson
Reviews.Content: Having arrived fresh from the overnight sleeper train from Paris, we experienced a wonderful warm welcome from Alberto on the Reception desk. We had a superior double room on the six floor and early check-in as requested on our internet booking. The room was clean and modern with a balcony which I think is what classes it as a superior room rather than a standard as it was quite compact. If you are sharing the room, make sure you quite familiar with the other person as you will be able to view and hear each other's toilet habits and showering through the glass partition which separates the bathroom area from the bed! The minibar was well stocked and there were fluffy bathrobes and towels were changed twice daily despite the hotel proporting to be environmentally conscious in its literature. Unfortunately, we had to change rooms due to the ant problem described by another reviewer. On the first night, there were only a couple but by the next day, I found them in the minibar, on my clothes and pillow! I was not given an apology on taking my complaint to the Reception, rather a smirk from the Receptionist who laughed and said it was recurring problem - if so, why don't they sort it out?! On the plus side, the rooftop pool was fabulous and the dining area on the same floor was also lovely with a good continental breakfast. I would also warn that the bar can be pretty noisy at in the evening and we had to endure blaring techno music one night (only until midnight) because of a private function. This is a great hotel location for its proximity to the train station and has a great pool. However, I don't think I would have been impressed very much were it not for the rooftop pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: kgrandstrand
Reviews.Content: Honestly this is one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at, and we stayed for free. When we arrived we moved quickly through reception and were on our way to the room...good start. As soon as we walked in the smell of stale smoke was overwhelming, which was disappointing since we reserved a non-smoking room. We went back to reception and asked to switch rooms, which apparently was a huge inconvenience for the employee behind the desk. She eventually got us into a new room and we were on our way. The new room did not smell like smoke, but the white walls seemed more like an ashy-gray and the rest of the room appeared unfinished (exposed wires, holes that had not been patched, doors that wouldn't close because they weren't flush). The plumbing from rooms above us was so loud it actually woke me up one night. I'm not even sure that they had sealed the bathtub, because when I stepped in, the whole thing moved under my feet. It felt like cheap, thin plastic. In general, the hotel felt dirty and cheaply constructed. Granted the pool area is nice (if you like the constant sound of trains, which are less than 100 yds. away). This hotel is AWFUL...stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leon191
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Radisson Hotel. We booked this hotel after reseaching on line as we liked the quirky, modern, style and features of this hotel. Check in was quick and efficient despite the reception staff being interrupted by impatient guests. Our bags where taken up to the room for us by friendly staff even though a tip is hinted at and is recieved very warmly. Our first impression of the room was as expected; quirky design features. Our only downside was we had to change rooms due to ants wanting to party with us! Once we mentioned this to staff there was no problems with the change over. The beds are extremely comfortable, room and maid service is also very efficient. The restaurant is expensive to eat/drink in but there are some very reasonably priced restaurants near by. Although the hotel has had some poor reviews about the area, we found the area easy to travel through and never felt unsafe. The roof top bar and pool is very relaxing and you are well looked after. There is a great breakfast selection which provides for all tastes. If I was travelling to Rome again I would certainely consider staying in the Radisson again. I would class it more a well run 4 star hotel than the 5 star rating as advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Good design hotel”
Reviews.Author: markusinmiami
Reviews.Content: The Radisson is not your usual (Rome) hotel, which is why we booked it in the first place. The design is very modern, intruiging and sometimes not too functional, but better than many of the outdated and overly expensive rooms that you get in Rome. The train station/metro stop is right around the corner (for public transportation purposes) and while the area might not be the nicest, it didn't strike me as more unsafe than the touristy parts of town. The beds are very comfortable, the rooms clean and the roof terrace spectacular. Great breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “All style and no substance”
Reviews.Author: starflyergold
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews here before I had a fair idea of what to expect from the Radisson in Rome but for a number of reasons I still went ahead and booked three nights there. The rates vary widely on the internet so it pays to shop around before you book and make sure breakfast is included (if you plan of having it, otherwise you will pay dearly). The hotel is not worth more than €140 per night. The Radisson is certainly not in a very glamorous location. Nestled between Rome’s main train station and market buildings it is a decidedly underwhelming neighbourhood, however I should say while not a flashy neighbourhood, I did not feel unsafe in the area. On the plus side the Airport Train (Leonardo Express) is stopping right outside the hotel. Check in was a little slower than normal and this gave a pretty impression of what was to come. There was nobody assisting us with bags (of which there were a few) and what I assumed was “security” just lingered around instead of assisting guests. The reception area could do with a make over (a door at the entrance was missing, the white walls need repainting and the elevator walls are scratched). The Radisson tries very heard to be a design hotel, however this is very hard to get right unless there is a constant strive towards perfection and unfortunately they failed at this. The room was a medium sized white box with glass encased bathroom. Again a good attempt at upmarket design but unfortunately time has not been good to the design. Walls are chipped, the shower did not work properly, there is paint on glass partitions and when we got there the air-conditioning was not working either (it was 38c in Rome!). The room was lacking a sufficient number of electrical outlets so laptop and mobile phone recharger and other devices had to be alternated all the time. However as in all Radisson SAS hotels broadband was free which is great. The aircon was fixed quickly and we retired to the rooftop bar. This is the hotel’s biggest asset: a stylish bar area with tree lined decking with a good size pool. The breakfast is also served on the top floor and has a decent choice of hot and cold options however the staff are totally uncoordinated and are unable to make sure there is steady supply. Frequently items such as eggs are out and it takes them forever to restock. Talking staff, the hotel is staffed by complete and utter amateurs, obviously chosen for looks but definitely not for any skills in the hospitality area. The roof top bar staff (and there are quite a few) are unable to serve tables on time and frequently it took us over 15 minutes to get served while they stand around at the bar and talk excitedly to one another. We decided to have dinner at the restaurant one night and this turned out to be the biggest disaster I have ever encountered at a so called four star property. We ordered food and wine from a young pretty waiter. 20 minutes later wine had still not materialise and when asked if we had to beg for the wine his reply was “yes”, while a very comic example of language difficulties it illustrated very well the total and utter incompetence of the staff. Another staff member (may have been a maitre de) came over and asked us twice for room number. Why? We’ll probably never know. The wine arrived after the starter, ashtray was removed and never replaced and when the main course arrived we had enough: the food was cold and had to be sent back: Inedible junk just couple degrees warmer than a frozen meal. We requested the bill (main courses were taken off by supervisor) and left. The moral of the story here is that while the hotel certainly has some style and it has very little substance. I remain convinced that none of the staff working there have any qualifications in the hospitality industry and should either be sacked or urgently sent to a customer service boot camp to wise up. Alternatively a trip to any other four star hotel in the world might open their eyes. Pretty boys and girls are no replacement for trained professionals. I should point out though there were two efficient and friendly staff members: the pool attendant and one of the receptionists. I would hope the management, and I use that term lightly, would respond to the comments here on Tripadvisor but I noticed that they have not made use of that option so far. Sooner or later they will have to face up to reality that most customer do not leave happy!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Locket1972
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with a balcony. To find the balcony was not only unsafe for our child but you could see the balcony from every aspect of the hotel, even the people in reception could see you sunbathing. The room was absolutley filthy and very tatty. When you opened the curtains the room over the way could see straight in to our room and because of the way the bed was placed in the centre of the room everyone could see you in bed. After the dissappointmnet of the room, the service was the last straw. No one helped us with our bags, a meal by the pool took an hour to arrive, they forgot to get our drinks after asking for three times. The corridors and the roof of the corridors are painted in black/brown with little lighting, and you expected your feet to stick to the floor like they would in a night club. It's in a grotty area of Rome, although well placed for the train station we didn't feel safe. This hotel was so bad, that we couldn't even face staying for one night. I would tell anyone of thinking of staying her to avoid this hotel. It's the worst hotel I have ever stayed in and it spolit our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: rld0101
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Radisson at the end of July/beginning of August for our first wedding anniversary. The location of the hotel isn't great for sightseeing as it's quite a distance from most of the main tourism areas. Tubes are great though, 5 minutes from the hotel and very cheap. With regards to the hotel, we were very disappointed. The hotel itself is okay and the rooms are modern but very small. We had a balcony which was very public and everyone can see you from the breakfast/dinner area so there wasn't a lot of privacy. It is definitely not value for money!! As for the bar staff - customer service was non existent!! We had to wait at least ten minutes if not longer to attract the bar staffs attention and then even longer for the drinks. On quite a few occasions we gave up asking for our bill and actually went over and paid at the bar. It wasn't exactly busy, the bar staff didn't seem interested and quite often were just chatting and avoiding customers eye contact! It was quite frustrating!! Breakfast was okay with a fair choice but the hot food wasn't very appetising!! As for the pool, we didn't even go in the pool as it was very dirty! It looked like it hadn't been cleaned for weeksif not months and there was geen/brown dirt all around the inside of the pool it wasn't pleasant. I don't like complaining about hotels but at the end of the day you are paying five star prices for a two star hotel! If we hadn't paid using our Radisson points, we wouldn't have been happy at all. I would definitely recommend an alternative hotel if you are considering staying here!! Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely for mouses and pigs...”
Reviews.Author: cicciput
Reviews.Content: During check out I seen with my house that the whole hotel was in panic because of three mouses in the crew's restroom.... Nothing surprising me because the hotel is dirty, in dangerous location and offers very poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, poor location.”
Reviews.Author: Eric_Johansen
Reviews.Content: Sorry Radisson - this is a 5* hotel that's been situated in a 1* location. Rome is a hard city to find space in which to build, but I think you should have waited to find somewhere better. Although this hotel may be billed as being close to Termini it is effectively a 15 minute walk, and through a not-so-nice part of Rome. By the time I came to stay here I was a Rome veteran, so it was not a problem. For the first-time-traveller I'd recommend taking a taxi after dark. Once you're inside the hotel things are okay. The rooftop bar is not set-out particularly well, but there you go. The rooms are quirky but comfortable - the room service is quick and good. No bath in my room - perhaps not universal. The shower was very strange - reminded me of the MASH 4077. It is a good hotel though - everything is good quality and well maintained by attentive staff. Would I stay here again? Personally yes, but a new-comer I'd send to the Exedra.

Reviews.Title: “7th HEAVEN...”
Reviews.Author: Maajk
Reviews.Content: I was amazed by the modern style off this hotel in the middle off such an old city, in a good way!!!! Especially by the 7th floor, where i found this amazing Beauty spa and outside Pool. I always book Spa treatments when im on holiday and i must say here I found a piece of heaven, the treatments I received from the Beauty therapists at this lovely Beauty Spa were done with extreme professionality and care. I felt completly pampered!!! I recommend this little hide away to anyone who is coming to visit Rome. 2 Thumbs up!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlueWoman
Reviews.Content: This was a really funky hotel right next to the Termini - so it was very easy to find. It is ultra modern and may not be to some people's taste. We are normally quite traditional but this hotel was so much fun. Check-in was a little bit of a wait, but it wasn't a major problem. The room was brilliant! You have to see it to understand but the window was floor to ceiling and had a remotely operated blind. The wall light was like a deflated balloon that inflated when you turned it on. The bed was really comfy with lovely white duvets and pillows. The controls for the blinds and all the windows were by the headboard so you could be really lazy! The shower was in a frosted glass cubicle behind the bed and the toilet door was frosted glass too, so if you are a little inhibited or are on a romantic break just getting to know someone you might find it a little strange! The floor was like a rubber material and all springy - strange but nice to walk on and the shower could have been a little more powerful. But we really enjoyed the fact it was so different. On the 7th Floor was the restaurant with an outside area with two swimming pools. It was a little bit too chilly to swim, but sitting out there in the glorious sunshine was perfect. You could sit and look at all of the aerials on the rooftops and see the beautiful buildings. The food was very nice although quite expensive, as was the mini bar! My recommendation would be that you get a room that overlooks the inner courtyard and not over the train station as it is noisier. We went for the inner courtyard and it was so peaceful. The staff were helpful but in the inimitable Italian way! I would definitely go back for another stay. It was within walking distance of the Coliseum as well.

Reviews.Title: “There must be better hotels in Rome”
Reviews.Author: worldman1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson SAS in Rome while on a business trip. The standard of the room was acceptable and the staff helpful, but this not not make up for the bad location (noisy train station and worn down buildings) and worn down common areas (smelly elevators, black hallways). There must be better hotels in Rome for the same price level.

Reviews.Title: “Sparseness of service matching the minimalist interiors”
Reviews.Author: ozon
Reviews.Content: Overall: In our view, this hotel might appeal to those looking for uncompromised modern style. It will not appeal to everyone’s taste: especially those with children and those looking for more traditional comforts. Location: The location of the hotel is convenient for transferring from/to the airport by Leonardo express. If you are travelling to the airport on the train, book your tickets at the staffed ticket office as a lower fare is quoted here as opposed to the tickets being offered on the platform concourse. We found most of the highlights of the city within the walking distance - that is if you are prepared to walk and enjoy the abundant architectural scenery and local café culture. Check-in The check-in staff were there not to help and welcome but to mechanically process your reservation and display some attitude. Perhaps they think that sparseness of service matches the minimalist interiors. Room and hotel facilities Hotel facilities were rented out to external parties most of the time and consequently were not available to hotel guests. This was very disappointing as the rooftop swimming pool and bar are among the most striking features of the building. On the one occasion that it was available, the service was slow, some of the tables were empty but still marked as reserved. The attendants were unhelpful. Our standard double room was small but well designed. The room could have done with a good clean, floors and scratched surfaces in particular. The shower was difficult to use. The range of bathroom products was quite good. We dined at the hotel on our night of arrival; the main restaurant was not available to hotel guests because it was rented out for a corporate party (see above). Alternative dining was provided in the hotel ‘library’. It was disappointing in both range and quality of food offered. There are certainly more exciting culinary choices to be enjoyed in the city. We would recommend some researching and booking ahead as finding something other than the ubiquitous pizza restaurant was a challenge. Check out: no problems - the staff again seemed to be operating on ‘auto-pilot’. Overall: overall, the ‘wow’-factor is due to architectural features of the building and interior design not matched by service, staff attitude and food. We would not say ‘don’t stay there-categorically’, but we certainly won’t be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not a favorite”
Reviews.Author: georgiakurt
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel during a 3-night stop in Rome for work. After reading the reviews for this hotel, there really weren't too many surprises. The area is definitely not one of the best areas of town. There were a few sketchy looking characters on the streets but I never felt unsafe, although I did look over my shoulder alot to be on the safe side. I had read reviews about the noise of the train and asked for a room away from the station, so I never heard any train noise...although the hallway could be pretty noisey. The hotel is fine is you just need a place to stay in Rome and are having trouble finding other places that are within the city walls. The modern design was okay...definitely different, but not a negative. The light in the room that looks like an airbag was something i had never seen before. The negatives to me were the following: 1) Room just didn't feel clean. The black carpeting in the room had a number of stains and the mounting that connected the desk to the wall was barely holding the desk to the wall. I assume the desk had been repaired (poorly) recently because someone probably sat on the desk and detached it from the wall because there was only one uncomfortable chair in the room. 2) The bathroom was definitely a low point. This room, unlike some of the reviews that I have read, had a distinct bathroom that would provide decent privacy. When i first stepped into the bathroom, I noticed a large white stain on the tile floor. I wasn't really sure what is was though. Then I went to take a shower, and noticed the shower head just comes straight out of the ceiling and there was no shower curtain or any definition of a shower area. So when you took a shower, the water went everywhere in the bathroom. You would think that in such a design the floor of the bathroom would be well-sloped to drain or at least have a small ledge to contain the water. But it didn't, so the whole floor starts to flood. Hence the large white soap stain on the tile floor. I did start to put towels around the shower area to confine the water though. This may have been a handicapped bathroom, but you would expect at least a shower curtain or something. Standing right next to the toilet taking a shower is not a highlight. 3) Not business friendly. Very poor design in that the phone in the room was by the tv but the desk was on the other side of the room. So I would have to stand by the tv when i was on a call instead of sitting at the desk. Also, during my stay, I used my corporate toll-free calling 30-40 times...again i stress "toll-free", so no local phone expense to the hotel. However, at check-out, I was charged 2.5 euros for each connection. This has to be the most any hotel has ever charged for such a connection. I'm used to a nominal access charge, but not 2.5 euros...that was just outrageous. 4) Dining options. The restaurant at the hotel had decent food, but the prices were ridiculous in my opinion for the portions that you received. I did venture out a little in the neighborhood, but the dining options were pretty limited. If you stay here, I would recommend eating while you are away from the hotel sightseeing, etc. Overall, I would not stay here again. But, I think if you read most of the reviews here, you can make an informed decision for yourself. Safe travels.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing Pool!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaMM
Reviews.Content: The Radisson SAS in Rome is near the train station, which is handy coming in from the airport. The area is a bit rundown but I felt safe walking around the area on my own, even at around 10.30pm. When I first checked in, I was given a smoking room, so I had to go downstairs, queue up again to get a non-smoking room. The same thing happened to my work colleague, neither of us were asked our preference. The rooms are really unusual, and made a nice change from other hotels. The floor was made of rubber, which was really comfortable to walk on, especially after strolling around Rome all day. A few things didn't work, like the remote control for the TV and one of the phones. The lights could take a couple of goes to get working. The beds are really comfortable though. The breakfasts are nice, lots of choice. My one gripe would be the tea, as an Irish person I like a cup of tea in the morning, but the only thing on offer was luke warm water in jugs to make tea with. Was horrible. (no tea/coffee facilities in rooms). The biggest complaint I would have about the hotel is the pool. I jumped straight in my first day, and nearly died. It was freezing, had to get straight back out again. The second day I was sun bathing, no one could get into the pool, was too cold. What’s the point? I thought I saw unmelted ice in the kid’s pool, which would explain why it was so cold. It’s unusual to get a hotel in Rome with a pool, but why keep it so cold only penguins can use it?

Reviews.Title: “Vastly Overpriced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: s2sap
Reviews.Content: I have never felt the need to write a review for any hotel I have ever stayed in...and they are many. However I really felt the need to let others know ...the hotel is very nice, however if you are paying to stay in it as I was with my family...as opposed to havving it paid for you by business / corporate account it is vastly overpriced even for Rome. We stayed here 1 night before a cruise and stayed in the Hotel Universo in the same area for two nights after our cruise ( because Radisson was fully booked for conferences on our return dates ). The Universo was half the price for a good 4* hotel and I have to say a superior hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist Heaven ”
Reviews.Author: Annalise_Andy_UK
Reviews.Content: We like minimalist hotels so this place was perfect for us. We upgraded to a Junior Suite for £150 which included breakfast. The room was great with a jacuzzi bath and a separate seating area, inflatable lampshades and pink underfloor lighting. All beds face towards the window which is different so try to get a courtyard facing room. Good location with Termini and a metro station very very close. 10 min walk to the colloseum - you'll be amazed how small Rome is and most of the key sights are walkable from the SAS. The restaurant is expensive... and the food is nothing to write home about. The pool bar is worth a stop though, especially after dark. The gym is very small but it does the job. The sauna and spa area is big for a hotel and looked really good - it was closed for maintenance when we stayed though.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: fori
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a nice location close to all the amenities.. You/ll find a big lobby with 2 people at the desk ready to assist you. If you take the lift and go to the 7 th floor you can find the bar, restaurant and a beautiful swimmingpool!!! The people on the service are nice but not so much friendly like the people on the reception especially Consuelo gave to us a friendly service and she was so professional and smiling in every time. Anyway the hotel is modern and the rooms are small but confortable!! Go to the Carbonara Restaurant in Campo dei Fiori is very very good and cheap!!

Reviews.Title: “A superb stay”
Reviews.Author: Jenta
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at the hotel for three nights and found the hotel to be of great standard. If you are into design , this is the place to stay in Rome. Very helpfull staff, nice restaurant and an excellent breakfast. The only thing we did not like, was the air bag-looking lamp in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Italian Designer”
Reviews.Author: choppiedoppie
Reviews.Content: The Hotel couldnt be more accessible. Straight off the Leonardo Express Airport Train into the hotel. Of course that means some noise.. and the road works outside the hotel added to the noise. The rooms were very unique. Was it Italian designer or Scandanavian designer. The shower was in the middle of the room, and surprisingly didnt seem to make the room damp. I couldnt find the light switch for the bathroom (or the room with the loo and basin in which the shower wasnt) - until the morning so had the light coming through the frosted glass but after a fine Roman dinner (elsewhere) that wasnt going to keep me awake. The Rooms were too much for some of my colleages at the same meeting who were staying on afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: eiffel00
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Rome is simply fantastic, the best is the staff and the design. When we arrived the front clerck was so helpful (the concierge Claudio) gave us the best information of the city and restaurant, what I notice the entire staff was very much genuine. The area is not the best but if you stay in via veneto (la dolce vita area) the price are much higher and possible the service is not so nice. The room was we got was not big mu very confortable. The restaurant staff very friendly and good breakfast. I suggest this hotel Jean

Reviews.Title: “Best meal I had in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sfeuropeexplorer
Reviews.Content: We came over to Rome from London after a less than happy experience. The guys at the front desk were great as noted. We had the little guy (7 years old) with us, he was treated like a king by all the staff. We had the junior suite with the tread mill, ballet bars and the extra, extra big balcony. You just started smiling when you walked in the room. The whole room was a total experience, great design. Some stuff of course doesn´t work, like the water from the bath and shower always went all over the wood floor, the jacuzzi started all by itself etc. you know all the disfuntions all design hotels seem to have. The room was huge so there was plenty of space to let the 7 year old spread out with all his toys. After this I´m just not going to try to travel with the 7 year old unless I have some space in the hotel room. Anyway... great room, great service. The whole experience came with a huge pricetag... $2600 for 4 nights... just have a couple of stiff drinks before you check out. But the best part..our first night we came in late and were too tired to go out to a restaurant. In our lazy mood we decided "just" go to the hotel restaurant. What a great surprise. Turned out to be the best meal we had in Rome and we went out of our way to wine and dine. SF/Bay Area Traveler

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful service and pool”
Reviews.Author: badminton1
Reviews.Content: Tired of the palace hotels me and my wife decided for this design hotel. It is just a few steps from the central station Termini so very convinient (no taxi cost). The check in was great and the room we got was very nice just what we were looking, ask for a superior on floor 6 not huge but with balcony, I saw also rooms with terrace (next time I will get that one). The breakfast was very good above average in variety and service and the best is the pool on the top floor. Overall me and my wife have had great stay. P.S. The beds are the most confortable I have ever slept. Martin

Reviews.Title: “Weird room....not the best location”
Reviews.Author: hedylarue
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night at the end of my trip in Rome. The room was clean, but had such an odd set up it was ridiculous. The sink is outside of the bathroom and literally over the head of one side of the bed. The shower is also outside the bathroom and right behind the bed. Forget about privacy because you can see right through the shower curtain and the glass bathroom door! My husband and I are close, but this was crazy! There is no place to put your luggage or anything else for that matter and you will find yourself constantly running around the bed in the center of the room to get to anything. The area is right next to Termini...convenient but at night not the best. Decent restaurants are at least a 15 minute walk away and we weren't comfortable with that after dark. We ordered room service and the food was good, but we had to sit on the bed and eat off the tray as there was no table or chairs in the room!! Overall, this place looks cool but is totally impractical.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual but good”
Reviews.Author: stbUk
Reviews.Content: I took my wife and two children(14 and 10) to the hotel in January. Me and the children really liked the decor and style of the hotel, whereas my wife prefers something more traditional. Breakfast was good and staff were always friendly and helpful. Check in was quick and efficient. When we booked on line we said we would prefer two rooms with an adjoining door, this is what we got. I agree with other reviewers that the surrounding area wasn't the best but we never got any bother even late at night. We found the rooms a little stuffy even in January but opening the window fixed that. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: travel8787
Reviews.Content: Modern Hotel near central station. One of the most design hotel I have ever been, very nice. The staff is excellent, smiling and friednly. They have a swimmimg pool at floor seven, just fantastic and nice food. Price is OK and the breakfast just superb. Location very convinient. I will go again

Reviews.Title: “A Modern Nighmare”
Reviews.Author: Brackens
Reviews.Content: We stayed for ten nights so we got to know the hotel really well. The room was modern minimalist and impossible to keep tidy . We had to argue for tea making facilities in the room. We couldn't have air con. until after Easter Saturday when Summer officially started.The room was unbearably stuffy to sleep in.The room has a glass shower cubicle and a glass door to the toilet cubicle.We have been married for 36 years and even we found the lack of privacy trying. In the ten days we were there the restaurant menu which offered very little choice didn't change. The bar menu was either salad or a sandwich. For our wedding anniversary my husband ordered champagne for our room. They delievered on the wrong day and spoilt the surprise. The hot buffet at breakfast time was usually tepid and unpalatable. The area around the hotel is very unsafe and the foyer frequently had notices displayed for tour groups to be on their guard.. My husband was subjected to an attempted robbery on our first day there and was spat at when he remonstrated with the youth. It was afternoon and we were a street away from the hotel.. We always got a taxi into the hotel grounds for safety.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by a few niggling things”
Reviews.Author: sb1London
Reviews.Content: So reading past reviews this is either a love it or hate it kind of place. The concept of the hotel is superb and if you like cutting edge minimalist design this has to be on your list of places to visit in Rome. The rooms are reasonably large, bright and airy. Cool features and intuitive storage make minimal impact on a sparse room with very comfortable beds. Yet the overall feel is let down by peeling paint and a few knocks and scratches. The location is very handy for the Leornardo Express and you can be in the Piazza de Spagna in 15 minutes. There's also a great rooftop space with a terrace and pool, let down by rude and lazy bar staff (when ordering drinks you're sent back to your seat, to then wait for 15 minutes before a waiter finally saunters over to take your order).
