The bar staff's attitude is an enormous contrast to the helpful and smiling reception team. If you want something a little different, at a good price with plenty of space (certainly at a premium in Rome) then give the Radisson SAS a go. It's not awful, as some reviews would lead you to believe, but there are a few drawbacks that let what could be an amazing hotel down.

Reviews.Title: “Rome's Reliable Radisson”
Reviews.Author: Big_Daddy_Si
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rome Radisson for 3 nights over Easter 2007. The Radisson is easily accessible via the Termini Railway station that is a mere 5 minute walk from the hotel. The surrounding area is a little rundown with graffati and litter all around. The room was small, but modern - strangley enough the shower is located in the bedroom (although behind a wrap around shower curtain). The staff at the hotel were friendly and all spoke English, The rooftop bar was nice, although food and drinks quite expensive eg Coke 5 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to its standards”
Reviews.Author: Congresstraveler
Reviews.Content: A rather futuristic design - the idea is OK but problems with the rooms...firstly do not accept a room on the tracks side (right next to railway station) on lower floors! Also, a 4-star hotel's shower should not be in the middle of the room bordered only by shower curtains (does not hold the water inside them...) and in addition these curtains should not be covered with mold! The only really cool thing is the 7th floor restaurant and the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson SAS Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jph03001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very modern design, to the point that some things were silly. For instance, light switches were little buttons sometimes in hidden areas meant to blend into their surroundings. Once we found them all and figured out how to use them, this was fine. Also, there was very little storage room... just a few small drawers by the sink, and a single rack for hanging a few articles of clothing. The toilet area offered very little privacy as the door was a fogged glass, and it was free swinging. The shower door, if shut all the way, could not be opened from the inside. Other than these things, the room was very nice. The bed was king size, but was actually two twin sized mattresses squeezed together. This was nice because your partner could flop around all night and you wouldn't know it. We were very happy with the location. It is located directly across from the termini station. Very easy to get to when you first arrive to Rome. This location was also very quiet. I have heard complaints that in other more centrally located areas, it is difficult to sleep at night because of the noise from traffic and crowds of people. This was no problem at the Radisson. The size of the room was bigger than average from what I have heard about typical European standard size rooms. The shower was also quite large. I heard another traveler talking about how at their hotel, they could not even turn around in the shower because it was so small. The staff was very nice and presentable, and the free wireless internet was nice. We had to call maintenance twice, once to fix our door, and once to fix an electrical circuit that blew because of our hairdryer. For the door, they came immediately, but for the electrical, we had to call a couple times apparently because they didn't understand what our problem was. Overall, we enjoyed the hotel, and would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this place, even though a Radisson...”
Reviews.Author: DepLondon
Reviews.Content: Good points: - Beautiful piece of contemporary, minimalist design - this place wasn't always a Radisson... - Fantastic pool / lounge on the roof, an oasis after a long day walking around (although note point about trains below) - Top notch service - It was very hot and they have real powerful AC (not some little box dangling off the window) - if I ever go back to Rome in summer, I will go back to this joint simply for the AC. - Chic / swanky joint Bad points - chic / swanky joint - Not best location, but Rome is relatively small so nothing is that far - it borders onto the train station with the constant buzz / noise coming in. Rooms have very thick windows blocking out all the sound (so you won't hear it sleeping), but you do hear it everywhere else (ask for a room not facing train station if you want to be sure). Its pretty noisy on the roof deck. - Rooms are reasonable price wise, but I think I recall everything else being extortionate (and there isn't much else in that hood) - If you are looking for all the classic charm of Italy, this ain't the place to roll (this hotel could feature in any city around the world). - it's not intimate (its like staying in a W in NY).

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: TEACHERLeeds
Reviews.Content: First review on this site. In January me and my wife had a break trip in Roma and decided to try this hotel. The best experience was the staff, Front Office in particular, so friendly and smiling. The breakfast was execellent and the lady at check in was superb. The location is central very convinient near the station and few minutes from the train. So I decided to return in April, the price is ok and really the service is great.

Reviews.Title: “Total Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: lovinlondonLondon
Reviews.Content: Too modern and not comfortable or functional-had to wait inordinate amounts of time to book restaurants as front desk did everything from room service to check in-guess Radisson is trying to save money at our expense. They did not like to book restaurants that they did not know so forget trying to go somewhere where the review is unknown to them-wonder why? Staff all in black so hard to tell client from staff. Rooms look trendy but electricity source too far from desk and bathroom gets so wet that the hems of trousers wet too-bar upstairs nice but constant playing of video of themselves very wearing-disappointed in London

Reviews.Title: “Very averge”
Reviews.Author: James-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the location is ideally suited for exploring Rome. If you are used to city life then you will not find the location off putting or dangerous. The Hotel however has seen better days, it is drab and clearly has a managment team who have no passion or care. The Hotel is very modern and off the wall. I am sure it looked great on paper, but it does not work and leads to an uncomfotable stay. My bed was in the middle of the room, the shower was directly behind the bed, all open not in a seperate bathroom. If you wanted to work, there are no chairs to sit and only one socket in the whole room which is no where near the dressing table (if that is what you can call it) I stayed for 5 days and my sheets were not changed once, the dirt on the toilet floor remained. The gym was also not clean and had more than one piece of equitment out of action all week. Breakfast is a whopping 35 euros a head and can only be descibed as average. For the prices charged, you can find much better. I will not return here.

Reviews.Title: “Not everyone's cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: Shant
Reviews.Content: Often, you will find a hotel which has universal appeal; other times, you will be faced with grand opulence; some are just luxury; other hotels, they don't strike up much emotion at all; this hotel is none of those things. You will either love it or hate it. The design is most unique, and very modern. Some of the rooms work, some don't. I can't tell you about the junior suites, the executive suites or the presidential suite, however, the superior rooms follow a sort of wave design while the standard rooms follow one of two designs, either the Zattera or the Elle. The Zattera is like a raft, in that it occupies the whole central part of the room and everything (apart from the desk occupying the whole of the window side) is mounted upon it - the furniture, and even the shower (behind). Elle, on the other hand, is just strange and a strange shape and everything is mounted upon a rotational design against the shower; however, it does work. The great things about the hotel: if you like the design, it a relaxing place to stay; the food is fab; the service is excellent; the staff are ever so helpful and provide any service you require; free wi-fi; brilliant views from the top. Poor things about the hotel: the location is just horrid; in the middle of nowhere, though next to the main station, and when going there, you have to dart around the prostitutes; there is no indoor pool; if you are out late at night, you cannot walk back to the hotel from the city centre. Whilst the hotel is not old, in some of the rooms, the furniture looks a tad worn, but that is due to the materials it is made from. I would stay here again, if I were in Rome on business, but if I were on holiday with my wife and 3 year old son, I would stay at either the Westin or the St Regis Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Not my kind of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oro
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just ugly. The service was okay. We arrived at 9am and had to wait until noon to check in. The lobby sofas are most uncomfortable. The food was okay, the location was very close to the train station and there were quite a few restaurants within walking distance. I would not stay here again, only because I personally do not like ultra modern furnishings. The only reason we did stay here was all my other choices were completely booked. I later found out that there were numerous conventions in town.

Reviews.Title: “Not designed for real people”
Reviews.Author: Carno
Reviews.Content: We were booked in for a conference and stayed on for the weekend. The website showed us what to expect, but we had little choice. The hotel is not really near the station - you can see the railway lines and the commuter station from the top floor, but it is a long, scary and dangerous walk from the main station, where the airport buses stop. When you leave the hotel there is an older building which houses an indoor market, with another fruit and veg market to one side. Beyond that is a lovely park and square, with a Metro station, taking you far away from the ghastly Radisson hotel. At last, you feel you are in Italy. Despite cards in all the rooms saying 100% satisfaction or your money back, the management do not care about the guests. Rooms are uncomfortable and peculiar. No wardrobe, just a clothes rack, few draweres (all well hidden), open plan bathroom, and only one seat which is a metal chaise longue moulded to the desk and impossible to get comfy in. The beds are very hard and ugly, but adequate. On arrival late at night room service did not answer. They have a 'one stop' button on the phone, but no-one replies. Apparently this is the case at any time for any one. A friend failed to book a massage this way. Hot nights in November have no respite from the advertised air conditioning. According to the desk clerk dealing with angry guests, the management decided it should be switched off in November, and it could not be switched back on. I opened a window, but this is a bit dodgy in this rough area. For some reason they have a light show on their windows. At some point in the evening if you do not press the button to make the blind go all the way down, an eerie purple or pink light glows out from the bottom of the window. Weird and wonderful taps, light switches and other essential facilities come without any instructions, so running a bath took two people half an hour to work out how to do it. Lights switch themselves on and off at will during the morning and evening, and there is a peculiar wall light which is a balloon, inflates when it is on and hangs limply when you switch it off. Words cannot express how horrible these rooms are! Escaping within the hotel to the Zest bar, in search of food (lack of response from room service) showed that the staff are lovely and the atmosphere in the bar is great. they also offer free canapes in the evening, and the balcony is nice to sit on, with space heaters for the cold nights. Other public rooms have nasty white plastic rectangles and pebble shapes to sit on. Breakfast is lavish, but all the food is a bit unpleasant. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: travellero1o
Reviews.Content: Reading this reviews worried me as I did the reservation last year but I decided to try. The hotel is just great and the best was the staff. The breakfast was full even the biological corner and the rooms were clean. Maybe I was luck? I stayed 3 nights with my wife in a junior suite and the entire stay was superb. I would suggest this hotel, I have visited other Radisson SAS in UK and Scandinavia but surely this was one of the best expecially the service.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaithiOg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in early November for part leisure/ part business and found it pretty mixed to be honest. The location is a problem: a pretty, grotty and rundown area of rome that's a decent 20-30 minute walk from any of the main attractions. I didn't come across any trouble walking around the area, even late at night, but it is the sort of area where you'd be careful to keep your wits about you. The hotel imagines itself to be an ultra modern, hip and stylish hotel, but it's 'beauty' is only skin deep, if that. for a new hotel it's starting to look a bit shabby around the edges; having white leather couches in the lobby might have seemed like a good idea at the time, but they're starting to look very ragged. The lack of cleanliness surprised me. I've stayed in a number of Radisson hotels around Europe and they all seem very clean. this one is different. the lobby, elevator area is really not as clean as it should be. The gym on the 7th floor was filthy when I was there. For 3 days in a row I used the running treadmill (there's only one) and for three days in a row the same half eaten, decaying apple and snotty tissue greeted me on the little treadmill shelf. Now, it was the weekend and maybe staff weren't on, but still. The pool area and bar were out of bounds for the 4 days I was there due to it being hired out as a function venue, which was very frustrating seeing as this is heavily advertised as one of the key benefits of the place. Theplus side: rooms are genuinely stylish and v friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Respite in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Shusha
Reviews.Content: As I stayed in the SAS Radisson in Rome during September , I thought it was too late to write a review. Having read the recent comments, I thought that I should record my experience as it was very different to most of those listed. I was initiatly very dubious about staying at this hotel because I had read such bad reviews, however, the lure of a pool when travelling with a jet lagged 10 year old won me over. I had not been to Rome for 25 years. I was delighted as to the ease of locating the hotel from the airport Leonardo Express train. My son spotted the hotel sign from the train window as we pulled into Termini Station. We were able to walk down the exit ramp next to where the train pulls in ( don't walk to the front of the train station) without difficulties and across the road to the hotel. When we arrived at the hotel after 28 hours of travel, we were immediately given our reserved room. The desk staff couldn't have been more helpful. I do agree that our room was a little tired ( ours had a rip in the blind and smelt smoky) but the beds were comfortable, and everything else worked. The rooftop pool was a god sent after a day of the walking around in the 33 degree heat. The pool staff were fantastic and, on some occassions, even let my son stay in a little later past the 7.00pm closing. In the evening, we would sometimes indulge in the free antipasto served by the pool. On some days after having been out for a big lunch this was enough to feed us for the night! Much has been written about the seedy location, whilst it is not the most charming part of town, I was not the slightest bit scared walking around at night with a 10 year old. Being close to Termini meant we had access to the supermarket for supplies and the the newsagent for transport tickets. It was also an easy walk to the metro, and the bus terminal at the front of the station was a reference point when we were lost. (We often caught bus number 'H' to Travestere of an evening to dine). We found all the staff to be very pleasant. They would joke with my son, answer his questions about the excavations in the front of the hotel, and recommend and book restaurants or taxis without a problem. I don't know whether we were just lucky, or having a child which the Italians love, meant our experience was unusual, but we really enjoyed our stay at the SAS RAdisson and would highly recommend it. Andrea (Australia)

Reviews.Title: “The best service ever”
Reviews.Author: SIRSUTTON
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with my wife at the Radisson Rome for a leisure trip and what a fantastic service. The breakfast was excellent and the guys at front office simply genuine. During my entire stay the staff was so nice, we were under the impression to be at home, all of them smiling and friendly. DEFINETELY WILL STAY AGAIN JSUTTON

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Disappointed - Dublin”
Reviews.Author: CiaranB
Reviews.Content: I'm actually writtting this review from my last night in the hotel room. The free wireless broad Band in all rooms is about the only good thing about the hotel. We booked the Radisson as part of our honeymoon, and its been a major let down. Both myself and my wife are big into modern, minimalist hotels and travel quiet alot particuallrly as she's in the airline industry. We had no quams about paying the €1000 for 3 nights in a junior suite as it looked amazing on the website - and its our honeymoon. But we were more than worried and amazed at the poor location of the hotel as we arrived. Even the taxi man told it was in a dangerous and horrible place. he was right. We had no problems checking in - and I have to add the staff were all very friendly. HOWEVER, they stated the had not got the rom we requested and had to give us a suite without a balcony. We were also tols when we asked could we go to the Restaurant and bar that it was completely closed off for the duration of our stay as its been reserved for different functions. When I asked about the swimming pool I was told the pool cloeses for winter on the 25th Sept. 2 days prior to our arrival. When asked could we still use the terrace bar around the pool for drinks - smae excuse that its closed off for an outside event?? what the hell. Does this hotel not think of its guests!! On arrival in the room we were initially pretty impressed. Then we slowly found faults with our room - mainly our TV didint work properly! and half the lights were broken. To summerize the hotel design has some good points, but it's a ll the small issues that leave a bad taste. The location is terrible and for that reason alone I would not stay here again. Plus having all the barts out of action and trying to replace them by a 1st floor buffet was a joke. Luckily this is only a fraction of our honeymoon and we have other destinations to look forward too...hopefully they are better than this.

Reviews.Title: “6 hours check in”
Reviews.Author: Blakieb
Reviews.Content: Ok, sooo, we got there at 1pm Friday afternoon-we were only staying until Sunday and we got checked into our rooms around 7ish-VERY BAD-THIS SHOULD BE A 2* HOTEL NOT 5??? We had to wait around, eventually we got changed into shorts in the bathroom as we had no room and looked at the pool-its very pretty, we were really looking forward to getting in until we found it had been shut for the full 2 days we were there- something you should be told before you book so we were very disppointed at that also. The staff were rude and VERY unhelpful! I'm suprised they worked there! We eventually got to our rooms and they were OK-not what u expect for a 5*. We went to use our safe and a sign came up saying 'battery low' so we decided not to risk it, another disappointing thing. At 12pm when we were in bed the fire alarm started going off, we were all woke up, not evn a sorry just a don't worry when we stuck our heads out of the door and again at 6.30am fire alarm story happens again. We went to breakfast, that was nice if you like a crossant and fruit for 26 euros-very expensive for what it is. The only thing we liked was the bathroom-quite stylish and a nice big shower. If you are staying for a long time i definately wouldnt recommend-if your staying for a short time i would also not recommend, we wasted the first half of our 2 day trip waiting to get a room evn though we had booked and paid on net 2 months earlier. BAD NEWS! AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Wont be Returning”
Reviews.Author: Shamonmaster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights as nothing else was available and rooms were limited across town. The only room left was a junior suite on the 6th floor with cost €1000 for 3 nights. We couldnt afford it but had no choice and in one sense we were looking forward to sheer luxury. Oddly, breakfast wasnt even included in this high price. The location near Termini Station is poor, somewhat dangerous and it costs nearly 15 euro one way in a taxi to the heart of the attractions. For such a big room, there was no hairdryer, the bath/jacuzzi didnt work correctly, the battery in the safe was dead when we arrived, the TV by the bed wouldnt work, and the duvet cover was dirty. The hotel sells itself as an ultra modern facility however turn on the lights (lights are extremely low on room floors) and you can see that the paintwork is ageing and dirty. There is free broadband in the room if you have your own laptop with you however if you use the internet in the foyer, it costs €8 for 20 minutes. Cmon guys, what are you thinking! On the positive side the staff were ultra smiley, there was plenty of room around the hotel, the relaxation massage in the spa was very good and of course come check out, the train is just across the road, literally. Still wont be returning though.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sharon.Edge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here earlier this month and I must admit we weren't too impressed at first, but the hotel certainly grew on us - mainly due to the lovely staff. The reception area does seem rather neglected and we had a few teething problems with our rooms, but these were sorted out quick enough. The roof-top terrace was wonderful in the evening and breakfast on the same floor was equally great. The staff here couldn't have been more attentive. As its right across the street from the train station, you can easily hope on the Metro and get to almost all of the sites that way. And the location was great for meeting real locals rather than just fellow tourists. We would consider going again.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay at Radisson rome”
Reviews.Author: manctraveller
Reviews.Content: I knew the location was not fantastic but taxis were readily available and cheap and the hotel staff very helpful at booking them. The hotel design was great and pretty much what we expected after looking at the website. The staff were OK a couple were really nice and helpful and a couple a little offhand. We had a problem with our reservation as we had booked 2 interconnecting rooms - we have 2 children and they tried to give us 2 rooms on 2 different floors but actually after standing our ground they eventually gave us a suite instead for the cost of 1 room which was fine. I agree about the pool it was so cold it was suprising how they managed to make it that cold, and the drinks service around the pool was shockingly slow and was a bit offhand. I read with interest about the 7pm buffet which nobody at any point told us about - that would have been nice to have been told Overall the hotel is fine and we got a very good internet rate of 155 euros per night per room so felt it was good value for that.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay - great design hotel - cool rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: alohatiger1
Reviews.Content: Me (36) and my girlfriend (32) stayed at this hotel for 3 nights over the weekend for a short trip to Rome. We loved the hotel!!! It is perfect for a sightseeing weekend in Rome. The whole stay was perfect, from the beginning till the end. It is an ultra modern stylish hotel. The stuff was extremely friendly. And the most perfect thing about the hotel is the pool on top of the roof. You can go sightseeing and in the afternoon you can relax at the pool, have and drink or eat something. At 7.00 pm the have a free antipasti buffet (for every guest) at the poolside, which is very nice. The rooms and the hotel itself is ultra modern, you have to love the style – which we do!!! The rooms a not very big, but what do you need – I don’t travel to Rome to stay in my hotel room all the time. Everything is in white and the bathroom is made out of glass. You have a flat screen TV and the internet is free of charge. The guests of the hotel are between 30 - 50 years (probably because of the style of the hotel). The stuff is also between 25 - 40 years. The location is ok. We always took a taxi to get to the place which we wanted to see. It only takes you a couple of minutes to get there. Well you can’t expect a modern hotel in the historical area of Rome. If you want to stay in the historical area, than you have to book a hotel which is also historical – which I didn’t want to. We paid around 190 Euro per night and I thing the price is fair. We had a room on the 6. floor and only these rooms have a balcony, which I think was nice. All the rooms on the other floors don’t have balconies but therefore I think they are a little bit bigger. It is up to you what you prefer. I was reading some of the reviews here before I booked the hotel. And I don’t understand why people don’t like the hotel or complain about the location. Before I book a hotel, I look it up in the internet and see if I like the style or the location of the hotel, than I read the reviews if the internet side really gives you the right information. If I know, the style is ultra modern (and I don’t like it), why do I book the hotel and afterwards complain about the style??? I also don’t buy a Porsche and afterwards complain that it only has 2 doors!!! Also the stuff was extremely friendly, when we walked into the lobby in the same moment somebody come up to us, took our luggage, check-in was in a minute, stuff at the pool very friendly. I don’t understand why people here at tripadvisor complain about the stuff? Overall, next time I come to Rome, I will defiantly stay at this hotel again, and I would wish there would be more of these hotels in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service & location, steep drink prices”
Reviews.Author: Rangoon
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located near the Termini, one of the major rail/bus points which is nice in principle, but like nearly every place around a station worldwide it leaves much to be desired. In addition it is just about the furthest in the centre from any of the main sites. Not walking distance and you would not want to walk in that area. The hotel itself is poorly managed, both on the reception and on the roof bar. Check-in and queries are dealt with a unpleasant and grudging way. The roof top bar is a nice space but the service is so slow, expensive and inept (7 euro for a 280ml beer) it is just not worth it. The rooms have been designed by people who have never stayed in hotels before. There is nowhere to work or write postcards the chair is uncomfortable and their is no real hanging space for clothes. There were some nice touches; a traffic light style control panel on the bedside, nicely tiled bathroom and excellent beds and A/C I did not try the breakfast at 25 euros I thought it was overpriced, so went around the corner and had an excellent coffee and croissant for 2 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Are you kidding me?”
Reviews.Author: crissy420
Reviews.Content: What a rip-off! First, the location is really bad. I've stayed near the station before but this time I did not feel safe walking the 200 meters from the station to the hotel IN BROAD DAYLIGHT. I arrived at the hotel at around 3 pm, after calling ahead to ask how to walk from the station -- after three calls with no answer, I finally reached the reception desk, and the man was more than annoyed with my call. I arrived to find the same attitude. I speak Italian (I lived in Italy for many years) and speaking the language didn't seem to make my experience any better. The reception is a free-for-all. The round desk does not make for an organized check-in, I waited behind a line a several people who were having problems (sending faxes, reserving rooms, asking for information), while a group of flight attendants who came in at least 15 minutes after me were served before me. There were 2 people behind the desk who were working and 4 others who just "looked good". You know, I am sick of the beautiful people who work in the service industry. Get over yourselves! For over 200 euro per night, I expect a better reception than being ignored by people who "think" they are better than that. Finally, I was checked in but no one helped me with my bags. There were at least two porters in the lobby but they were too busy with themselves to help me so I took my own bags to my room. I arrived in my room to find paint peeling off the walls and the balcony full of mold and peeling paint. There was no bottle opener in the fridge and when I asked housekeeping if I could have a bottle opener and a list of prices for the mini bar, she told me I must be mistaken. Sure enough, there wasn't the afore mentioned items and they quickly brought the necessary items. BUT, wait a second, 12 euro for a friggin' mini bottle of whisky!!!!! Heaven forbid you want to mix it with something. Cokes are 6 euro for a mini bottle. Ok. so this hotel's main selling point is the pool. Well, guess what!?! The pool is closed always for private parties, and you, as a PAYING GUEST, ARE NOT WELCOME! The second day I stayed here there was a notice in the elevator that the pool was closed from 5pm- on but the restaurant inside would be open. Well, it wasn't. When I went upstairs for dinner, I was told to go to the first floor and when I got there, I was told that only sandwiches and salads were available for dinner. This is not what I call service. OK, I'll stop here. There are many other negatives things but I think I've said enough. It was not a good experience coming here. If you do end up here, don't say you were not warned! Radisson management, if you are listening, vergonavi!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fan987
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to stay here since it was just the ES hotel. I love modern design hotels and this one didn't dissapoint. The look of the hotel isn't that original but it does provide a break from the dirty old streets in Rome. I had a good stay but wouldn't stay here again mainly because of location. I expected it since I read all the reviews, but it's a good location if you're arriving from Termini. The rooms look nice and are clean but getting them to work takes effort. Certain lights would occasionally decide not to work and the TV never worked at all. I booked a superior room with a balcony, which was nice but only had a view of the inside of the hotel. The pool area was probably the best part of the hotel, but the trendy crowd has seemed to have dissapeared. The front desk staff was mostly helpful. Overall though I had a good stay and it was definately worth it for what I paid.

Reviews.Title: “I read these reviews but still gave it a go - here's what I think..”
Reviews.Author: LondonsTraveller
Reviews.Content: I like travelling a lot - and prefer to stay in 5 star hotels. I booked this hotel via Expedia for a cheaper rate and was really disappointed. I had read the reviews on tripadvisor prior to booking however decided as Radisson is a well known hotel, other vistors may have just been unlucky - not the case, it really is just a poor managed hotel. The hotel is minimalist and I had no problem with the room - however towels were not changed during our 3 night stay. Checking in was a nightmare - we had to wait for 3 hours to check in, encountering rude staff at the desk - with the exception of a lady called Victoria (she served us on our 4th attempt to check in). The bar was not anything special and the food was OK. The location is close to the Termini - which is the main station, although don't be fooled by this. The hotel is situated in a less tourist-y area, I called it the "ghetto" of Rome. Which isn't nice if you have enjoyed a day in the heart of Rome and want to walk back. You'll be so aware of this poorer part of Rome that you'd wish you'd caught a taxi - but we couldn't as the taxi's were on strike!!!!! I really take note of the reviews on this website and def would recommend a hotel in the heart of Rome and advise you to disregard the Radisson Rome even if the price is appealing on Expedia! Rome overall was lovely but venice is better... see my review for the hotel Saturnia and International..

Reviews.Title: “My favourite in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Battersea
Reviews.Content: The SAS Radisson (formerly the Es) is my favourite hotel in Rome. It is not like most hotels in Rome in that it is a modern, quirky and boutique-like 'hip' hotel. It doesnt have the feel of 19th century grandeur nor does it have a central location..but, that is why I love it. First of all, the modern black/white and stone design is very calming. From the lobby to the top floor bar the focus is on light and shade; on colour and transparency. Thus, you feel you are in a large space...and not in a claustrophobic 'hotel'. The location is in a 'transitional' neighbourhood - it is next to Termini station - so, cheap hostels, Asian and Indian market stalls and restaurants and African migrant workers. But, it is REAL... it is not the Disney-esque view of Rome and its monuments. The SAS brand makes sure everything is Scandinavian efficient and clean. The staff are very helpful and friendly and multii-lingual. And, the facilities are great...particularly the top floor bar and restaurant. (like the architecture...modern but enjoyable!) The rooftop pool area is excellent to enjoy the outdoors above the hustle and bustle! I warn you though...the pool is freezing, so better to sunbathe and pose than do a few laps. And, in the evening when the DJ plays and bar is open... all you really want to do is enjoy a Negroni and sunset! The Rooms Vary in size and features..but, in principle they are stark modern minimalist. Once you work out how to turn the lights on/off and shower to warm you will be fine (make sure the bell boy shows you the switches!). Crisp white sheets, excellent towels and an excellent tv/sound system. The coloured lights and inflatable car airbag lights are weird but work. Make sure you ask for a room with a tub/shower glass cubicle and not the wooden floor/tent shower. They have to get rid of that concept... The worst features.... The spa/gym is a disappointment. SO, don't stay here if that is what you want. Also, the hotel is clearly now booking large conferences and tour groups...so, be warned. The business centre is a joke...one internet pc terminal in the lobby (practically in the lift!)..but, the staff said this is being changed shortly. The tent showers and telephone on the desk not next to the bed makes wake up calls a pain. Too many business conferences and tour groups hogging the lobby 'on breaks' or pre-boarding of buses. The best features... The location. The design. The SAS service features and staff. The breakfast selection and view. The concierge(s) and the taxi calling service. The food and bar on the 7th floor. The pool deck and views. The SAS Radisson has made this previously dysfunctional design hotel 'work' but it is not for everyone. If a typical 'Roman' or 'Italian' experience is what you want...don't check in here. But, if you want something more modern, different and unusual the SAS Radisson fits the bill. It is pricey, but better value than the Exedra or Aleph.

Reviews.Title: “Definately NOT 5 star!!”
Reviews.Author: kama0529
Reviews.Content: This hotel is officially a 5 star.....but let me tell you, it is definately not 5 star! The rooms themselves are adequate, functional and somewhat quirky - the semi-transparent glass shower cubicle and the room lighting was something that I actually quite liked. Despite the room being a little small, the room itself was ok- not great - but ok. Where this hotel falls down, is in its location AND the service it provides. The location is situated next to the main train terminal - and like in most cities, the train station is in the slightly dodgier area of town. Having said this, I had no problems walking around the area and there were always enough people around to feel safe enough. It is certainly not a pretty area and is industrialised - but the real problem is the distance from the major attractions. In the cooler months, it would not be too bad - but in the summer months, it is just too hot to be trapsing up hills and for a few miles to get to the main attractions. If you are thinking that this isnt too much of a problem because you can just get a taxi then think again. The hotel refused to order us taxis, and the taxi rank around the corner at the station awaits unknowing tourists from the airports and charges journeys at 4-5 times over the odds! The hotel also advertises that it is next to a metro stop - again, this is at the opposite end of the station, and is a good 10 minutes walk away. And now to the service. Although the staff are plesant enough - the service is terrible. Room service stops at 11pm - and although you can still order sandwiches after this time, the sandwiches are pre-made and not very nice. When I phoned to place an order, I asked what sandwiches they had - and was told that he couldnt be bothered to do and look in the fridge and would send up one of whatever there was! Like I said earlier, they would not order taxis for us. The room maid service one day wasnt done at all. There was no activities / tour desk and no small shop for basic essentials as in most hotels of its type. The air conditioning was very noisy and most nights we ended up having to turn it off in order to be able to sleep. The swimming pool area on the roof was nice - but even when it was 35 degrees outside, the water was too cold to be able to get into the pool!! Several guests commented that they must be putting ice cubes in it!! There is a small selection of bar snacks and a wide variety of drinks availiable, but they are very expensive - too expensive. Overall, i would suggest that you didnt stay here. The hotel was not a good experience, and you would be much better off staying somewhere more central.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to try minimalist this is for you”
Reviews.Author: AliGee
Reviews.Content: It’s 29th May 2006 and my wife and I are staying int the hotel, using the WiFi to leave these comments. WiFi works well and is free! Getting there – We were confused by the map, the hotel is not close to the station’s main entrance in fact if you are coming from the airport it is almost directly opposite to where the train stops so come out the first exit you can find, cross the road go down one block and turn left. Location - Others have commented on the dodgy area, well it’s only slightly more dodgy than the rest of Rome and we did not experience any problems. It is slightly further out than many hotels but we usually expect to walk in Rome and it was not a big problem. Room – if you want to try minimalist this is for you. We did feel that we untidyed the room just by being there! Storage space is very limited. We had a superior room with a balcony - shame there were no seats on the balcony and only one in the room. Don’t confuse minimalist with high tech – yes it has a flat screen telly and a blow up lamp but limited choice of channels, if there ever were music channels they don’t work and I can’t even view my bill on it. I would have expected lights in the toilet to switch on automatically - nothing so high tech you have to find the switch. The shower behind the glass looks good but sprays water on the wooden floor I was disappointed to find our duvet cover had two rips in it – not really the standard I expect from a 5 star hotel.. The mini bar is well stocked and it is not one of those annoying ones that charge you every time you open the door and rattle a kit kat. Other Facilities - We have not tried the fitness centre but we have used the pool. It is good however it is a bit annoying that they re-configure the area at 5:00 to use some of it for the restaurant asking people to move so that they can set up tables then you are left wondering where the exit is. There were plenty of staff around the pool but they always seemed more interested in talking to each other rather than looking after the guests - we seem to get in their way! All in all it was OK and just what I expected from the reviews but lets face it in a 5 star hotel in Rome you really expect grandeur not austerity. If plain white and glass is your thing stay here – next time I’ll be up the road at the Exedra!

Reviews.Title: “FAB HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have been with my spouse in the radisson SAS es Hotel, definetely one of the best hotel service ever ecperienced. The staff was extremely helpful and my stay was just superb. The have fantastic breakfast and the pool on the 7th floor is simple the best in europe. Definetely will go back again. Marc Cord

Reviews.Title: “A well-lit version of hell”
Reviews.Author: SpinRX
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation at the SAS for the last day of our vacation that began in Rome a week earlier. We first stayed at the classic Rose Garden Palace (a top-notch place) but thought it would be fun to stay at a swank, hip place as a contrast. It was a contrast, but not the kind we anticipated. This place is horrible. Think of it as a hotel designed by Fellini, and operated by Tim Burton. First, the location. It is located as the a---end of the train station. OK, that isn’t bad in and of itself, but the environment is dirty (by Rome standards) and quite menacing. It took 20 minutes of brisk walking before we felt safe enough to slow down. No wonder the best rooms in this place look inward to the courtyard. The hotel looks like it was a really cool public library – back in 1973. It tries to look hip, but looks more like a 70-year-old woman wearing a mini-skirt with a thong. The rooms are all about form, and nothing about function. It took us 30 minutes to figure out how to turn on the lights, with the icongraphically driven room material providing no help. The air conditioning did not work, and the TV had more snow than Innsbruck. When I needed an Internet-capable computer, I decoded the book to read that there was a ‘business desk’ on the main floor. It turned out to be one PC on a desk near the back of the lobby. After a witless desk clerk agreed that it wasn’t working, I proceed to reboot it myself when he walked away in clueless disinterest. Once I got the thing up, I was amazed that they wanted a fee to use it. I coughed up the credit card to get online, only to find the printer was also broken. We were blessed, though, with two wake-up calls. We had that going for us.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no complaints”
Reviews.Author: hopingtotravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a very pleasant long weekend in this hotel which was no more than 15 minutes by metro from all of Rome's main tourist sites and was also easy to get to from Ciampino airport via the nearby Termini railway station. Our superior room was spotless and the bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds we've ever slept in - very welcoming after a long day's sightseeing. Our shower and wash basin were divided from the rest of the room by a glass wall while the toilet and bidet were totally separate behind a frosted glass door. There were plenty of complimentary toiletries and these were replenished every day. We enjoyed lunch in the hotel's restaurant on the day we arrived and ate there one evening - both meals were excellent with a very good selection of wines. Breakfasts were also more than adequate with hot foods as well as cereals, fresh fruits, yoghurts, bread, croissants and fruit juices. The roof top sun terrace and swimming pool attracted a few hardy souls who enjoyed an early morning dip while other people chose to exercise using the hotels fitness facilities. Termini metro where the red and blue lines meet is about 10 minutes walk away but there is a closer stop called Vittorio on the red line which is literally two minutes from the hotel door. Trams also pass this metro stop. The hotel staff were more than helpful and perhaps we were just lucky but unlike other contributors to this website we don't have any complaints about the Radisson SAS in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for the manual to get into your room...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I picked this hotel to be close to a metro stop and Termini is the crux of lines a and b. That is the good news. I didn't mind the location too much, while you are right next to Termini, you won't notice if you walk the other way. The hotel itself is "interesting". The doors are "push to get inside" after the funny door card makes a buzzing sound. To figure out the lights (the toilet took us about 5 minutes) takes a manual. We were here in early spring and the hotel is extremely hot in every room. So we now open de window all day. All of this is not too bad (we figured it out, the shower is nice, the bed decent), the thing that makes this a bad experience is the staff. The check in took some 15 minutes, questions are looked upon with a frown, answer make no sense, greetings are not done etc. The folks in the restaurant (breakfast is an unbelievable 26 euros a person, and it is nothing special) say good morning, but that is about it... Some new staff could actually make this a nice hotel... Oh, and the TV is total crap... Very much geared to Italians (you will see BBC News, CNN for most of your stay unless you speak Italian).

Reviews.Title: “Unmoved!!”
Reviews.Author: steviebhoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from boxing day till the 29th as a christmas treat to my girlfriend and to be perfectly honest it was nothing special!if your lookin for special then dont go here!if however you want a reasonable base(although have to admit i was slightly wary of my surroundings outside the hotel,few dodgy characters around)this hotel is in absolutley no way the worst in rome there is worse but theres also much much better!not a good place for the first timer in rome! P.S the staff are really unhelpfull!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: travelbug151
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson in March 2005 not having read reviews on this website and was surprised to discover the number of poor reviews it has received. I found the staff to be helpful and polite. The room was comfortable and clean had lots of modern touches. On the first night we were disappointed to find that there was no hot water in our room so we complained and an engineer was sent up to check it out but we were told it was a problem with the area not the hotel, the next day we found a fruit basket and chocolates in our room to make up for it. The hotel is quite a way from the centre of Rome which may not appeal to everyone, but we found some lovely restaurants nearby and the metro is only 5 mins walk away. Overall I found the hotel to be just right for a weekend break, just bear in mind the open plan nature of the bathroom when deciding who to share with!

Reviews.Title: “great place for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: elh11
Reviews.Content: went here with my boyfriend in january for his 18th birthday. i've got to say that the reviews i've read have been far too harsh! we stayed in a superior room on the 2nd highest floor and the view just from our balcony was amazing, so i'm sure the view from the rooftop pool must really be spectacular, but we didn't go up there. admittedly the location isn't beautiful and when you think you're going to a 5* hotel it's a little confusing that it's in such an industrial area. however, the archaeological remains in the lobby are nice to see and the staff served us immediately. they were polite and helpful, giving us a map of rome with all the sites on. the cleaners walked in but once i said 'non grazie' they apologised and left, no problems there. the bathroom was a little intimate but the open plan layout of the room was really nice and our room, like all the others looked out onto the pretty courtyard. we ordered room service twice on the first day - delicious food and when they brought up the wrong dessert they didn't charge us for either of them. also just round the corner from termini station (one of the main stations in rome). we really enjoyed our stay and being so close to the station we were able to travel round the whole city - we even saw the Pope giving Mass. all in all we were very impressed and although the hotel was in a bad area (but still convenient) we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mo81
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson for 5 nights in November with my fiance and loved it. I really don't understand why it keeps getting negative reviews. We checked in about 11 pm and the staff where very friendly and helpful, we had a problem with the key and getting into our room at first but this was sorted out immediately. It has a cool design and the rooms are very comfortable. The selection of breakfast available is very tasty and extensive and again the serving staff were friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and warm, which it would have to be considering it was Nov. The shower was a little strange as it was open and tends to soak the whole floor but this didnt really bother me as I hate hotel shower curtains etc so this felt a lot more hygenic. Don't be put off by the location, once you come out of the hotel you are literally 2 mins from Termini and once inside it is about a 5min walk to the metro and shopping centre part of the station. I would definately stay here again and recommend the hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there ... or you will regret it badly !”
Reviews.Author: Arnaud92
Reviews.Content: The obvious aim of this hotel is to look cool but it is anything but cool ... a crappy lobby with a cheap ikea look, an inefficient check-in, dirty lifts at all time of the day, an awful location near Termini Station (one of the worst in the Rome ... even if for being honest, you are just in front of the railway station with trains going to the airport), a tub in the middle of the room with water either freezing or boiling, not an outlet anywhere available for personal use, so you will need to unplug an appliance. Additionnally expect time for finding a way to open you door room (not the usual card ...of course!), to switch off all the lights, and even more difficult to keep the heater switch on during the night ... So be aware that you will have a very, very bad stay if you persist to choose this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: galby
Reviews.Content: I was considering cancelling my reservation to this hotel and I'm glad I didn't. I stayed for 3 nights and found it a great place to stay. Checked in and out within minutes, help with my case to my room and shown how all the lights etc work. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were nice and clean. If you leave by the back door to the hotel you are just across the street from the termini where you can get a daily bus ticket for 4 euros and you can get a train directly to FCO airport in 30 mins for just over 9 euros. Local restaurants are located nearby and serve beautiful food for great prices. I dont understand why so many people haven't liked this hotel but I really liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there”
Reviews.Author: SamGG
Reviews.Content: This was the second night of our honeymoon and it was a very bad experiance. 1 hour to check in for some reason that we still don't understand. Our first room was like an ice box and it was only after 3 calls to reception that we got a room with heating. We later found out that the Aircon in one wing was not working but we had still been put into that wing. The next day when we left half an hour to check when the room had been paid off.

Reviews.Title: “What a change”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time I have been in this hotel in October 2003 and it was a completely disaster. Now I decided to come back because my wife loves the design, and what a positive change. Now the hotel is extremely clean and the staff extremely helpfull and organized, and the hotel now seems to me AN HOTEL. I can see that being now an international brand the staff know what to do, I reccomend to visit this fantastic hotel, yes the location is not great but very convinient as just near by the central station. B.D.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever, horrible service and quality, not 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: crazyyankee
Reviews.Content: Worst Hotel Ever! Avoid at all costs....service was horrible, the place was dirty and falling apart. Very cheaply made using cheap furniture that looks like ikea stuff. Beware of the crappy location as well because it is not near anything except the train station. I switched hotels on my second leg of the trip and had a much much better time. For the record, i stay at hotels across the world regularly and this is NOT a 5 star hotel at all! Was a total rip off....i felt cheated and scammed after staying at radisson sas.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere, this is not worth your time or money!”
Reviews.Author: Joizee_HD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of a corporate conference and had the pleasure of having my bill taken care of. I am so happy about this because I would be absolutely steamed were I to have paid the bill myself. In respect to my host, I technically shouldn't complain, but I travel enough to be able to compare this to other experiences. The place is definately nice in terms of design and it is the basic "design-style" hotel. Actually I am kind of tired of this style of hotel as they are all the same and generally cold and impersonal. Anyway, here's what I disliked. The service is horrible. Outside of being non-responsive and generally slow, no one speaks much besides Italien. The saying "when in Rome, do as the Romans" must refer directly to this. English, German, etc. are definately very foreign languages to the majority of the staff. I also found the set-up of the hotel inconvenient. It really kind of is a pain to walk around and it could be better. The rooms are relatively small and some have the shower in the middle of the room, where getting things wet isn't all too difficult. I was lucky enough to have the room with the tub, but it too was odd. The breakfast room I do have to say though is nice as is the pool area and balcony outside the bar area. Further, I didn't find the Termini area all that bad but it definately is not somewhere you're going to spend time hanging out. I was lucky enough to have a room not disturbed by train noise but a lot of others complained about this. All in all, you can do much better in Rome. I won't ever be returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: epolaris6
Reviews.Content: After reading many negative reviews, I can only come to the conclusion that I was either very lucky or did not go looking for problems. The twin room was very clean, larger than I expected. The tub was huge, the shower worked fine (lots of pressure and hot water.) The beds were comfortable with bright white linens. My aching feet appreciated the soft-ish floors (what was that, padding?) after walking so much each day. Loved the cute little toiletries. As for the service, I happen to like a laid-back, no need for small talk approach, although the reception was very cordial. Check-in was very quick and our bags reached the room before we did. Did not have much time to use the pool or try the restaurants, but did have breakfast once. A little pricey, but lots of good food. It was a very pleasant way to start the day. I noticed there were lots of community areas to sit and have a drink and enjoy the views. Just never found the time for it. I'll admit that I got a really good rate - $210 a night, even less than many 3 star hotels in Rome. Next time I go to Rome, I will definitely try to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for younger guests”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews before our trip we were "prepared" for some of the issues raised by other reviewers. However, on arrival, received very good service at reception, we were able to check in at 9am. Our room was as we had expected, very modern, it's true to say that we were looking for problems and had to report a couple of things ( broken TV remote and toilet seat, plus the elusive DVD player) Reception told us they are no longer supplied and we pointed out it is advertised both in the in room info and the website but I doubt anything will be done to change this! The pool area was fabulous very chilled and again, we received excellent service. Dinner in the Hotel was again excellent although we were only one of two couples dining so the room was lacking in atmosphere. The area around Termini is not great, but I had no issues at all with personal safety and it made travelling easy. The facilities are a little rough around the edges but none of this affected the enjoyment of our stay. I think if you are young enough to be influenced by the quirky design and "cool" atmosphere then you are able to overlook these points but older guests may not agree. One point - the music played in the Hotel was great - but by the end of the week I knew the CD off by heart - perhaps invest in some more music! Overall I had an excellent holiday and would recommend this Hotel to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Roman Ruin in the Making”
Reviews.Author: Fife_Flyer
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Hotel Torino earlier on our trip July 05 we arrived at the Radisson full of expectation. After a 4.5 hour train journey from Venice all we wanted was to collapse on the bed. This took longer than expected. The too few staff at reception were slow, very arrogant and not very welcoming. When we finaly got our key and went up to the room, we got a surprise when we found the room already occupied! Back to reception to find one half of the couple arguing that the room they had (which we were allocated) was not what he had booked. We were offered a smoking room instead which we accepted and seemed to be of a higher standard anyway. However as other reviewers have mentioned, the trendy design proves to function less well than it looks. The light control pod between the bed headrests was broken, one light didn't work, the glass bath/shower door didn't open fully and the hand spray attachment didn't work. Oh and yet another hotel that has single matresses making up a double bed! The air conditioning was also too loud to have it on at night and if the window was opened we were kept awake by screeching train brakes. When the rest of Rome was scortching in one of the hottest summers on record the unheated pool could only manage to reach a feeble 23 deg Celcius. Very dissapointing. In all the Hotel location, presentation and service leave a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, rough Location, staff need more personality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was lovely if not a little too quirky & modern! the shower in the middle of the room took a little getting used to but grew on us! We loved the Pool on the roof and the whole environment was very airy and relaxing. As a gym addict i always look for a hotel with a gym and the hotels fitness suite was above average. The area is not the best but I had already read this, we still managed to walk to the Coloseum in 15 minutes. The main thing letting the service level down was the lack of personality of the staff. Dont get me wrong they were attentive and plentiful, they just did not crack a smile very often. A cheerfull barman or waiter is always nice and makes a difference. Other than that I would go back without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious and Falling Apart”
Reviews.Author: steve23
Reviews.Content: The Radisson SAS was pretentious in its design, so were the staff who serve you and the wierdos who come and stay here. The novelty factor of the Scandanavian minimalist design wears off when you realise that nothing in your room is functional - it would be a nightmare to stay for more than one night. The first room i was given on the 3rd floor had tatty furniture - although the concierge said it was not possible they had only been open for 10 months - but trust me the shower had so much lime scale and mould on it, the shwoerhead was barely visible- they showed us another room on the 4th floor which had cigarette burns in the bath tub - then after not accepting their 2nd offer they showed us the 6th floor room - which was better and not tatty and had its own balcony, i think they reserve the 6th floor for guests they like or think are important, but even then none of the rooms i went in had a DVD or CD player, neither did they have any champagne glasses just 2 tumblers. We were lucky we didnt get the room overlooking the train station. The restuarant although good was expensive - as evidenced by the fact that only 4 other guests were dining the night we did, the portion were quite small too, the night was spoiled by the kitchen staff cheering and making a racket and jumping in the luxury roof top swimming pool at the end of their shift at 11.30pm fully clothed smelling of the kitchen - there were at least 15 kitchen staff at the end of the night and i doubt very much given their general laziness, and hygiene standards in the rooms that they cleaned that pool in the morning. Oh yes the cleaner did knock at 4pm asking whether we needed fresh towels but did seem suspicious as she is known to let herself take what she wants from your belongings. The only good thing about this place is the pool which you could visit whilst as a guest elsewhere - there are much better 5* hotels elsewhere in rome - this place should be downgraded immediately, i am minded to write to Radisson HQ to alert them to the delapidating condition of one of their supposed 5* hotels.

Reviews.Title: “BE WARNED”
Reviews.Author: Lex59
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels all over the world and to be very honest I have never stayed in such a horrible place in my life. Yet another Scandinavian failed attempt at being cool. It is anything but cool, it is impractical, inconvenient and poorly designed. Your shower looks like a giant laundry bag in the middle of the room with a pseudo-scandinavia flooring. The water goes all over the room and I am a short person and can barely shower in it let alone if I needed to shave my legs or something. It was just the worst experience I have ever had. Lights have a mind of their own, and there is not an outlet anywhere available for your personal use, you will need to unplug an appliance. the toilet spits everytime you flush it, it is just heinous. I read these reviews and said to myself it could not be so bad and that I would try it....BE WARNED DO NOT TRY THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Words of Warning in Rome”
Reviews.Author: overtime
Reviews.Content: Time to have a moan..... When we arrived we thought it was quite convenient the hotel being alongside the train station, until night. We were so close we could hear the trains and the announcments all night. I did not feel safe walking back to the hotel at night as it is like at all big cities. The area around the major train station is dodgy and really smells. The double bed was infact 2 single mattresses on a double base so I kept falling in between them. I could hear when the people in the room next to us were having a shower or flushing the toilet. Oh and the advertised gown and slippers... I dont think so, we didnt even get toothpaste (I've been to 2 star hotels that give you toothpaste, forget 5 stars) I would suggest to any travellers to Rome rather stay closer to the Spanish steps, Trevi fountain (That area) in a 3/2 star hotel as you will feel safer when coming home at night and its closer to the main attractions. Rome is great, I cant wait to go back........but definatley not to the SAS Raddison

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DawesFamily
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3nt stay and I have to say I don't recognise any of the reviews that have slated this Hotel. From the moment we checked in we were dealt with in a courteous and efficient manner with additional information voluntered without asking to make our stay more pleaurable. We were asked if this was our first stay in Rome and I said it was as we had come to celebrate our 3rd wedding anniversay he said 'we'll have to do something special' and after arriving in our bedroom, room service arrived with a huge gooey chocolate cake and bottle of mineral water beautifully served with the compliments of the Hotel - Brilliant! Our room was excellent on the 6th floor overlooking the courtyard with a balcony - the gadets were great fun although the room didn't have a hifi or dvd but this didn't matter at all. Our snack on the poolside was excellent I had a club sandwich which was huge and my wife had a salad again huge and service was very quick and courteous and reasonably priced too. Breakfast was included in our package and was equally as substancial - general location ideal and will definately recommend and stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellently located! Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: trinity2104
Reviews.Content: I am pleasantly surprised at the latest two bad reviews for this hotel as I'm assuming the reviewers stayed at the hotel when my boyfriend and I were there. Although, I must admit I haven't checked my credit card bill yet! When you get to Termini Station, please don't walk all the way to the end of the platform, you'll just end up lugging your baggage all the way back! Get out at the exit in the middle and the hotel is directly infront of you! On getting there, we arrived at 12:30 and was informed that there were no rooms available. After reading the reviews, I must admit, I'd expected this so wasn't too shocked! We were told to come back at 2pm. We'd left our baggage at the reception, we had absolutely no problem with this as plenty of other guests have done exactly the same thing! However, on the first day, we made the mistake of exploring the backstreets at Termini - it's not the best place to start a holiday, so do please give this a miss! On our return at 2pm, we were asked whether we would prefer a quiet courtyard room - what was the alternative, I have no idea! The room was beautiful!! it was much larger than anticipated and we had such fun over the controls by the bed!!! The shower was certainly eye opening, although by the end of the first night, we weren;t so keen on getting our feet wet every time we went to the loo (the shower room, toilet, sink, bday is all in one room with no shower curtain!) The best thing about this hotel is the location, don't come back from your days sightseeing through the backstreets. Get a bus from whereever you are back to Termini station and walk down the main road beside the station back to the hotel. On the last day, we checked out at 12pm with absolutely no fuss at all! Overall, our room was cleaned everyday and towels replaced! Although, we did have one incident on the last day when the maid walked into the room when we were still sleeping and then promptly walked out! Overall, EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “Check your credit card bill when you get back home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The bedrooms of this hotel are described as ‘minimalist’ and this was certainly the case for the front desk service which we found to be particularly slow and inefficient. On checking out, we were re-charged for our room - despite pre-paying when we booked on the web. We did not sign the first (incorrect) credit card slip but this transaction still appeared on our bill when we got back home. Although the transaction appeared to have been refunded, this was at a less favourable exchange rate so we had to chase this up through our bank. The service at the poolside bar on the roof was even worse - how difficult could it be to order two snacks and two drinks and get what you asked for within a timeframe of 45 minutes? Despite only being a couple of years old the décor and fittings are starting to look pretty rough and you tend to get the impression that it was built on the cheap with the sole purpose of winning a design award. The bedrooms are certainly interesting, though certainly not a good idea if you are intending to stay for more than a couple of nights due to the lack of hanging space and overall size. As for the 5* rating, this truly beggared belief and sparked several theories. The location is handy for Termini station and the Spar shop, as already pointed out, but little else besides.

Reviews.Title: “wrongly advised”
Reviews.Author: franz71
Reviews.Content: My partenr and I booked for a 5 day-stay in the hotel due to the way they advertised their premises...5 star hotel, with DVD and hi-fi inside the room, to the point that I have joined their mailing list. To our surprise, we arrived at 14:30, the room was not ready yet. We have to go the roof top where the pool was, which I admit was quite relaxing though small for a 5 star, and the room was ready by 16:00. Again, to my surprise, no DVD and hi-fi which I specifically requested. The main reception said that they are under new management. I explained that I appreciate that, however, they should not advertise that they have DVD player and hi-fi inside their rooms, since this is one way of "robbing" their guests. No one apologise for the inconvenience this has caused us. Thus, we decided to transfer to another hotel on the remaining 4 days of our holiday. By the way, I am on my early 30s and my partner is on his early 20s...so it does not mean that the hotel will be more appreciated by younger ones. Will never stay there ever again!!

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend-trip at the Radisson hotel in Rome, and me and my boyfriend LOVED it! We arrived by train at the termini station and had to walk a 100m to the hotel (you have to take the exit aside from the station, not the main exit!!). We arrived at the hotel at 10 am. The staff was really helpfull!! They took our bagage and were very welcoming. We were expecting to have to wait for a room till 2 pm, but no, we got our room immediately and it was great! All white and clean, with a seperate bathroom. Having breakfast with an ausumn view over the city was wonderful! We also loved the pool with its lounge-bar. The hotel is not in the city centre but we did everything by walking. One day, we took the metro to go to the Vatican, and that costed 1 €. At night, we did not eat at the hotel, went by taxi to the piazza navona. that costed 8 €. Overall, we loved our stay in the hotel and we would certainly go back!! We didn't understand all the negative comments here, altough we think younger people will more appreciate the hotel.. The whole hotel is so exlusive, the staff the most friendly and helpfull we've ever met and the pool the coolest we'd ever seen. LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pretty much agree with all the recent reviews here. It was in an annoying location (a long walk to the front of the termini station). The reception staff were unhelpful, unwelcoming and sooooo slow, and we didn't have a cd & dvd player in our room as advertised on their literature. The icing on the cake was when the maid stole some money from our room (on two consecutive days!) apparently thinking it was a tip - it was pounds sterling, only the pound coins were picked up, and she'd taken it halfway through our stay - yeah, a tip - right. The front desk manager was unapologetic, rude and blamed us for leaving money out! It took a lot of arguing to finally get the money taken off our bill. On the good side, the pool was lovely, our room was cool & clean, loved the TV, the bed was really comfy, and the shower was great. Oh, and the spar opposite came in very handy! Not really a five-star hotel - the service was utterly atrocious.

Reviews.Title: “Not for those looking for a 5* experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is for sure a mediocre 3-4 star hotel in a one star area. On the plus side, my room (once I had swapped it for a twin that I had originally booked for the double that I was allocated on arrival) was spotlessly clean and the air conditioning most welcome. The pool also proved a hit after a days sightseeing, though trying to interrupt the staff chatting amongst themselves long enough to order a drink is another story. Now the downside- One has to rely on taxi's for sure in the evenings as the hotel is in an area which is a magnet for undesirables, tho from what I saw, most handy for catching a train and buying the odd provision from the nearby Spar shop. Queing at the checkout with the stations wino's is quite an experience. The es. Libris bar is a law unto itself (waited with my daughter for a sign of life but ended up getting a drink from the above mentioned Spar shop) as is check-in. Although we waited in the most bizarre queing system we where eventually checked in by a friendly and apologetic chap. Breakfast there was a huge mistake and we waited 25 minutes for the egg and sausage (?) '' servers'' to be refilled. Luckily upon bill inspection they had not added on breakfast. Phew. If you want a breakfast, walk up the road to Tuddini's on the Via Filipo Turrati as we did for the remaining 4 days. Another tip, if you want extra towels, request them the day before and forget the wake up call. This was a most unusual experience. I will most certainly be revisiting Rome, but will not stay at The Radisson SAS again and I'm afraid I cannot recommend it. Forgot to mention that while my elderly mother was resting in her room, two burly security guards barged right in thinking we had checked out two days into a five days stay without even apologising. That was the icing on the cake for me when no one at reception seemed to give a damn.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good At All!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: NOT A FIVE STAR!!!!! I spent 4 nights there in July and can tell you that this is not to the level of regular 5 stars in Europe. I took 2 hours (YES TWO!!!!!) to get our room when we checked in at 2pm!!!! Excuse room wasn't ready as they allow for late check out from previous customers!!!! Courtesy drink to help us wait??? YEAH RIGHT.... went to the roof terrace (the only major plus point of this hotel) to get some refreshments, the service was terrible, we had to wait up to 20' for a beer!!!! And they had 10 staff running around like headless chicken!!!! for 20 tables!!!! The elevators and incredibly slow and annoying. The cleaners walk in your room even when you shout 'NO' or 'WAIT' (obviously some very complicated words to learn for anyone working in an internaltional hotel.....). What looks like clean line design is actually very grey and boring and very poorly finished. The lobby actually looks like a funeral home. Check out was on the same poor level: Had to wait for 20' to get someone to attend, and the bill was wrong. Considering the very poor location of the hotel, you would think they would try to make up for it with good service and a smile, but no... Quite the opposite.... VERY VERY DISAPPOINTING...

Reviews.Title: “It does what it says on the tin...”
Reviews.Author: Parrot3333
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during July and it was lovely - it is just like the pictures. The Staff help where they can and its immaculate. Its a nice relaxed place and its as its so spacious you've got your own space. The toilet/bathroom arrangements aren't as weird as they looked (i was worried before i went) but with no lock on the toilet door and a bit of a gap in the shower curtain i wouldn't go with someone you don't trust! All in all, a fab hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Radission: not what you expect from a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Radisson in Rome in the middle of July. First impressions are that you are staying in a car park, as the hotel is adjacent to a multi-storey and looks out on the main train lines going into Termini, so even with double glazing the rooms facing the tracks are not quiet. Moreover, the surrounding area is very down-at-heel and not the sort of area that a woman on her own would wish to go through to get to a hotel. You wander into a large airy foyer and go to reception. Whilst there were 3 staff on reception it still took about 15 minutes before anyone dealt with us and then they seemed to have the most complicated procedures which took a further 5-10 minutes. (We had booked and paid in advance!). In addition we were told that breakfast was included only to discover on the last day that it was not included and we had to pay 25 euros per person for breakfast (and the breakfasts were not worth it!). This added insult to injury as, on the penultimate day, I had to ask 3 times for a cappuccino which finally came after some 20 minutes wait. Likewise we gave up waiting for anyone to take our order one evening and went elsewhere for a drink. On the positive side it has a nice roof-top pool and the rooms are clean and air-conditioned. However, all in all it was very poor value for money, the location is undesirable, and the staff have no idea about customer service. I would not stay here again as there were clearly better 5 stars in Rome than this.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: manchesterexplored
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of mixed reviews about this place before, some absolutely fantastic and others rather damning! I loved it! When we arrived at the hotel, they didn't have any of the superior rooms we'd booked ready for occupation. So, shock horror, they had to upgrade us to a junior suite. When the guy on reception asked if this was ok, i had to fight a massive grin breaking out and managed to reply calmly that this would be fine. When we got out of the lift (there are five or six) on our floor we realised how trendy this place was. The lights were dimmed and the number on each door iluminates to indicate whether the occupants are in. This means you won't get bothered by cleaners if you decide to sleep in. The room looked like it had just been plucked from a style magazine and was certainly very spacious. Everything can be worked by a control centre by the bed. We spent ages winding things up and down and finding new gadgets to play with. The jaquizzi bath is really powerful and big enough for 2! Don't do what we did and put the bubble bath in.
