We nearly had a foam explosion! The minibar is not cheap, but that's the norm with these knid of places. And now for the icing on the cake, the roof! There's a good sized pool and a smaller one for the kiddies. These are both surrounded by sun loungers where the beatiful people tan themselves. At one end of the pool is the bar which is a sight in itself. Surrounded by white tub chairs and tables, it's looks like a set from a music video! It's a about 6 euros for beer and around 28 euros for a bottle of good wine. Champagne is 50 euros. Late afternoon/ early evening they set up a complimentry buffet on the bar which we found sufficient as a meal one night. We weren't trying to save the pennies, it's just we didn't want to leave the bar! At the side of the pool is a lovely restaurant, we ate here one night and it cost us 100 euros but was worth every penny. I had rabbit and my boyfriend had lamb, they were both delicious. The location isn't the best in Rome but it's within walking distance of the coleseum etc... One word of warning: make sure they call you a taxi when leaving, do not get in one of the mercs outside. It cost us 70 euros to the airport. Saying this, it was a lovely car and probably worth it. If somebody offered me a free hotel in Rome, I would still pay to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Cath_1975
Reviews.Content: So the breakfast is expensive- but if you are looking for a special hotel with fantastic and fun design pluss an outdoor pool with a view- this is it!!! Trendy, cool and centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: saintfieldabu
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the radisson in rome as part of a 10th wedding anniversary trip. Looked cool on the website. Check in took 20 minutes and the queue management was atrocious as people appeared from everywhere to jump to the desk first. That night we were cleared away from the pool area as it was being used for a 'prior engagement'...some sort of function...nothing was mentioned at time of booking. So didn't get use of pool - reason why we booked that place. Room (we'd booked a superior room)was clean, small, trendy but overlooked Termini station (not the ideal view)...and we were astounded that breakfast was not included and so would cost another 19 euro each (two nights was already costing us 400 euro!!). It's handy to the station but that's all...a long walk from the city centre through dark streets to get back at night. All in all way overpriced and staff are uninterested at best. No one at any stage asked if everything was alright. Save your money and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Breakfast Buffet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I should begin by saying that the Radisson is a great hotel with mostly great staff. The one complaint I had was that when we checked in at 6:30 AM the front desk staff told us that we could go up and have breakfast while we waited for our room to be ready. However, what he did not say was that the breakfast buffet costs 25 euro per person per day. My friend and I had a 75 Euro breakfast bill when we checked out! I don't think there is any breakfast that is worth 25 Euro. When I checked the website, some rooms include the breakfast buffet, but many didn't. Take it from me, make sure to ask how much that breakfast buffet is before you sit down and eat!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: itspog
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel but some of the fixtures are starting to fray at the edges with the rooms needing some refreshing, that said it is funky and there are lots of gizmos to play with. The bath/showers are excellent and the toilets more discreet then some of the reviews suggest. If you get the Leonardo Express from the airport and go down the steps at the end of the platform (there is a lift) and turn left you are 20 metres from the rear entrance of the hotel, how convienient is that! The imeadiate area is abit scruffy but nothing scary. We were there when it was 38 degrees this week and the 7th floor pool and bar is both stunning and a life saver, the price of a beer is the same as in most bars in Rome so not the rip off in some similar hotels. All in all a good package and we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Standard!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in May 2005 while honetmooning. The room was excellent standard and very modern. The hotel services and staff were very helpful and the hotel pool on the roof was a nice escape from the hustle and bussle of Rome after a long day sightseeing. Its very close to the main train station and there is a metro station just a 2 minute walk away that saves you having to go to the main crowded stop. Would use this hotel again if we go back to rome.

Reviews.Title: “If You Like Mod You Must Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: yuhi
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! It is what it is, a very modern, sleek, stylish, minimal hotel that will NOT cater to all travelers, that is those seeking an overstuffed, corporate cookie-cutter hotel room with pattern crazed decor. Public spaces are expansive and creatively furnished, my standard room well layed out with luxury touches, cool gadgets and a huge soaking tub with logical shower. Staff was friendly, courteous and responsive, a call to check my CD player was answered and repaired in minutes, and a non-working room key replaced on the spot with TWO keys. The exercise room and spa area are more typical of a resort, and the top floor outdoor bar was the perfect space to entertain friends, what a view! Stayed for 4 very hot Roman days (5/27-5/31) and the rooftop pool came in very handy. Yes, the surrounding area is not the Champs Elysees, but it is incredibly handy for all modes of public transportation. Plus if adventurous there are a few local bars/eateries worth visiting, especially to watch local foot traffic at night. I have recommended this place to everyone I know. The Radisson SAS will be my home in Rome on all future trips. MS-Chicago IL

Reviews.Title: “a convenient, cool and stylish haven!”
Reviews.Author: romire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson SAS Rome for 3 days (31 May - 3 June) before our cruise and were so pleased with our choice! The location is so convenient - a few steps from the Termini where the Leonardo Express trains from the airport arrive, the Metro and the double decker tourist buses. The hotel is cool, calm, stylish and elegant. After a hot and noisy day touring the hectic streets and sights of Rome, the ethereal music filling the lobby was most welcoming. Best of all, the roof deck with a pool, bar and restaurant overlooking the city was the perfect place to decompress and refresh - a haven! The staff was professional and helpful - calling taxis and making restaurant reservations. The rooms are fun and full of gadgets and switches, with soft and fluffy bedding and nice toiletries. I really don't understand any of the negative reviews about this hotel - as a jaded New Yorker I really enjoyed it! The hotel is not located in the most elegant part of town and perhaps that can be off-putting for those of the "Holiday Inn mentality" - but anyone with any bit of city savvy and a willingness to embrace the Roman experience will be cooling their feet in the pool with a Camapari and soda and say "aaaahhh...".

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay in Rome !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent a wonderful weekend with my wife in Rome (3-6 june) This hotel was exactly what we were looking for. We loved it. Don't know what people dislike about this location: it's literally (!) 20 steps away from the terminal of the Leonardo Express which connects FCO airport with the city in 30 minutes. From the hotel, it's 2 minutes walk to metro or taxi... although as already said in other comments: in Rome you can do everything by foot. Some 4-5 star hotels seem to think that marble reception desks and gold plated toilet seats are an expression of good taste or style... Nothing like that in this hotel: see pics attached. It's a bit expensive, but what isn't in Rome? Staff are friendly and helpful.... We will return there for our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A modern, stylish hotel out of place with its surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Adrianv
Reviews.Content: The pictures provided on this hotel's website looked amazing and for once were acually an accurate representation. Our room was extremely stylish and modern and looked much better than the abundance of dirty, traditional hotels in Rome. The variety of electrical features and quirky furniture in the room was impressive. We had dinner in the restaurant during our stay and were treated like royalty. In fact, all of the hotel staff, particularly the waiters, were extremely polite and helpful. Overall we felt the hotel offered very good value for money in all aspects except for it's location. It is in a rather seedy area and it is quite a long walk to the central attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Trippy Hotel, awful location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Liked the room, hated the location. Be warned, you will have absolutely no privacy if you are sharing a room with someone. Also, walls were paper thin. We could hear everything going on in the room next to us. The location is awful - right next to the termini train station. The streets around it are covered with graffiti. The staff was helpful. The business center consisted of a computer and temperamental printer on a folding table in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Forgetful, unhelpful and lazy staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Now I am no hotel snob but at the very least you expect some kind of service, especially at a 5 star hotel. The hotel itself is quite modern and funky but it is seriously let down by the incompetence of its staff. 1. On our first day, we ordered a couple of drinks by the pool and they forgot 3 times and we waiting 45 minutes and we received no apology, the bar wasn't even busy. 2. We visited the hotel bar in the evening and again ordered drinks, waited about 20 minutes in a quiet bar and when asking the staff where the drinks were, they said they had problems and it would be another 10 minutes - why couldn't they have told us instead we sit there like dummies. 3. And to top it all off, we could not find laundry bags so took some trousers to reception to send for ironing, they wouldn't take them and sent us back upstairs to look for laundry bag which we still couldn't find so we went to Reception again to ask could they leave a note for the housekeeper but they wouldn't. On the last night, I wrote a complaint and left at Reception for Hotel Manager and nobody contacted me to apologise and nothing was said when we checked out. The style of hotel is funky but it you actually want them to do anything forget it. We visited the Exedra for dinner and it was amazing, the staff were very nice to us and it made our holiday, it doesn't take much. I would never stay at this hotel again and would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Come with expectations in mind”
Reviews.Author: PackerCraft
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site since December when I booked our tickets, I hoped that I was prepared for the trip. Collectively, this site told me to expect: Small but unique rooms, high prices at the restaurant, somewhat slow service, a downtrodden area surrounding the hotel, but most of all a unique experience. My expectations, and those of my wife, and her sister and husband were fulfilled -- we knew what we were getting into. We prepared as such -- packing light, eating out at every meal (there are entirely too many great restaurants and cafes in Rome not to!), being patient, and briskly moving through and around the Termini and staying away from the street vendors. I've never stayed at a hotel quite like this one. It's urban, funky and cool -- there was an Italian feature film shoot going on when we arrived. Most of the experiences are unique to oridinary hotel stays, from the entirely black-clad staff, to the minimalistic furniture and room design to the pulsating house music that permeated the lobby and common areas. The entire time you feel engaged in an ambiance that can't quite be duplicated elsewhere in Rome. We visited many other local hotels --- all were of the overstuffed, luxury variety -- and somewhat "ordinary fare" for this city. Although it's certainly not 5-star material, there's a uniqueness to it that cannot be duplicated. The hotel met my expectations because we were prepared. Thanks to all who submitted reviews.

Reviews.Title: “EXPENSIVE BUT GREAT FOR TRANSPORT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we expected the the worst after booking the hotel & seeing the reviews after . i must say i dont know what people expect these days! on arrival from fuminci airport via train .{dont use the taxis as very expensive} we approached the hotel on the left hand side . 2 minutes after leaving the train we are in reception with the attentive staff seeing to our baggage & locating our room . i would advise being at the front of the hotel or overlooking the court yard , not the termini side. 1 st comment of the hotel was the helpfulness of the staff .{nb this was fri 8th april 05 & was very busy due to the popes funeral} on arrival to our room our baggage was already in our room to be unpacked . nb do take lots of hangers as this is very minamilistic !! room was very nice & overlooking the neighbourhood . we only had breakfast in the room one day & drank in the bar on 2 occasions which was expensive, dont use the mini bar as 9 euro for small peroni beer ! only 0.89 cents in spar in termini . regarding the area we had no problems but i am sure it may be off putting for others being so close to the termini & less undesirables . the termini is great for seeing & getting about in rome , dont use any other transport .{apart from taxis at night for restaurants etc} also as it rained no stop for 3days it was a pleasure to use 1 euro for all parts of rome . dont miss eating & drinking in piazza novano square , watching performing artists {even better if the sun shines} for the old type pizzeria we ate at est est est {book though as busy with locals} 3 course meal with wine & beers unbeliveably 32 euro sat pm we ate at gusto , if you like traditional food pizza , pasta use the downstairs bar etc , more refined diners the 1 st floor restaurant . this was resonable at 75 euros for 2 courses & wine , but alot more upmarket . in short great stay , great hotel though will be in the need of an makeover shortly not 5 star good 4 star , good location {for transport}, nice staff , great city .

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: UKDavidS
Reviews.Content: If you are arriving into Termini Station from Fumicino Airport then if you look up and to you left as you arrive you will see the SAS Radisson sign. There is no need to trek all the way to the main station concourse to leave the station, take the first exit, it is dedicated to the trains that serve the airport, and you will exit directly opposite the hotel. (Walk up the ramp opposite the Spar). That is the easy bit, from then on it goes down hill. For our Easter break we were lucky to be allocated one of the sixth floor courtyard rooms which had a small balcony. However, you could still hear the announcements from Termini Station. For those overlooking the station, this could be intrusive. Unfortunately, it seems the area around the hotel is home to many of the city's undesirables and this can seem a little threatening. There is no way ths hotel warrants a five star rating. However, if the service was consistently good it could pass as a four star. It is an ultra modern and unusually styled hotel. The room was disappointingly small and hotel corridors very dark. There is no ensuite as such, a glass partition separates the bed from the wash basin and the shower is also in the main room, separated by a shower curtain. The toilet is separated by a frosted glass partition through which you can still see everything! Be sure that you know intimately the person you are staying with - not a place (or area) to take your mother! One night after a busy days touring, we decided to try room service - what a mistake. When the order was brought to our room it was completely wrong. I got a (very small) portion of unremarkable lasagne with stale bread. When my partners correct meal finally arraived the burger was cold and uncooked in the middle - I asked if they were trying to kill us from food poisoning!. The ultra modern styling of this hotel is let down by the hit and miss service and unfortunate location. I would not consder staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and fresh”
Reviews.Author: JacquiStAlbans
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending the Easter weekend here and have to say that some other of the reviewers either had an unlucky experience or are just misserable! Having arrived on an early flight, we expected to have to wait till the afternoon for our room to be ready, especially on such a busy weekend. It wasn't a problem, we were greeted by a very welcoming bunch of staff and directed straight to our room, with a welcome message and panetonne cake in celebration of the weekend - nice touch! The rooms are pretty cool, it must be said. I do agree with some other reviewers in that there's not much privacy when you're in the shower, but didn't you look at the images of the hotel before you booked it - this is pretty obvious? Needless to say, my partner loved it! Light switchers and controls do take a bit of getting used to, but that's part of the fun - you wouldn't have them at home. It's worth taking a few spare hangers will you just in case you tend to pack too many bits of clothing that never get worn! Plenty of hidden drawers though, enough to store a long weekend's worth of clothing. I only hope that they maintain the hotel to the standard it is now - white walls in room could easily become scuffed and scruffy in no time. We only had lunch in the restaurant, but this was fab, no more expensive that some of the bars/restaurants we came across, which was a pleasant surprise. Didn't use the pool as the weather wasn't up to it, but it did look nice. Only main negative point is the location - but what do you expect from most cities? It's the equivalent of walking around Kings Cross in London, OK in the day but not in the evening. It was nice to come out of the centre after a day's sightseeing to an area that wasn't over-crowded by tourists. Saying that, all of the tourist sights can easily be reached by the metro in the Termini station or on foot. This is our second trip to this city (stayed at the Aleph 1st time which was v.v. nice!) and having done lots of the major sights first time around, we tried to check out the less well known tourist areas. I personally think that for a first timer, you should try to see the following: - Trastevere area: lots of local charm and restaurants were filled with locals which is always a good sign. The flea market around there on a Sunday isn't as great as the guidebooks say - Colosseum: take the guided tour or buy the audio guide for Euro 4 pp, you'll get lots more from doing this than just going there to have a look - the Vittoriano monument in Piazza Venezia, just up from the Colosseum: has the best views of Rome from the cafe, especially Ancient Rome - the Vatican: priceless You could get to see most of the sights very quickly, at a glance, but suggest spending at least a day at the areas listed above.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money”
Reviews.Author: Lovepets
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel the same time as "Good for Little" from London. Apparently, they got the only 4 tissues in the place because there were none in my room. We were also disturbed by the same party as the other reviewer. I was hoping that the modern decor would be fun and unique but it is really just an IKEA gone bad. Rooms were very annoying to use (lighting, bath fixtures) and my bathroom was not cleaned for 2 days. Very little privacy if you aren't rooming with someone you are intimately involved with. Hallways off the elevator were barely lit (yes-almost completely dark). The front desk (it was more of a Slinky draped with a bedsheet) staff were either unfriendly or downright rude. The only two positives were that the beds were comfortable and the restaurant staff/food were excellent. Unless you have a really good reason for staying near the train station, this is a poor and unsafe location. There are a zillion other hotels in Rome--stay in one of those instead.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Experience”
Reviews.Author: asdgjkdhjk
Reviews.Content: Location: Okay - the neighborhood is not great but I did not find it as scary as some other reviewers did. The hotel's location is very convenient the metro, airport bus, airport trains and national railways. There's actually some good and cheap places to eat nearby as well. Room: Very nice, clean, modern and minimalist - but not for the shy amongst you. The shower and washbasin are just behind the bed - separated from the rest of the room by a glass screen. The toilet is just behind separated by a frosted glass door....and if you overlook the courtyard - you better be prepared to be a bit of an exhibitionist. The rooftop restaurant and bar had good atmosphere and food, although it was expensive. The gym also seemed quite good. In summary a great place to spend a weekend with somebody you know quite well (if not- you're definitely going to get to know them better) with good service and friendly staff. The rooms however aren't ideal for people who aren't light travellers - as there is nowhere to put your clothes/suitcases. A nice experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 3/17/05 We just came back from an awesome vacation. We only have great things to say about this hotel. The staff, amenities and location were perfect. We loved that Termini train station was a 2 minute walk. We hopped on the train to go to the Vatican, Spanish Steps and other beautiful sights. Don't get us wrong we walked all over the city and took tours. It was just nice to know that we could mesh with the locals. The only thing we didn't like was the local cuisine, it was expensive and lacked flavor. Aside from that we would definately go back to Rome. Monica and Marc, Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Very Little”
Reviews.Author: Sooner in UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Radisson March 12 through the 15th, 2005. The hotel is in a very poor neighborhood -- one that is not very safe after dark. It is immediately across the street from Termini station so it is very convenient for day trips out of Rome. The rooms on the station side of the hotel suffer from noise from the station and the trams. All rooms suffer from poor design -- or inappropriate design. One might guess the hotel rooms were designed by an architect who has never stayed in a hotel, much less worked in a hotel room. The amenities in the rooms are very minimal -- four (yes count them, four) facial tissues, no closet (clothes hang on a rack in the room), strange lighting (requires special instructions), and no real seating other than on the bed and an odd lounge chair. The hotel evidently does not turn on the air-conditioning until summer, so the guest and conference rooms were uncomfortably warm. One could open the window to cool the room down some, but all exterior rooms are affected by street noise. The restaurant is okay, but nothing special and not a good value at all. On top of these systemic problems, we suffered through the noise of a party in the top-floor restaurant/bar on Sunday night that went to nearly 1AM. We complained to the front desk but they were not very sympathetic and not apologetic at all. The Radisson chain has brochures prominently displayed in their rooms promising full refund if not 100% satisfied. The Radisson Rome management acts like this does not apply to them, even though they have the brochure in their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Minimalist decor and a little spartan, but more than made up for in lots of ways: kind and helpful staff; less than 100 yards from the Fiumicino train arrival point (don't even consider any other form of transport); only a short distance from the metro (in a nearby square, closer than the main station, and easier to get onto when crowded); it is on the line to Vatican City, and a single change to the Colosseum; a local covered market for those who like such things (we do); useful local restarants (e.g. Stella Nuova); a supermarket just inside the nearest part of the station. A short walk to one of the main museums and other sights; and the view from the rooftop restaurant is great. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: fossildog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two night short break and just got back. Have to say we were put off slightly by some of the reviews but ignore all them as this place is EXCELLENT. The hotel is located right next to the Termini and yes the area is not the best BUT all of Rome is covered with grafitti (even some of the monuments we went to visit!), and the shops around are interesting, mostly Chinese owned shops selling cheap (copy) clothing. We did feel safe though and walked everywhere and never felt threatened or worried about the area. The Colloseum is a five minute walk away and the main shopping street about a 15 minute walk (or a 5 minute taxi ride if youre feeling lazy). The room was excellent. We had a standard room and everything worked really well. The shower was great and the bed one of the biggest I've been in. Nice mini-bar, great toiletries and flat screen TV with DVD player. Only slight misgiving was the toilet/bidet which was in a small frosted glass cubicle at the back of the room. Probably could have given a bit more privacy. Everything was spotlessly clean and I couldnt find fault with anything and Im very fussy. The electric blind worked well and even when it was up privacy was maintained with the linen curtain. We ate one night on the 7th floor restaurant and it was one of the best meals I have ever had. The setting was great with subdued lighting and attentive but discreet waiters. The food was some of the best Ive had and the way it was served was done with professionalism and flair. We skipped the entree and while waiting for our meal were brought complementary hors douvres like tempura flowers and the like which were gorgeous. It cost 80 euro all in including a nice bottle of wine which seemed cheap I thought as we were both full (try the celery ice cream for a real treat). Considering the vast majority of places to eat in Rome were the candle in a chianti bottle variety this place stood out (some use frozen not fresh food and mark these on the menu as such!!!) and I would highly recommend eating there if you can. Overall this hotel is a real experience. I have stayed in plenty of boutique style hotels around the world but this one stands out head and shoulders above the others. When you look at the price of hotels in Rome and the type of accomodation you get for your money this place makes you wonder how they can do it for such a low price. Next time I go to Rome or if anybody asks me where to stay I know I will recommend this place wholeheartedly (unless they are 60+, have trouble with remote controls, stylish interiors or no sense of adventure) :)

Reviews.Title: “Service & Style”
Reviews.Author: ghosteater
Reviews.Content: Arrived without having made a reservation on a cold and rainy saturday afternoon. Even though the hotel appeared to be fully booked, the gentleman at the reception found what I believe was the last available room for us. The standard room was just perfect - 25 sqm with a lovely bath and a lot of stylish features and accesoires.. eg. a lounge chair almost like the famous Eames "la chaise", and flatscreen TV with DVD/CD player. As one may expect in a five star hotel the place was perfectly clean and the staff was superb. The thing we enjoyed the most was breakfast. The large buffet (almost Vegas size ;-) ) on the 7th floor was great, there is no better place to start your day than with this view. I can highly recommend this unique cutting edge place !

Reviews.Title: “Very Euro”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights in the Radisson. It was very cool Euro in design and function; not charming and inviting as our other stays, but we handled the change up with ease. The front desk was helpful in arranging a tour of Rome by night upon our arrival. The restaurant was also very comtemporary with high prices; not exactly what we were looking for so we went elsewhere for meals. Based on our hotel stays in two other city visits, I would urge you to select a hotel with morning breakfast included. The location near the train station does have a couple of good positives, unlike some of the reviews. When we arrived in the afternoon from Florence by train, we were a two minute walk across the street to the Radisson. Yes, there is graffiti on the walls and all the other components around a train station, but each day after finishing our touring, we hopped on the Metro and were whisked back to the main termini. The best reason for the location is the ease with which you can get to the airport. Just buy a 9.50EUR express train ticket, and literally walk across one street, up an elevator and there's your departing train. 31 minutes later - you're at the airport. So, the Radisson does have its positive!

Reviews.Title: “Is it a begin of changing?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel early this month. It seems they changed from one management to a chain management of Radisson SAS. This seems to work, the staff is very helpful and proactive to all clients. we were there when they are having some works going on they say they have to update some rooms because of the bathrooms and so on. Generally the hotel is good and definitely I will come back both for business and vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ive ever Been too.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels throughout the US and north america. I normally stay at 4 or 5 star hotel. I honestly do not mind paying $300++ for top quality. Quite simply--this is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Location--Only negitive I had....which was also a positive. It is a 7 min walk from Rome Termini train station. If you are taking trains to go to any part Italy---it is extremely conveniant, as lines for taxi's are long at times. Also the Topless red tour buses meet there. Romes sites are rather hard reach by foot. Having these buses and the metro was very convientant. The only negitive comes from the fact that since it is soo close to the termini...the area directly surrounding is a bit seedy and smells like pee. ROOM---Simply gorgeous. Ultra modern...It seriously looks like magazine picture. The Shower layout..brilliant. remote control for all the rooms features on the bed. the sheets were like brand NEW---so white and smelled good(other european hotels--please take note) Hotel restaurnt/amenites--- One word---WOW! 5star by far!! The best and most expensive dinner I have ever had. The veiw was fabulous. I had my glass of water refilled every second sip. And the final sign of stupendous service---when I went to the washroom and returned--my napkin had been changed. The gym was actually decent...but dont expect Golds. It was too cold for the pool--but it looked very beautiful---though it may be small on a hot day with more than 50 people. Staff--Didnt really need them, but they seemed helpful and spoke english. Breakfast buffet---Expensive at 30euro....luckily included in the room rate. Ur normal fair...nothing special other than the nice fruit. Overall....tremendous value even at $250-300/night. I would have paid $500 night to stay there. If I ever return to rome--I will not chance another place.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is beautiful but think hard before you stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Aesthetically, the hotel was totally amazing and a great experience. BUT.... The room service was cold and spotty. They refused to print out room-dial phone rates, forcing us instead to ask for verbal rates from the concierge, who then lied to us and verbally quoted us rates that turned out to be a complete fantasy. We were stuck with a $250 bill for a couple of short calls. The pool was a nice touch, but it was not always open when we needed it. The Termini train station across the street from the hotel doesn't make much noise at night, but the neighborhood around it leaves something to be desired. If you stay at this hotel, you will need a taxi to and from everywhere else in Rome because there is no way you should walk around that neighborhood at night unless you speak Italian and like gypsies. You could probably get around there speaking Chinese, because the area doubles as Chinatown. It also doesn't make for a very nice view, so it's a good thing that my room faced into the courtyard. Like the hotel itself, most of the staff was very attractive, but a few of them were just plain offensive in their unwillingness to help. Overall, this is a nice alternative to overstuffed hotels like the Ritz Carlton, but the service and staff make you wonder if it's really worth all the pain.
